pads.content:
Greening the roofs of low-rise buildings
Greening of roofs of the buildings
(NGO “Pukhovichskiy Krai”)
A methodology for greening of the roof for 1-2
storeyed buildings was developed and piloted on
a real site in order to introduce this into practice of
low-rise urban buildings design and construction.
This was implemented within the framework of the
pilot initiative implemented in Pukhovichi district,
Minsk region, by NGO “Pukhovichskiy Krai” from
January 2015 to September 2017. The methodology
of Greening the roofs of the buildings is stipulated
in Annex 1 to this report. The accessible roof of
the greenhouse building of gymnasium No. 5 in
Maryina Gorka town, Puchovichi district, became
the pilot site.
As a result of the implementation of the pilot
initiative, the following was achieved:
- the existing greenhouse building was
examined;
- the concept for greening the roof of the
building was developed by a Polish expert;
- design estimates for the reconstruction of the
roof of the greenhouse building was developed;
- construction and installation works were
carried out to insulate the roof, organize the
drainage system, two irrigation systems, etc. A
typical extensive roof with an 18 cm. soil layer
was constructed with two irrigation systems (drip
and sprinkler), an automatic soil moisture control
system (when the level of moisture is optimal, the
irrigation system automatically turns off , in case
of rainy weather, irrigation systems are inactive),
a two-layer system drainage (drainage of surface
water and separate drainage of water absorbed
into the soil), a slight slope, perimeter fencing and
lighting, reinforcement of the roof deck, allowing
to carry load of 500 kg/m2 at the weakest point,
of which 200 kg/m2 – is the snow load. Thus, the
structural features of the roof allow it to be used
by a lot of people at the same time; however, the
plans of the Maryina Gorka gymnasium provide for
the presence of groups of up to 5 children on the
roof under the supervision of a teacher;
- specialists were trained in new green
technologies. 3 people were trained during a
study visit to the Republic of Poland in May 2016.
2 people introduced the fi rst green roof in the
Republic of Belarus at the 6th Moscow International
Garden and Flower Festival on 4-6 July 2017.
The methodic of greening and functioning of its systems was tested during Spring, Summer, and Autumn. In Winter the roof don't needs the snow removal.
The report on this innovation was broadcasted. Meet Sergei Zinkevich, the DIrector of Maryina Gorka Gimnasium, where the green roof is situated
you can contact Sergei Zenkevich through Facebook, he agreed to contact with AccLab enthusiasts
https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100032892362594
pads.title: Greening the roofs of low-rise buildings

pads.content:
Extracting facility for humic and fulvic acids for fertilizer production
Pilot processing facility by Vasyuhin technology in Cherven district, Minsk region on the basis of agricultural enterprise producing vermicompost (NGO “Belorusskiy Souyz Predprinimatelei”)
Within the pilot initiative, based on the technological process patented by the author and researcher Mr. V. Vasyuhin, a pilot unit for extracting humic substances from peat and sapropel and production of organic and mineral fertilizers based on humic and fulvic acids was designed, produced and piloted in the agricultural
farm. The organic and mineral fertilizers received passed laboratory tests and fi eld tests. The pilot initiative was implemented by the NGO “Belorusskiy Souyz Predprinimatelei” (Belarusian Union of Entrepreneurs)
The facility is produced on the basis of 20" marine container and is transportable via a truck to the place where the raw material is.
The raw matrerial is a compost, sapropeles, peat.
The technological process envisages for milling the liquid with special mill and absorbing of liquid which have the needed molecular mass.
Meet Viacheslav Vasiukhin, the patent holder, entrepreneur and inventor, He is avaliable through Facebook for contacting.
His company produces and supplies such facilities to enterprises that produces fertilizers for around 70 000 USD per one facility FOB Minsk.
This is a buckwheat seedlings of a similar age (3 weeks). Upper one - after applying humic and fulvic acid concentrate, lower one - without it (for comparison). The humic and fulvic concentrate gives explosive growth on the lower stages of seedling's life and makes plants stronger, which guarantees survival.
Applicable for any plant, including grain, vegetables, fruit trees.
pads.title: Extracting facility for humic and fulvic acids for fertilizer production

pads.content:
Security on streets!
Since certain neighborhoods in Guatemala City, are threatened by car thieves, particular persons in an informal way have managed to provide "a security service" in a spontaneous way. Most of them tend to be very friendly and get to know the people that demand parking space on streets. In exchange they accept an open fee (what the car user wants to pay them). This is one of the successful "eyes on the street" practice. However, there are other cases of this type of "guards" that demand higher cost or a fixed fee as you park or otherwise they become the threat against the user and his/her car . This is Mr. Dionicio Xante Ca, he comes from zone 8 and the neighborhood he is guarding is San Ignacio in zone 10 in Guatemala City. 
Security on the streets, people in an informal way have managed to provide this service as street guards in particular neighborhoods. 
Spontaneous way of solving problems. No central o local government is present, but it can be solved in a practical way. People from other neighborhoods come to provide the service in demanded areas. They have this sort of mental map where action is (potential threats and visitors / plus the users and visitors map).
pads.title: Security on streets!

pads.content:
Urban experiences from separating garbage at home
Javier Brolo and María Inés Castañeda on May 13th, 2021
If a person previously separates its household waste and leaves it separated before garbage collection, then the garbage collector will keep it separated when picking it up.
Household garbage classification 
May 10th, 2021
Separate the garbage of the house using at least three categories: carton/paper, glass, and plastics. Put each one in a different plastic bag. Then, put the classified bags outside of the house and wait and see what does the garbage collector do. Observe and annotate whether the garbage collector keeps the bags divided or mixes them up. Take pictures or videos only if it is not intrusive. Annotate ideas and insights. Don't talk directly to the collector, just watch and learn.
Household garbage, garbage bags, garbage collector, cellphone or camera
No additional comments.
The garbage truck does not go inside the street's house. Instead, on behalf of the truck, a collector man goes throughout the street with a medium cart to pick up the neighbors’ garbage bags. When the collector picked up the bags, he joined them into one. He did not keep the bags separated. Next, he put that one mixed bag on top of the others ones on the cart. 
Since the collector has to use a cart for moving the garbage maybe it is easier for him to merge the bags. We wonder whether he separates the bags again once he is back at the main garbage truck. We also ask ourselves if this is a common practice in other areas of the city. What do other garbage collectors do when they find separated garbage on their routes? Are there any garbage collectors who do keep separated the garbage and why? 
We could do a second trial of the experiment and in addition to the observation we could talk to the garbage collector and ask whether he considers the separated garbage is useful and if so, why and to whom is it useful?
1 day
We will try to invite country office colleagues to replicate the experiment at their homes and record their results and insights in order to see how experiences vary throughout the city.
Socioeconomic incentives for improving solid waste management 
How to increase resilience to climate change? How to incentivize waste management?

Pre-experiment (probe, trial & error)
Relevant to a CPD outcome
Clearly stated hypothesis
Methodology is clear
Low risk
pads.title: Urban experiences from separating garbage at home

Composting organic waste from the market

The project is a pioneer in market waste composting in alliance with the market administration and the municipality of Guatemala and Villa Nueva. 
Its vision is an integrated approach and to expand the methodology in the country and region. The compost is produced with the advice and methodology of an experienced research institute Landmanagement (Austria). Once finished, the compost is sold to municipalities and other buyers. Courses and consultancy are also provided.

Healthy and organic food in the city

The project consists of a group of young entrepreneurs interested in promoting food sovereignty through a local buying and selling network, providing only high quality, organic, vegetarian and fresh products.
pads.title: Healthy and organic food in the city

pads.content:
When Biodigesting becomes more than a solution by setting Waste as Gold 
Biodigester solution is a device used to transform organic waste (waste that can decompose) into biogas and organic liquid fertilizer. this solution is the work of our friend Koivogui Gbadé. Native to the forest zone of Guinea.
It should be noted that this solution consists of three units: The electronics which, according to the manufacturer, have a duration of 4 years; The Battery which lasts on average three years and finally, the metal here galvanized to withstand the negative and corrosive effects. For marketing, the difference is in the storage capacity since: the one with a capacity of 2000 liters is sold at 1800 USD, 1200 liters at 800 USD and finally that of 250 liters at 300 USD.
in pictures, the papaya tree used to serve as a cobail for the soil reconditioning test to promote organic cultivation
Merci à Koivogui Gbadé et bonne chance à lui!
pads.title: When Biodigesting becomes more than a solution by setting Waste as Gold

Giving plastic a second life

Ecoplast has a wide variety of raw materials of the highest quality for the national and international industry.

La cafetière du ghetto made in KANKAN
La cafetière de Kankan, issu du recyclage de déchets métalliques; est très en vogue et est en permanence utilisée dans les salons de thé et de petit café. elle est une sorte de compresseur de café moulu auquel on ajute de l'eau. Sous l'effet de la pression qui est appliquée par la barre supérieure maintenue par trois points tenus par des écrous solides de sorte à complètement extraire le liquide désormais coloré café. Commercialisée à prix moyen (200 000 GNF pour le moyen), cette solution est véritablement prisée dans les ville à fort niveau de consommation de café.

Brooms made from 100% recycled material

Production of plastic brooms and brushes of the highest quality. Their business model is to manufacture 100% of all our product lines with recycled raw materials.

Recycling collection centers for everyone

The Municipality of Guatemala, through the Directorate of Environment and Auxiliary Mayors, in alliance with the companies Tetra Pak® and Diso S.A., makes available to the neighbors of the city the Recycling Municenters, located in different strategic points of the city such as: parishes, municipal spaces, among others, with the objective of preserving the environment as well as promoting a culture of waste classification for its correct final disposal through a recycling process.

pads.content:
M'mawali, The financial management app
M'mawali is our solution designed and developped from the collaboration of UNDP and the Ministry of Telecommunication through it's agency ANIEN. 
M'mawaly is a financial management app available for the women as contribution to their resilience against COVID-19 pendemic situation. 
For the initial part of our project, like a normal app developpment, from the idea, we passed through a dianogstic of what women are really living in their respective activities as challenges. So, after some analyses we ended by designing and developping M'mawali. Essencially, the app is about finacial expenditures and incomes management for the women to better understand their finance movement. 
The App is the result of the common work between UNDP and the ministry of the telecommunication. From this collaboration, the Lab was sollicited by the C.O to accelerate the process. So now we are pleased to announce you that we just ended the sharing of the smartphones and the training so that they be able to use by themselves.
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.moudjames23.octa.mawali&hl=en_US&gl=US

pads.content:
Managing the CPD through Mural
Javier Brolo and María Inés Castañeda on June 18th, 2021
IF information on CPD is transferred to an alternative way of communication -a Mural- THEN it will be easier to make sense and give coherence to the big amount of information on the CPD regarding the systemic strategy of UNDP towards attaining human and sustainable development.
Alternative means to communicate effectively dense information
June, 2021
For this experiment an inductive analysis was employed through 4 main steps. (1) First we read the CPD in detail in order to identify cause and effect relationships implicitly stated on each paragraph. We considered as "cause" those elements linked to any expected result or effect, including lines of action. As "effect" we considered those elements that are expected to happen in consequence of a cause. It is important to note that some cause and effect relationships are bounded. In other words, some causes have effects which are also causes of other ulterior effects. That is why the categorization of an element as a cause or an effect was given by context and was not by any means absolute. (2) We grouped the cause and effect relationships found according to similarities perceived among the lines of action. From this iterative grouping process a pattern emerged which let us rank the lines of action from those more oriented towards institutional strengthening to those most oriented towards society strengthening, passing through institutional and society coordination. This pattern is not the only one possible, however, it is the one that let us make sense of all the information analyzed. (3) We proposed labels to name the groups of cause and effect relationships. Three main groups were identified, each one having other subgroups. (4) On the basis of the aforementioned main groups a general hypothesis was proposed with three additional derived hypothesis (this will be presented on the results).
Mural; CPD document
No additional comments
Through the analysis we identified one central hypothesis and three derived hypothesis about UNDP's intended contributions towards development based on the lines of action proposed on the CPD. The central hypothesis identified is: 1. (x1) strong institutions, (x2) institutional coordination, and (x3) strong society influence positively on (y1) development. [x1 + x2 + x3 = y1] From the central hypothesis, three additional hypothesis are derived: A. (x1) Procedures, (x2) technical abilities, (x3) knowledge management, and (x4) technology contribute to (y1) strenghtening institutions. [x1 + x2 + x3 + x4 = y1] B. (x1) inter-institutional mechanisms, (x2) mechanisms among national and local level institutions, and (x3) mechanisms among local institutions contribute to (y1) effective institutional coordination C. (x1) dialogue mechanisms, (x2) citizenship participation, (x3) economic empowerment, and (x4) social inclusion contribute to (y1) strong society
We consider that this analysis might be useful to make sense of the CPD through a way which is easy to remember and repeat. This can be useful to socialize and help appropriate the CPD both at an internal level in the country office and also at external levels including audiences that are not experts on development topics. On the other hand, from the Accelerator Lab standpoint, this analysis lets us identify more clearly which are some of the assumptions or mechanisms used on the lines of action that can be tested through experiments. Also, this analysis is linked to our learning cycle on knowledge management, letting us learn whether this kind of analysis helps to understand and give coherence to the huge amount of information on the UNDP's systemic strategy to contribute on human sustainable development gathered on the CPD.
As noted on the design, since this analysis was an inductive process it is important to keep in mind that other patterns may be possible.
Approximately 3 weeks.
We shared the results with the Monitoring and Evaluation Officer at the country office. Right now we have ongoing meetings to discuss it, examine it, answer questions, validate it and identify opportunities to test its usefulness.
Knowledge management
How to appropiate development knowledge? What makes it easier to base decisions and behaviors on existing knowledge?
https://app.mural.co/t/javierbrolo3191/m/javierbrolo3191/1623790647961/e607cd81eb7875d5fc5215105d525db384be28c5?sender=ud8503f7274be0545cea17940
Pre-experiment (probe, trial & error)
Relevant to a CPD outcome
Clearly stated hypothesis
Methodology is clear
Strong collaboration opportunity
High potential for scaling
Low risk
pads.title: Managing the CPD through Mural

THE LIGHTUP HAT
In the electrification campaign of the city of conakry, the government has installed electricity poles which, according to residents, do not meet the need for light. To overcome this problem, they have found it better to install bulbs of more than 100Watts covered from above by a slice of a 20 liter container but of yellow color.
this solution is to satisfy the need for large lighting coverage and by the same way protect the bulb against the rain.
Installing electricity poles is good but the Electricity company should take in consideration the circonconference of the lighting coverage, the poles top may be changed with transparent plastic like this the one in the picture. This will contribute recycled the water containers wich will certainely be produced by using the millions of thrown plastics.

pads.content:
THE STATION OF HOPE
Here is Mohamed Bah, like many other guinean youth , having decided to go and try their luck in europe but by the fact of fate decided after 3 years of exile avant-garde reinvents himself as a gas station owner for motorcyclists.
Normally for petrostation we currently see some tables on wich we just drop the batles containing the fuel. The magic part of this solution is that it is use to carry in small space 14 botles of 1L. I was wondering what was the top for? Amazingly structured to be protecting against fuel evaporation due to the sun and at the same time water infiltration during rain. The base support is made of Car ray that is strongly maintained fixed the the ground.
The HOPE here is defined by the Courage Mohamed had got from the lesson he learned from his 3 years jurney trying to reach Europe. By this little market, he will not lose hope and faith to the fact that one day from his home he will create something better for himself and his familly. As a reminder, Mohamed Bah has a University degree and is still looking to the horizon to get a JoB.
pads.title: THE STATION OF HOPE

Multi Hands washing station of TELICO
Designed by the students of the TELICO institute in Mamou, this innovation cannot go unnoticed insofar as it is imposing by its architecture. Composed of a bucket of water (water tank mixed with disinfectant), a long iron bar, the lower walls of which are littered with small holes that are almost invisible if you do not pay attention to them; and a long half-channel allowing the flow of waste water.
pads.title: Multi Hands washing station of TELICO

pads.content:
the regulating potential of COVID-19
His name is Oumar CAMARA, grew up in Sierra Léon and has joinned Guinea a decade before. from this picture, we see a single and simple man but when we try to discuss and go a little bit deeper, we discover the other side of the isberg hidden by the wall of modesty. Let's together read the story of Oumar, our former english teacher transformed throught the impact of covid-19 to an isolant seller.
Oumar Camara has started to monetize his knowledge of english in a school in the city of Kamsar where at the begining, everything was fine and with the time, he took advantage of the fact that Guinea scholarship is less expensive and the program spread the taught program has a shortfall in English. However, we will remember that for the years felt, the government of the Republic of Guinea has focused heavily on strengthening the training capacity of teachers and on the other hand is the need for a professional working language where it was introduced. idea of ​​ensuring that children from elementary school can start studying this language very early. It is therefore in this momentum that our friend Oumar CAMARA has established himself. 
And as we know in any case there are ups and downs, our friend Oumar after this good period of grace began to have delays on the wages which was due for the work done despite all the revision and proposal of Alleviation of payment for management hardly changed anything. In the end, he even deduced that it was the management that refused. While the latter gave every effort to be able to respect its commitment and ensure that the damage is minimized. Against all expectations, the covid-19 pendemic has upset the majority of our abitudes and even the most fundamental such as the payment of schooling due to the closure of many businesses and restrictions on motion to certain destinations.
Faced with all these elements which constitute a strong alibi of disuasion to remain indulgent. not long after, Oumar by a coup de grace, found himself promoted to the post of director. From that moment on, Oumar said he was able to quickly receive his salary (s) given that the arrears were a significant portion. On the strength of his new position, Oumar was surprised by the parents' non-reaction to his appeal for payment of school fees. As we raise the curtain on a surprising situation, Oumar suffered a big shock when he finally realized that all this time he was struggling to warm up the management when the reality was totally different. After several recall attempts, he was forced to throw in the towel. Nothing more could be added to it. This is how our friend finds himself in search of a solution to meet his needs and ends up realizing and admitting that everything had to be redone. Surrounded by his friends and brothers, he receives some suggestions of resilience in the face of this lean cow situation among which he brilliantly welcomes the idea of ​​trying his luck in the sale of protective plastics normally intended to pack televisions and other equipment. classified very fragile. In any case, we call it a "float" because of its property of floating on liquid surfaces. 
According to Oumar, the sale of insulation is very easy and quick in terms of generating money as it allows him to earn between 900,000 and 1,500,000 gnf on average and per month, which is much better compared to his old profile. Oumar uses his links in conakry for its supply by isolating collected from repair shops for electronic equipment and or from surrounding markets where the majority of insulation is collected as soon as the freezer boxes and others are opened without forgetting the fact that he makes great use of his fraternal relationships to expand his network of suppliers. Fortunately for him up to this day, everything is going very well. Oumar often pauses the question if for him although the Corona Virus is a difficult burden for all humanity, the fact remains that for him and some of his condition in particular it is rather a solution that has arrived at the right time?
so we wonder, but what is the use of the insulation or floats sold by our friend?
Well behave yourself because, the fishermen rush to the lots of floats to use it, once mixed with oil which gives a sticky and opaque mixture that does not let the water pass under any pretex. In short, it is a perfect element which spread over the sides of the boat, prevents water penetration. AND for our friend Oumar, this is a real positive means of recycling that we could well popularize in order to contribute to the good behavior of the environment.
It is therefore on this end note that Oumar CAMARA gratifies us with this smile while hoping to tell us the rest of his story which according to him must necessarily have a future extract retracing his return to teaching because for him "TEACHING" is the best commitment we can make to the community that has given us everything.
Thank you
pads.title: the regulating potential of COVID-19

pads.content:
Knife-sharpener used as a hanger
I noticed that plastic bags are hanging on the unknown (to me) object. Then I approached the sales woman asking what this black and red object was and it turned out to be a knife sharpener. The lady (Botagoz) mentioned that her husband came up with this idea so that they do not need to buy extra hangers. Interestingly enough, when I approached another counter where sales team had the same sharpener, they said they bought hangers for the plastic bags. This shows how people have a different viewpoint towards the same object.
This idea does not necessarily answer a need, but shows how people re-use common every day objects.
The lesson of this example is how people approach same common objects in a different way. For example, this shop was the only one that was using the knife sharpener as a hanger even though most shops had the same knife sharpener.
pads.title: Knife-sharpener used as a hanger

pads.content:
Learning how to plant during lockdown
During the lockdown in Mauritius, a lot of people (including members of my family) had to learn how to plant (in case something bad happens which, fortunately, didn't happen). But, in the process, people who had never ever planted something learned about the different kids of soils, the use of fertilisers, the different kids of seeds, etc. This knowledge, in many cases, was passed to children.
The need, at the very least, to continue eating. Of course, someone who had never planted cannot aspire to quickly be in a position to become self-sustainable in terms of food but this is an important first step.
In situations of crisis, people need to innovate.
pads.title: Learning how to plant during lockdown

pads.content:
La tech au service du respect de la distanciation physique
La distanciation physique d’au moins un mètre entre les personnes est l’une des principales mesures barrières recommandées
dans le cadre de la lutte contre la propagation de la Covid-19. Mais le respect de cette mesure s’avère parfois difficile, car dans la culture africaine et celle béninoise en particulier, les populations sont habituées à vivre en communauté avec des relations sociales très étroites : une tendance à aller saluer la famille, les malades, à manger ensemble dans le même plat, à participer à des réjouissances (mariage, baptême, etc.) ou à des cérémonies funéraires. Dans un tel contexte, le respect de la distanciation physique reste un défi en dépit des sensibilisations.
Le Laboratoire d’Accélération du PNUD a collaboré avec une start-up béninoise pour développer une solution peu onéreuse, inclusive et à la portée de tout détenteur d’un téléphone portable. Il s’agit d’une application fonctionnant avec la technologie Bluetooth dénommée « Stop Covid-19 », qui comprend des modules distincts. En effet, via la technologie Bluetooth, elle permet de déterminer de façon précise si deux ou plusieurs personnes ne respectent pas la mesure de distanciation physique (rester à au moins 1 mètre de distance les uns des autres) et génère automatiquement des alertes sur leurs téléphones via des notifications claires (sonores et sms) leur indiquant le non-respect de cette mesure dans des langues de leur choix dont des langues nationales parlées dans diverses parties du pays.
Ainsi, en cas de non-respect de la distanciation physique, l’alerte sonore suivante se déclenche sur le téléphone portable : « Attention ! Veuillez reculer ! ». Le message d’alerte est selon le choix de l'utilisateur, en français, ou en anglais ou en langue locale jusqu’à ce que l’intéressé prenne ses distances. Dès que l’on se retrouve à au moins un mètre d’un autre individu, le message vocal suivant résonne : « Merci, vous êtes à une distance raisonnable ! ».
Par ailleurs, l’application est associée à une plateforme web accessible de façon sécurisée fournissant en temps réel
l’historique des individus avec lesquels une personne est rentrée en contact (restée à moins d’un mètre). Aussi, est-elle également dotée d’un moteur central pouvant fournir des statistiques et, en cas de besoin, l’historique de toutes les personnes susceptibles d’avoir été contaminées par une personne testée positive à la Covid-19, pendant une période donnée parce n’ayant pas
respecté la distanciation physique.
Les alertes sonores fonctionnent indépendamment de la plateforme et du moteur de recherche qui pourraient être utilisés pour
l’identification et le traçage des cas déclarés au cas où le Gouvernement en décidait. Toutes les données collectées par l’application seraient le cas échéant conservées sur un serveur du Gouvernement. En perspective, elle pourra
être utilisée pour gérer toute autre épidémie/pandémie au Bénin.
pads.title: La tech au service du respect de la distanciation physique

pads.content:
Spatial design interventions in housing for change in behaviors related to gender norms - House 1 
Portfolio of Experimentation on Gender Norms, Patriarchy and Masculinities 
Gender norms -which emerged from a patriarchal system of rule that is intertwined with masculine ideologies -create social injustices for people around the world. We are testing (whether?) different ways to challenge the patriarchal system, masculine ideologies, and gender norms in Jordan, to see whether they can carve out a space for new systems/ways? of pursuing gender and social justice in the development sector. After the completion of the first experiment as part of the Lab's work on gender and reflecting on the lessons learned, we looked for local initiatives already working on a similar topic. This exploration led us to a collaboration with a new type of partner for upcoming experiments on challenging gender norms -with Basmitak Hat'alem (SAIB) on the effect of spatial design on behavior related to gender norms. After conducting participatory behavioral research on three households, different situations were observed. In some cases, there was a traditional division of gender roles, reflected in the spaces that members spend time in and the chores they do. Others times, positive gender norms were observed, where both male and female family members are taking part in the chores and also spending time in different spaces in the house. The observed positive behaviors were considered potential "solutions" to further explore. 
Theory of Change
If spatial changes were made in houses with negative gender exclusive spaces, then these interventions will positively change the behavior family members towards more equitable gender norms/roles
FAMILY 1 Remarks & Challenges 1 Part of the house is unused (the grandmother’s space), (Consent to expand the family’s space over the grandmother’s is granted) 2 Lack of privacy for all family members has been recorded. 3 Relatively, low participation of the male members has been recorded. 4 The existed open kitchen design is not serving its purpose as it's open to a corridor with a dead end. 5 As in the chart of "Behaviors associated with gender type", despite the father's (male) positive participation in the house, the greatest reliance at work is on the mother (female). 6 There is no space for children's activities. 
Positive points to exploit and develop (Opportunities): The positive gendered spaces. Both the mother and the father contribute to the chores: An intervention to the space can motivate the father to handle more household responsibilities together with his wife. 
Spatial interventions 1 Combining the kitchen with the living room 2 Add a Kitchenette to grandma space. 3 4 Switch the guest room with Grandma's living room (suggested). Provide a rooftop space. 
TBD 1 2 3 Replace the roof with one of three: Sandwich panels, concrete, Combination of both). The stairs leading to the roof of the house. The location of the water tanks.
pads.title: Spatial design interventions in housing for change in behaviors related to gender norms - House 1

pads.content:
Community-based food security and circular economy during pandemic
This weekend I visited the low income community located less than 2 KM from my place on the outskirts of the western part of Bogor, West Java. I came across this community which has created new initiatives since couple of months ago during the pandemic. Young people who were worried about the limited space for movement and the uncertainty of facing a pandemic, had a strong desire to carry out useful activities in their neighborhood. The inter-generational discussion showed the same anxiety experienced by the older generation who were also worried about meeting their food needs and the sustainability of their household economy. They started the initiative by asking permission from a landowner to use his plot of land as a farming location for the local community. With a limited area of ​​land, they decided to use planting media made of used goods such as plastic wrappers for cooking oil and detergent, used plastic bottles, used paint buckets, and so on. The residents are offered to grow the vegetables they wanted, especially for their own consumption. However, residents are also allowed to sell their crops to fellow neighbors. The need for planting media and compost answers the challenge of better waste management. People sort waste from households and the stream that passes through their dense settlement. As a result, in addition to obtaining planting media and compost, the river flow is clean enough for fish farming. In addition, the community also has access to clean water and an irrigation system. The caretakers of the plants are mostly men, especially those who have free time or do not work. Some women earn extra money by participating in marketing vegetables in the neighborhood. A bamboo hall has been built over the river that brings together members of the community across generations and groups. People expressed that being involved in community farming had reduced their stress, made them happy and increased their sense of community pride. Currently the community is in the process of building a greenhouse over the river. Community agility makes their social innovation more developed. 
Waste management, access to good nutrition, clean water and irrigation system, social cohesion, mental health and well being, gender equality, economic and livelihood, youth empowerment. 
Strong engagement and understanding of the context itself including the identification of challenges and availability of local resources can provide a basis for formulating a community-based circular economy. 
What works - an enabling environment for social innovation: (a) Solidarity from the owner of a small plot of land, (b) Strong community initiatives with supportive community leaders, (c) Creativity in finding solutions to various challenges, (d) Social cohesion across generations and groups.
Unmet needs: (a) Good collective financial management, (b) Cultivation of seeds, (c) Alternative strategies to
increase awareness of hygiene and sanitation, especially discipline in disposing of waste.
pads.title: Community-based food security and circular economy during pandemic

pads.content:
E-Labor Market Maker for Less Skilled Workers
1- Exploring
I did not have to go too far to observe people crowding at the corner of the main street nearby my home. Day workers rushing toward cars and incomers to offer their services, which vary with respect to their skills (construction, plumbers...etc.). One factor in common they have is that every day is an absolute struggle to put food on the table for their families.
2- Interview, Information and Data collection
I approached a group of workers and asked what their main issues were and how to make their work pursuit better. The answers were several but a common one was SPEEDING UP the matching process. In fact, the matching between the customers seeking workers and the day laborers is hard to establish. This is mainly due to the information asymmetry, some workers pretending they have sets of skills they don’t in desperately attempting to match the customers offers (This leads the confidence of customers to deteriorate) ...etc.
3- Solution Mapping
I immediately considered a matching solution. How about an electronic platform or an application that acts as a labor market maker for less skilled workers (in reference to financial market makers which match bids and asks)? This will tremendously speed up the recruitment process cycles making the workers to benefit more from it.
4- Originality and Ethics
Excited about the idea, I sought to verify its originality and if anyone else came up with such a solution in advance. For doing so, I engaged in online research, social media and exploited some personal connections for that purpose. And the answer was YES! A group of young researchers came up with a very similar idea to address the problem of crowding of less-skilled workers. Their perception comprises a speeding up solution to the matching process through an application they are trying to develop.
5- Interviewing the Group of Researchers
The young researchers were interested in developing the application, however, they blame the lack of financial means to pursue their goals.
The needs answered by the solution can be listed as follow:
Clearing up or lowering the crowding in the main streets of the city.
Reducing the intensity of traffic congestion.
Benefiting workers with low income and skills (SDGs 1 and 2).
Contributing in employment formation (SDGs 8).
Reducing the risk of contracting the covid-19 among workers.
A main lesson can be learned from this observation. That is, well designed and tailored local solution can have a substantial impact on people’s livelihood. The impact of local solutions on SDGs targets can have an amplified effect through the dynamic nature of learning and solving at smaller scales. This is particularly true when it comes to jobs creation for the pool of less skilled workers, where the effect on the wellbeing of the poorest laborers can be felt considerably.
pads.title: E-Labor Market Maker for Less Skilled Workers

Upcycling cans
I met Sabado in Mercadu Bandim, the biggest informal market in Bissau, as she was collecting old cans we started a conversation. Sabado collects the cans from the general waste laying around on the street. When she has collected enough cans she is heating them up and remoulds them into pots that she sells on the market.
There is a need for job opportunities in Guinea-Bissau. Sabado creates her own job opportunity as she takes cans that people have thrown on the ground and process them into something valuable that she can sell so economically sustain herself and her family, an interesting example of up-cykling. At the same time she takes an action agains the lacking waste management system in Bissau, contributing to a cleaner environment.
Up-cykling has potential for women employment in Bissau.
Collection of cans

Due to inaccessibility and lack of employment she and her community have been limited in ways they can buy washing up powder. With inflated prices in Farim, she tested and prototyped till she developed a washing powder which used only local products. With the success of her washing powder she is able to sell but also give to other women of the city who face the same issues as her.

3000 plaguicide plastic waste containers removed

Ministerio de Ambiente, PNUD
El Programa Nacional para la Gestión Ambientalmente Adecuada de Sustancias Químicas en su Ciclo de Vida, liderado por el Ministerio del Ambiente, Agua y Transición Ecológica (MAATE), con el apoyo del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo (PNUD), cumple un hito en el marco de la campaña ‘Aliados del Ambiente’. Tres mil envases de plaguicidas serán trasladados de las Galápagos al continente para ser eliminados adecuadamente a nivel ambiental.
Esta iniciativa contó con la participación de más de 150 fincas y aproximadamente 400 participantes entre agricultores/as, almacenistas, niños y niñas de Isabela, Santa Cruz y San Cristóbal, quienes asistieron a los talleres y fueron parte de la minga desarrollara en octubre del presente año para la recolección de este tipo de desechos.

pads.content:
Carishinas en bici

"Carishinas" is a Quichua word, which in Spanish has become popular to describe women and girls who don ́t fit into traditional roles. Women who don ́t cook well, who like to play outdoors and do "male" activities are disdainly called "carishinas". Honoring this term, a group of women have organized the collective "Carishinas on Bicycles". This citizen organization aims to reclaim public spaces for women who can freely transport themselves on bicycles. Ecuador is not Amsterdam, so access to a male, car dominated public space is quite a challenge.
Because of traditional roles, many adult women do not know how to ride bikes. This women ́s collective teaches women to ride bikes, and hit the road! Group biking are organized.
This experience was storytold in Human Library event organized by Ecuador AccLab in January.
Innovators: Carishinas en bici
Mapper: Paulina Jiménez
Curator: Paulina Jiménez
pads.title: Carishinas en bici

Gamified Recycling
Gamified Recycling: The BitEgreen Pilot, created by the Caribbean Environmental Management Bureau, was pitched at the 2019 "Blue Tank" challenge facilitated by the Accelerator Lab for Barbados and the Eastern Caribbean. In response to inefficient waste management practices, the pilot involves the development of a recycling/circular economy system which uses technology and gamification to incentivize participation. To do so, the proposal assigned a monetary value to reusable and recyclable material for all citizens and corporations as a catalyst for a new circular economy model. In practice, it applies barcode scanner sales, smart trash cans, reverse vending machines, mobile phones and an integrated online marketplace.
pads.title: Gamified Recycling

pads.content:
#InnovationChallenge: Dry toilets and sanitation system for rural communities

This solution was mapped thanks to the third edition of the challenge "Innovating together for children and sustainable development", which aimed to boost solutions that had an impact on clean and affordable energy or solid and liquid waste management. To combat the sanitation crisis and the dangerous consequences of disease transmission, health and hygiene problems, Mosan provides a complete, climate-positive sanitation solution, a human excreta collection service and its transport to Mosan Transformation centers. All solutions of the challenge had a great potential, however, MOSAN has all the characteristics of an innovative solution for sustainable development for Guatemala and many other communities that need sanitation, clean water, and health conditions. So far, this solution is already contributing to the community of Santa Catarina Palopó, providing an alternative management for human organic waste, and preventing polluted water and material be thrown at Lake Atitlan.
pads.title: #InnovationChallenge: Dry toilets and sanitation system for rural communities

pads.content:
Solar boats for the Amazon

Karasolar
https://karasolar.com/
Kara Solar began as a partnership between the Achuar indigenous people of Ecuador and engineers, anthropologists, communicators, and other allies that was established in 2018 to build solar-powered river transport and energy networks in Achuar territory, Ecuador.
Provide clean infrastructure to support technological independence, liberating communities from the restraints of gasoline power. In the Amazon, geographical dispersion demands the use of gasoline run boats or canoes, at very high prices. Gas stations are located at long distances, require several type of transportations. Solar energy run boats, reduce the dependence on petrol and money. To access to petrol, deforestation occurs, even if it is cutting down one tree to acess to cash to buy gasoline, the impact spreads throughout the territory.
The model created in Achuar territory is applicable to rainforests across the Amazon and around the world. Now, Kara is accompanying indigenous communities in Brazil, Peru, Solomon Islands, and Suriname as they replicate this model pioneered in Achuar territory.
https://karasolar.com/
DIY / open source
Yes
Product
Available in market

pads.content:
Eduba Platform
The rise of e-learning in the last decade has brought forth a range of solutions to provide high-quality education to people of all ages. Recent COVID lockdowns have inspired people all over the world to learn new skills at home using free and paid online courses. 
But today, the internet services and traditional methods of educational institutions in Iraq have proven to be a bottleneck in accessing e-learning services from home.
The Eduba educational management platform is the first platform that seeks to achieve a comprehensive digital transformation for educational institutions in Iraq. The 6-in-1 system includes:
1- Course management
2- Accounting
3- Human Resources Management
4- Evaluation and Assessment
5- E-learning
6- Video conferencing
In direct challenge to the traditional administration of universities in Iraq that rely on paper-based systems, Eduba is providing a comprehensive and secure virtual environment.
pads.title: Eduba Platform

pads.content:
Rêver l’avenir
DOMAINE D’APPLICATION : Entreprenariat des jeunes
TYPE D’ACTIVITE : Formation
PROMOTEUR : Association Bon Samaritain pour l’épanouissement de la jeunesse du Centre Nord
CONTEXTE
Faisant suite au constat de la croissance du nombre de jeunes sans emploi et du risque qu’ils tombent dans la
délinquance (voir être enrôlés dans le terrorisme) et les maternités précoces,
un groupe de jeunes réunis en association a réfléchi et proposé aux jeunes de
se valoriser, s’épanouir à travers une initiative appelée « Rêver l’avenir :
Moi avant, moi maintenant et moi dans quinze ans ». 
PROBLEME ADRESSE
La solution ‘‘Rêver l’avenir’’ permet d’adresser les défis majeurs à l’insertion socio-professionnelle des jeunes dans la région du Centre Nord que sont : 
L’inadéquation de l’offre de formation professionnelle dans le Centre Nord avec les besoins du marché du travail; 
Les jeunes de la région du Centre Nord n’ont pas été éduqué à la culture entrepreneuriale. 
OBJECTIF RECHERCHE : Permettre aux jeunes de découvrir et de valoriser son potentiel
RESULTAT ATTENDUS 
Il est attendu de la mise en œuvre de la solution ‘‘rêver l’avenir’’ les résultats suivants : 
Les jeunes ont acquis une estime de leur personnalité; 
Les jeunes sont formés à l’esprit entrepreneuriale; 
Certains jeunes ont commencé une activité génératrice de revenus
pads.title: Rêver l’avenir

pads.content:
Rabbit urine changes fortunes of farmers
Farmers have for years been blamed for feeding the country on vegetables and fruits with abnormally high concentrations of herbicides and pesticides. Studies have shown that pesticides and herbicides used in agriculture increase the risk of cancer and other diseases. It is for these reasons that Stephen Njoroge has taken up rabbit farming not just for their meat but also for their highly concentrated urine. Mr. Njoroge collects 10-15 liters of urine from his rabbits everyday and sells the urine to firms that manufacture fertilizer. Rabbit urine has highly concentrated nutrients which improve soil fertility and crop production.
pads.title: Rabbit urine changes fortunes of farmers

pads.content:
Upesi super sprayer - modified sprayer to help fight the voracious fall army worm
The innovation helps to control the spread of army worms in farms. The sprayer which is strapped on the back has six adjustable nozzles capable of spraying below the leaves of the maize crop, where the destructive crop hides during the day to escape direct sunlight. This hungry caterpillar feeds on several plant species but its preferred host is maize, a crop whose acreage is expanding faster than any other cereal as the demand for ugali and animal fodder increases. The pest presents a peculiar challenge as it can consume over 200 kilometers of crop during its adult stage, laying thousands of eggs along its way. Larvae burrow inside maize whorls or hide under the leaves, where they are partially protected from pesticides. The pump's rotating nozzles, which are adjustable, are located on each side of the sprayer and can be adjusted to spray directly inside the funnel, where the worm feeds, and the outside of the crop, where it hides. The sprayer is charged by a solar powered dynamo and when the solar power runs out, it uses a manual hand pump which serves as a backup.
https://youtu.be/Vwco65kiw6w?list=PL7xugFeVHXWd5qwEfjs8LnlsfrfxAVK5v
pads.title: Upesi super sprayer - modified sprayer to help fight the voracious fall army worm

pads.content:
Cassava drying and chipping machine
Since the beginning of time, most communities have dried most foods, including cassava, by exposing it to the sun, however, the weather is not conducive for this task all the time. When the weather is favorable, it takes no less than three days to properly dry the cassava, but when it rains, it takes much longer, and the risk for rotting is higher. Mary Wanjiru has developed a machine that dries cassava faster to increase its shelf-life. Within six hours, the cassava chips are ready for frying, to be ground into flour. The machine is installed to a solar inter-charge that circulates hot air directly to a fixed bed carrying the product. It also consists of a controller, chipping plates, absorbing plates and front-end trays of wire mesh.
pads.title: Cassava drying and chipping machine

pads.content:
Intercultural self-managed childcare center

This autonomous childcare center in the heart of Quito ́s San Roque Market was created to address some barriers to access posed by conventional care services. Another municipal public childcare center is right next to this one; however, the list of school supplies, uniform, strict schedules and other requirements are often a burden for the market mothers whose work hours go beyond 9 to 5. On the contrary, the autonomous childcare center is self-managed and provides bilingual education to promote the conservation of the indigenous language and identity in an urban context. This experimental center is run by parents and educators and guarantees an intercultural service, adapted to the times and needs of the market’s working women.
While the official care center, for some mothers, is seen as place where their children will blend into mainstream mestizo culture, cut their indigenous braids and adopt city clothing, others do not want to give up to their indigenous identity.
pads.title: Intercultural self-managed childcare center

pads.content:
Community based saving groups
In Ecuador, in both the rural and urban context, women create and participate in community-based savings and credit groups to solve a problem of financial exclusion. Five savings groups were visited and discussion held in focus group. Rural women who live in poverty conditions cannot access credit loans to finance their livelihoods, as they must jump over economic and bureaucratic hurdles: having a guarantor, real estate, employment contracts and regulatory paperwork that only formal workers can provide. Hence, they have taken the matters in their own hands and self-organized these piggy bank initiatives. Communities, led by women, organize savings and credit accounts, in which the main asset is not the money itself, but solidarity, trust and commitment.
pads.title: Community based saving groups

pads.content:
Simulation Game for Iraqi Entrepreneurial Ecosystem
Many actors in the business ecosystem are not aware of the role and interests of other stakeholders, especially young people seeking support to start their own business. On the other hand, traditional training methods addressing the local business ecosystem are limited and not very effective. 
What?
The Simulation Game is designed to be a training tool to enhance the understanding of the business ecosystem in Iraq. it can be used as standalone training activity or as supporting tool to workshops addressing business or entrepreneurship. 
How?
It is a fun way of role-play that would let each participant play a role in the ecosystem and interact with other stakeholders based on the interests of their party. The more the engage and achieve the objectives of the character they are playing, the more points and cash they gain in the simulation game. 
Who?
The game is designed mainly for young people willing to learn more about how to interact with the stakeholders of the ecosystem to start their own business. However, the cam can be played by other stakeholders such as government and companies (especially those mandated to support youth projects). Also, this game can be used as a tool to mix young individuals and institutions to build common ground and enhance communication.
pads.title: Simulation Game for Iraqi Entrepreneurial Ecosystem

pads.content:
Dorado Fish Traceability

This pilot plan for the artisanal dorado fishery will allow the traceability of this fishery in Ecuador. Through a computer
system, reports will be generated in real time of the catches made by artisanal vessels and the impact on protected species, key information, not only for the target species, but also for secondary and incidental ones.
By having this information, consumers will be able to know the entire process of the fishing product that he acquires, which will generate links with the producer and confidence in the purchase of a sustainable product, which will strengthen sales and the economic reactivation of these fishing sectors. On the other hand, the data collected will help to correctly monitor the sustainability of resources and the protection of the oceans.
This initiative has the technical support of the project 'Coastal Fisheries Initiative' of the Ministry of Production, Foreign Trade, Investments and Fisheries with technical support from the UNDP-Ecuador, and its partners Sustainable Fisheries Partnership (SFP) , Conservation International Ecuador (CI) and WWF Ecuador, and financing from the Global Environment Facility (GEF).
Story here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ieIm-1dMgS4
pads.title: Dorado Fish Traceability

pads.content:
Bassin de collecte des eaux de ruissellement
Description de la solution
Il s’agit de réaliser des bassins dans les aires de production pour collecter les eaux de ruissellement en saison hivernale pour les utiliser ensuite en irrigation d’appoint pour la production agricole et la culture maraichère en saison sèche. il permet de collecter les eaux de ruissellement des pluies pour des irrigations d’appoint pendant les poches de sécheresse ou pour faire du maraichage en saison sèche
A quel défi/problème répond cette solution ?
- Résoudre le problème fréquent de poches de sècheresse pendant l’hivernage
- Résoudre le problème de baisses de rendements agricoles lié à l’insuffisance des pluies et à leur mauvaise répartition 
- Réduire les superficies de production agricole
- Produire 2 fois pendant la campagne hivernale
- Réduire la charge de travail en exploitant des superficies plus petites
A qui s'adresse la solution?
- La solution s’adresse aux productrices et producteurs des zones à faible pluviométrie
En quoi est-ce que cette solution est innovante?
Cette solution est innovante de par: 
- La simplicité de la réalisation 
- permet une association de plusieurs activités autour du BCER (agriculture, élevage de volailles, de poissons, ...)
- adapté pour un exploitant 
Promoteur de la solution :
Association Solidarité et Entraide Mutuelle au Sahel (SEMUS) en partenariat l’Institut International d’Ingénierie de l’Eau et de l’Environnement (2IE)
pads.title: Bassin de collecte des eaux de ruissellement

pads.content:
Epargner pour le changement - Bâtir la résilience (EPC)
Description de la solution
La solution consiste en la création de groupes d’épargne et de crédit qui ne fait pas appel à l’injection de ressources financières externes. Il est basé sur la collecte de l’épargne des groupes constitués et leur redistribution sous forme crédit aux membres. Au bout d’un cycle qui dure environ 1 an les sommes épargnées et les bénéfices des crédits octroyés sont redistribués aux membres pour renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus et satisfaire leurs besoins. Au-delà des services financiers communautaires fournis, la solution permet de tirer parti de l'existence de groupes d'épargne pour bâtir une plateforme solide autour de laquelle seront organisées diverses sortes d'activités, telles que : l’encadrement agricole, la mise en relation avec les IMF, l’éducation nutritionnelle, les achats groupés d’intrants agricoles et les ventes groupées de produits agricoles, etc.
A quel défi/problème répond cette solution ?
- Chômage des femmes et des jeunes
- Faible pouvoir d’achat des femmes et des jeunes
A qui s'adresse la solution ?
Aux femmes et aux jeunes
En quoi est-ce que cette solution est innovante ?
- L’approche EPC sert de levier aux femmes pour sortir du cercle vicieux de la pauvreté et d’avoir en quelques années un accès aux IMF
- Les groupes EPC peuvent servir de plateformes pour d’autres interventions
Promoteur de la solution

pads.content:
AQUABA: Solar Desalination Pilot Project
Producing Drinking Water and Creating Livelihood Opportunities in Iraq. The challenge: High level of water salinity in Iraq leading to a lack of access to clean drinking water. The Solution: With their Solar Desalination Module, entirely produced locally, Aquaba aims to tackle the high level of water salinity and contamination in Iraq. The technology is made of stainless steel and glass. It is a simple water treatment method using solar distillation. Each module can produce up to 7 liters of drinking water/day. Aquaba is also creating livelihood opportunities by building the capacity of local Iraqi manufacturers/engineers to produce and distribute the devices in Iraq ensuring localisation of knowledge and local ownership of this solution. A USD 10k grant has been awarded to pilot this solution in partnership with ACF in Iraq. Target Population: Host communities affected by water salinity
Iraq Response Innovation Lab
To Owners
Just Started

INGOs
Individuals
pads.title: AQUABA: Solar Desalination Pilot Project

pads.content:
Farmers organization: APEOSAE

“I was born to a rural and humble home. I was always my mother ́s the 
head of the household. Knowing the needs of farming people and their 
exploitation, I proposed myself to create a second level organization 
called APEOASAE. We dedicate ourselves to ecological farming and we even
have exportation products. A month and a half ago a landslide took away
over 20,000 cacao plants, but that doesn’t bring me down”. José Alonso Castillo
Farmers association as a way to combat exploitation. José Alonso told his story in Ecuador ́s AccLab Human Library Event in January. He overcame extreme poverty and when asked how, by a person from the audience, he says it ́s a result from organizing, staying together with other farmers. He ́s known for his blockchain chocolate; "The other bar".

pads.content:
Complexe de Magasins de stockage d`oignon à Echangeur Géothermique
Le stockage de l`oignon est une opération délicate qui exige beaucoup de paramètres techniques. Le préalable du stockage des bulbes d`oignon est assujetti à un itinéraire inéluctable qui passe par les conditions de la production et de la récolte. Il est important de conjuguer ces deux étapes avant de passer à l`étape de la conservation. Le Complexe de Magasins de stockage d`oignon à Echangeur Géothermique est une innovation pour la conservation de bulbes d`oignon conçue pour améliorer leur durée de conservation. Jusqu’ici les magasins de conservation d`oignon n`ont pas donné satisfaction aux producteurs ruraux. Des instituts de recherche se sont penchés sur la question de l'amélioration du stockage et ont étudié et expérimenté plusieurs modèles et seuls quelques-uns se sont montrés pertinents mais le taux d`adaptation en milieu paysan reste très faible pour diverses raisons. En Afrique de l'Ouest et du Centre-Nord, les paysans utilisent plus de 95% du modèle traditionnel pour la conservation d’oignon dont la durée de n’excède généralement pas les 2-3 mois avec des pertes de l`ordre de 20 à 30%. Dans ces conditions, il est difficile de rentabiliser l’opération de stockage, même si les prix doublent ou triplent après quelques mois. Le Complexe de Magasins de stockage un dispositif innovant de conservation de bulbes d`oignon conçu, pour améliorer la durée de stockage, éviter les différentes blessures causées pendant de la manutention de bulbes, faciliter le suivi de l`état sanitaire des bulbes, réduire de manière drastique le cout des installations et augmenter la qualité et la quantité de bulbes stockées. La technique est écologique, naturelle, sans électricité, économique, sans mécanique, aucun frais d`entretien, aucun frais de personnel de maintien, sans bruit, s’adapte à tous les terrains, simple d’installation, performant et durable. Adresse de l’innovateur : INOVATECH-Sarl/ Innovations, Agroforesterie, Commerce Général RCCM/NI/NIA/2013/A/397/04/02/2013 ; Nif : 35665/S Cel : 91 10 00 85 / 96 96 48 53/ 96978110- BP 2796 Ny Email : hbissala@gmail.com, hbissala@yahoo.fr, einovatech@yahoo.com
pads.title: Complexe de Magasins de stockage d`oignon à Echangeur Géothermique

Water Collection tanks using the roof - Asucuch

The Association of Organizations of the Cuchumatanes has promoted this project as a measure of adaptation to climate change, focusing on the effects of droughts. The system they use captures the water through sheets of Aluzinc, then conducts the water into a PVC channel and finally settles inside a water tank. It is a method that has been used in different communities and proven effective. It promotes collectivity and work among people in the community.

pads.content:
Solar Irrigation System
Innovator: Staffs from the Department of Agriculture
Such is 'smart Agriculture' by using solar energy to draw groundwater needed for irrigation of farms. This solar-powered water system has the capacity to pump water into a 10,000L tank in just under two and a half hours. Using a gravity feed piping system, water from the tank is then sent to the two fish ponds, each holding 1000 tilapia fish, and a separate tap sends water directly to the four mobile sprinklers in the centre of the farm. This system also presents an opportunity for any farmer who is prepared to diversify and venture into farming fish or small livestock for that matter, as water will be readily available all year round. This system was designed by one local staff of the Agriculture Department and funded by the Italian government.
pads.title: Solar Irrigation System

pads.content:
Overcoming the digital gap for the elderly

Due to COVID 19 restrictions that also impacted on mobilization, the "ice-cream grandpas" where facing a higher challenge, how to sell their ice-creams by walking around with their mobile carts, in the urban areas and manage to go back and forth to their homes when public transportation went off and the working hours were very limited in the country. So the social network group "Ayúdame a Trabajar" notice their problem and suggested to bring food to the warehouse the elderly kept the carts to help them to survive. Some of them couldn ́t commute back to their homes. A young lady, María Isabel, came to help them no only providing groceries or health prevention items, but she created a Facebook page "Abuelitos Heladeros" with e-commerce link where packages of ice-creams from these group of "grandpas", could be sell through the page to help them to keep running their discrete business. Many people who knew about them started buying them many packages and collaborating either with groceries, money donations or other useful items including medic assistance. Maria Isabel with the help of family and friends raised more funds to refurbish the warehouse and open it as a residential option for them too. The initiative has grown, and now they are helping other elder that are facing rough conditions. Probably the main success key factor is that María Isabel has published all the expenses of the funds the FBPage has raised. 
The impact elderly face as technology moves faster, they remain conducting their small businesses in the traditional way, how ever with COVID 19 no only their economic activity was in risk, mobilization was blocked and the costs to use private alternative options were high. In addition, they face more risk to get the virus as elders. The solution "Abuelitos Heladeros" has managed to keep the economically active and even raise funds to provide them health care, better conditions in the warehouse they share. This a way how young people may help others to build a "digital bridge" to help others to pass thru digitalization and social media era, and not being left behind.
pads.title: Overcoming the digital gap for the elderly

Democratizing technology (computers)

NURTECH
Este emprendimiento se dedica a la recolección de equipos usados, sobre todo computadores. Se encuentra ubicado en la región Sierra. Se diferencia por trabajar mediante voluntariado y sin fines de lucro. Apoya el derecho a la educación, y el propósito de que los jóvenes no abandonen sus clases por falta de implementos tecnológicos. Se encuentra organizado por 20 personas y se maneja bajo el principio de la economía circular. Dentro de sus buenas prácticas está la identificación de la falta de equipos tecnológicos en los jóvenes, para proveerles de estas herramientas con la finalidad de que sigan estudiando y de evitar la suspensión de sus clases. Nurtech ha tenido un impacto positivo ya que ayuda a que los jóvenes reciban clases en condiciones adecuadas y no se vean obligados a dejar sus estudios.

pads.content:
Community pots and library

OLLA COMUNITARIA Y BIBLIOTECA COMUNITARIA EN LAGO AGRIO
Este emprendimiento abre un espacio para generar apoyo en su territorio de intervención, conjuntamente con otras entidades. Brinda los beneficios de su biblioteca. Respecto al trabajo con las comunidades, busca mitigar los efectos de la pobreza, entre los que se encuentra la desnutrición infantil. Se ubica en la región de la Amazonía. Se diferencia por ser una fundación sin fines de lucro y de servicio a la colectividad, y cuenta con el apoyo de instituciones y de autoridades para aportar en la acción humanitaria a través de eventos. La idea de esta organización nace de un grupo de personas que desean ayudar y capacitar a través de talleres, de manera voluntaria y con beneficios para la comunidad, así como a aportar a propósitos locales que puedan construirse desde los ODS. Esta fundación causa un impacto positivo en la comunidad y en los jóvenes. También cuenta con un proyecto para la creación del primer centro de salud mental comunitaria en Sucumbíos. El sector registra varios intentos autolíticos y suicidios consumados, sin embargo, este es un tema al que las autoridades no dan la importancia suficiente. Por este motivo, el proyecto busca contar con la participación de la colectividad.
funladesec@gmail.com

pads.content:
La broyeuse de feuilles de Siguiri
Issue de la forge de M. Yéro sur l’axe Siguiri-Bamako, cette machine conçue à base de métaux recyclés est greffée au moteur de type Tiger pour en assurer le mouvement continu de marteau-torsion installé à l’intérieur du canon d’éjection de la pâte ou de la mixture de plants ainsi formé. Cette mixture est utilisée par nos mère pour les sauces à base de feuilles de manioc ou de patate. Ainsi, elle constitue un véritable facteur de gain en temps de et en énergie durant la cuisson de nos mets de même qu'un moyen rapide et simple de remettre en valeur les nombreuses feuilles de toles issues de la décomposition de certains véhicules. En général, cette solution est disponible dans la plupart des marchés mais au format manuel qui ici en vue de gagner en temps mais aussi en quantité de production, a bien été amélioré.
pads.title: La broyeuse de feuilles de Siguiri

pads.content:
Le réservoir d'eau en béton (Djidaga) de SIGUIRI
Connu jadis pour ses propriétés liées à la conservation d’eau à température ambiante, le réservoir de béton est devenu une véritable solution locale contre le réchauffement de l’eau mais aussi le vol de bassin plastique ou du moins de faible masse; dont sont couramment victimes les habitants de Siguiri. A ce jour, vous pouvez disposer de bassin de 600 litres, 1000 Litres et même, vous le faire confectionner à domicile. Selon notre interlocuteur, ce bassin est fait dans plusieurs localités de Guinée mais la particularité de celui de Siguiri réside dans le fait qu’il est hyper résistant, solide et enfin assez lice de l’intérieur pour maintenir le caractère propre de l’eau.
pads.title: Le réservoir d'eau en béton (Djidaga) de SIGUIRI

pads.content:
Amazon Fire Tracker

"An innovative new app for Real-time Amazon Fire Monitoring (see MAAP #118 for details).
In a novel approach, the app combines data from the atmosphere (aerosol emissions in smoke) and the ground (heat anomaly alerts) to effectively detect and visualize major Amazon fires.
The app specializes in filtering out thousands of the heat-based fire alerts to prioritize only those burning large 
amounts of biomass and thus emitting elevated levels of aerosol (defined here as a major fire)."
https://maaproject.org/2020/fire-july-update/
Mapper: Paulina Jiménez

pads.content:
Web/app que permite recopilar datos de informalidad laboral

Finalista del RETO DE INNOVACIÓN para crear un registro de jóvenes en informalidad lanzado en el marco del Proyecto SDG/ Laboratorio Aceleración Ecuador.
Es un prototipo para un sistema inteligente que permite recopilar datos de informalidad laboral para mejorar las oportunidades laborales de los jóvenes. Este sistema está dividido en cuatro partes importantes:
1. PROGRESSIVE WEB APP (PWA):
Esta aplicación ha sido diseñada para que los jóvenes tengan un espacio idóneo y muestren sus habilidades y conocimientos de su área de experticia al mundo. Todo esto acompañado de un asistente inteligente que brinda ofertas laborales ajustadas a cada uno de los perfiles en el caso que se requiera. Esta solución no solo ha sido
pensada para que los jóvenes encuentren trabajo sino que ellos puedan capacitarse día a día y estén preparados para el mundo laboral. Cuenta con una sección para que los jóvenes se capaciten de acuerdo a sus preferencias a través de cursos, blogs, consejos y post informativos para mejorar tanto sus habilidades técnicas como blandas.
La aplicación de DANIK cuenta con un sistema de PUSH NOTIFICATIONS automático para mantener al usuario informado y fidelizado con la plataforma. El sistema de notificaciones permite al usuario mantenerlo informado de noticias, ofertas laborales, eventos o consejos que le puedan servir en el día a día. Además, este sistema tiene la facultad de avisar cuando un nuevo cuestionario se ha creado, así el usuario estará informado en cualquier momento y la tasa de respuesta aumentará. El sistema de CORREO ELECTRÓNICO tiene el mismo fin mencionado
anteriormente pero se limita a informar sobre nuevos cuestionarios disponibles y noticias de carácter importante a la comunidad.
2. PANEL DE ADMINISTRACIÓN:
Este panel incluye:
· Crear, editar y publicar contenido informativo de manera sencilla.
· Manejo y administración de la página informativa (Landing Page).
· Manejo del sistema de PUSH NOTIFICATIONS.
· Estadísticas de la interacción con aplicación de los jóvenes (Rendimiento).
· Crear, editar y publicar encuestas fácilmente y en cualquier momento.
· Administración de la plataforma a través de roles de participación.
3. PANEL DE RECLUTAMIENTO:
Características destacadas:
· Filtro inteligente para buscar profesionales y no profesionales
· Comunicación directa con los jóvenes.
· Interfaz de usuario intuitiva para observar los portafolios de los jóvenes.
· Perfiles destacados.
4. DASHBOARD ESTADÍSTICO Y ACCESO A DATA WAREHOUSE
Características destacadas:
· Información relevante hallada a través de metodologías de Inteligencia deNegocios.
· Disponibilidad a la información 24/7.
· Facilidad de acceso a través de un sistema seguro (Contraseñas).
· Acceso a datos consolidados y homogéneos de forma segura a través de una API.
· Base de datos confiable para aplicar técnicas de analytics.
pads.title: Web/app que permite recopilar datos de informalidad laboral

pads.content:
Green Joy - Green Grass Straw For A Greener World
Plastic Pollution Challenge: The demand for straws in Ha Long is growing strongly, following the boom of the tourism industry. Quang Ninh province received more than 14 million visitors in 2019, 14% more than 2018. Among 8 million tons of plastic end up in the ocean every year, straws comprise just 0.025 percent, but significantly impacts ocean and water fauna, leading to the deaths of millions of seabirds, hundreds of thousands of sea animals and countless fish each year. 
Innovation: Green Joy is replacing plastic straws with environmentally friendly, natural straws made of Lepironia grass, which is abundant only in the Mekong Delta of Viet Nam. The production process is eco-friendly, with 90% of the process being automated and relying on solar energy, reducing electricity and water consumption and resulting in minimal carbon emissions. They are also piloting AI technologies in the sorting process to automate the production line.
Business Model: Selling to B2B HoReCa customers domestically (D2C) and wholesaler/distributors for export to Europe, America, Japan, South Korean and APAC Revenue split: 90% wholesale, 10% retail.
Market: The market demand for grass straws is growing exponentially, as single-use plastic ones are gradually banned in Europe, the US, Asia, in 2020 -2021. In the US alone, about 500 million straws are used every single day, and according to Statista.com, Eunomia. Straw Wars, 23.5 billion plastic straws were used in Europe as of March 2018. With this, they calculate that the total addressable market for grass straws is about USD 2.5 billion, in which the Service Available Market and Serviceable Obtainable Market is around USD 1 billion and USD 50 million, respectively. This market potential is about 30 times larger than our current manufacturing capabilities, about 36 million straws per year To meet such high market demand, they plan to optimize our production by gradually automating more steps of the production process.
pads.title: Green Joy - Green Grass Straw For A Greener World

pads.content:
Refill Day - Join the Refillution!
Plastic Pollution Challenge: Plastic Pollution Challenge Single-use plastics, are leaked into the environment every minute causing a variety of problems, such as: Choking our rivers and oceans; Killing animals both on land and in the water; Entering our food chain; Creating human health problems. Unfortunately, in many cases there are no convenient alternatives to purchasing products in plastic bottles or bags, which leads to more use of virgin plastics and leaking of plastic waste into the environment.
Innovation: Refill Đây is an innovation synthesizing two existing ideas that no one else has tried before: motorbike delivery and refill stores. In many ways, it is similar to Mailing and DVDs, which is how Netflix started. The issue with refill stores is accessibility of both location and product brand. The refill shops require customers to come to the store with their containers. This is problematic if one lives far from the store as it is easier to just go to the local convenience store. Additionally, these refill shops tend to sell 100% all-natural and expensive brands that most customers have never heard of. By delivering well-known, trusted brands to the consumers’ doorstep, Refill Đây addresses both of these problems and brings an innovative new concept to the marketplace.
pads.title: Refill Day - Join the Refillution!

pads.content:
TILOFE Group - Pig Tractor
Innovation Detail: TILOFE is a group of compost developers working to promote locally sourced compost. The group is also working to promote sustainable farming technique that can help farmers in rural areas who do not have access to mechanical tractor to use simple equipment to soften the ground. A simple wooden frame was made to locate pig on spots on the elevated ground used to grow vegetables. Before planting the vegetable seeds, the pig inside the wooden frame will dig the ground and when the ground softened, the wooden frame and the pig can be reallocated to different spot. This continues until all the elevated ground surfaces are softened before putting the seedlings.
pads.title: TILOFE Group - Pig Tractor

Glink - Social enterprise provide quality health services for LGBTIQ group and equality working environment for gay men
Since 2009, Glink started to attend HIV/AIDS workshops at HIV/AIDS prevention and control Committee (known as HIV/AIDS Prevention and Control Centre). Along with being selected as one of the six most potential groups registered in “Develop Capacity for Self-Help Groups in Viet Nam” under the Health Policy Innovation (HPI) project, funded by the United States Agency for International Development (USAID), Glink began to have adequate capacity and confidence to implement projects from 2010.
