pads.content:
An open call to health workers from the diaspora 
An open call to health workers from the diaspora to help Serbia fight the Coronavirus epidemic - the campaign for inviting all available (Serbian) medical staff from abroad to register if they would be ready to, if needs be, temporarily return and, with their knowledge, experience and skills, help combat the coronavirus epidemic in Serbia. More than 300 medical workers responded to our call to put themselves at the disposal of Serbia’s health system, either in person or via online medical consultations and guidance. (link)
https://www.rs.undp.org/content/serbia/en/home/presscenter/articles/2020/poziv-zdravstvenim-radnicima-iz-dijaspore-da-pomognu-srbiji-u-bo.html
pads.title: An open call to health workers from the diaspora

pads.content:
Temp jobs for older persons
Platform for occasional, temporary or freelance work including a special section for retired persons. The idea is that working contributes to mental, emotional and physical health, and promoting work beyond retirement contributes to the economy as well as fighting ageism.
https://www.danasradim.rs/
pads.title: Temp jobs for older persons

pads.content:
Ministry of Human Resources
Human resources are the greatest productive asset of any country as they are for any company. Bigger companies all have an HR department that comprehensively deals with all aspects of strengthening the human resource base from recruitment, to continued education to keeping the labor force in good health. At the level of national governments there typically is no comprehensive national HR strategy that addresses all components that range from demographic to health and education strategies. These aspects are dealt with by different ministries with often little collaboration. But health and education, for instance, are closely intertwined, with health problems making it more difficult to learn and more educated people typically choosing healthier life styles and staying in better health until very old age. Rather than only focusing on the institutions providing these services (as is currently done), the idea of new Ministry of Human Resources puts people and support for their comprehensive development and empowerment at the center of attention.
pads.title: Ministry of Human Resources

pads.content:
Age Friendly Communities
In order for specific communities to “work” to enable people of all ages to thrive -- including older adults -- every feature should be analyzed through the lens of aging. It doesn’t matter if there is a wonderful community center if there are no roads to reach it. Age Friendly Communities are guided by public-private councils of all the entities touching the lives of older adults. They conduct a comprehensive assessment of needs and desires through community consultations with older adults (using the WHO framework) and then audit the community through the lens of the needs identified. The council identifies top priority needs, and then encourages the partners to work together to fill them, offering seed funding to fill top priority gaps. This is a strategy to coordinate and integrate public and private sector strategies to meet locally-identified needs to successfully age in place.
pads.title: Age Friendly Communities

pads.content:
Belonging Here/Investing Here
As a part of the global Serbia strategy, Serbia should explicitly encourage Diaspora Direct Investments (DDI), based on encouraging Serbian diasporic investment in home regions (through specific targeted investment vehicles). Present levels of DDI are not set to transform some of the key areas of interests (education, science, technology). Unlike standard foreign direct investment or the short-term consumption that remittances boost, DDI establishes a superstructure with significant reach into the target country. This is because emigrant investors are willing to share skills, technology, and intellectual property with their former homes. Diaspora direct investments go beyond financial gains to include strengthened cultural, geographic bonds between diaspora members and home countries. If well explored, Diaspora Direct Investments may serve as a catalyst for further investments and developing social networks globally. Finally, partnerships between Foreign Direct Investment and Diaspora Direct Investments should be part of a broader strategy of Serbia.
pads.title: Belonging Here/Investing Here

pads.content:
Clay Pellets

Fired clay pellets or granules are suitable for hydroponic systems in which all nutrients are carefully controlled in the aqueous solution. Clay granules have a neutral pH and do not contain any nutritional value.
The clay is formed into round granules and baked in rotary kilns. This causes the clay to expand, like popcorn, and become porous. It is lightweight and does not compact over time. The shape of each granule can be irregular or uniform, depending on the brand and manufacturing process.
pads.title: Clay Pellets

pads.content:
Contact tracing app
The idea originated in Singapore through an application called Trace Together, which uses the advantages of a mobile application to help epidemiologists use bluetooth technology to identify a large number of contacts that an infected person had in a very short time. On the basis of bluetooth, the devices exchange fully anonymized mobile ID codes within a range of 2-3m, and the data is stored within the application for the last 20 days or so for the maximum incubation of the virus. The Belgrade company IPification is in contact with the application developers from Singapore and they are working on a potential adaptation of the application for the Serbian market. If the application becomes available for our market, they hope that with the support of mobile operators and the Serbian Government, they will find ways to distribute the application to end users in a short time.
pads.title: Contact tracing app

pads.content:
Glass Stone

This substrate is a 100% natural and recycled growth medium, perfect for vegetables, herbs and flowering plants. The spaces between the recycled glass "rocks" open up more oxygen to the plant roots, while the texture of the rock retains water without drowning the roots. This combination favors the development of the root, which translates into a better absorption of nutrients and water.
In addition, it is a lightweight material and does not dirty the media where it is used.
pads.title: Glass Stone

pads.content:
Rice Husk

Rice husk is a by-product of the milling industry, which is abundant in the rice areas of many countries and offers good properties to be used as a hydroponic substrate. Among its main properties are that it is an organic substrate with a low decomposition rate, it is light, good drainage, good aeration and its main cost is transportation.
The main drawback of rice husk is its low moisture retention capacity and how difficult it is to achieve a good distribution of it when used as a single substrate in hydroponic cultivation.
pads.title: Rice Husk

pads.content:
OLA Filter

The OLA filter offers a solution for communities with access to a water source through pipes, but that is contaminated or unfit for human consumption. Through tiny fibers, all contaminants in the water are trapped.
It should only be connected to the outlet of the "Jet" and the water that comes out of the filter is completely filtered. 
It is an instant filter and it is also portable.
pads.title: OLA Filter

pads.content:
Sistema NFT (Película Nutritiva)

Es una técnica donde los nutrientes se bombean desde un reservorio, y no es necesario manipular las plantas.
Esta técnica garantiza la seguridad de los productos, ya que se produce dentro de grandes invernaderos que regulan la temperatura y también protegen los cultivos de enfermedades o insectos que puedan afectar al cultivo. 
Muchas plantas se pueden cultivar en espacios pequeños, ya que se pueden hacer sistemas horizontales o verticales, dependiendo de la cantidad de espacio disponible.
pads.title: Sistema NFT (Película Nutritiva)

pads.content:
Rocket Stove
Julius Kewir TANGKA
Renewable Energy laboratory, University of Dschang. 
P.O Box 373 Dschang. 
Tel: 677589794 Email: tangkajkfr@yahoo.fr, www.juliustangka.org
Yes, University of Dschang
Too much heat losses from conventional three stone fireplaces and other energy efficient stoves. Our scientific and technological analysis in the laboratory indicates that the most performant energy efficient stoves have an overall energy transfer rate of maximum only 25 % meaning that much of the heat supplied to the cooking pot is wasted. I am proposing a locally made heavily insulated rocket stove with proper heat flow which increases the energy transfer rate efficiency to 40% 
The unit cost if 45,000 Frs with no maintenance costs. However if massed produced with a small iron smelting plant the cost could get down to 25000 frs. Important to state that we recommend sheet metal thickness of 3mm which is quite expensive now in the market but very durable. 
Technical and economic feasibilities both positive. All materials of construction are readily available in most villages. TRL 7-TRL8 
Publication on social media has received over 4000 views and 600 commentaries. Many command are pouring every day. Was recently (two weeks ago) presented in an international conference at the Pan African Climate Justice Alliance in Nairobi, Kenya. We have received another invitation for a conference in Kigali at the PACJA commonwhealth heads of state conference from June 20 to June 25th 2022.
Our laboratory analyses and tests energy efficient stoves for the public. We hardly get any stove with an efficiency of up to 25 percent. This one is 40 percent. This gives even 40 percent wood savings compared, to other stoves.
No specific bottlenecks
Demonstration link: https://web.facebook.com/1296644613/videos/594677861800976/
https://www.facebook.com/julius.kewir.tangka/videos/594677861800976
https://www.facebook.com/julius.kewir.tangka/videos/594677861800976
DIY / open source

pads.content:
Biogas for poultry farms in Bangladesh
IDCOL
biogas@idcol.org
Government of Bangladesh
Establishment of biogas based electricity plants in the poultry farms reduces dependency on fossil fuel used forerunning captive generators. This also ensures bio-security and proper litter management in these farms. Moreover, slurry produced in the digesters as byproduct is a good bio-fertilizer. According to the Livestock Department, currently there are more than 150,000 poultry farms in Bangladesh with about 1,500 farms having more than 20,000 birds population. So, Bangladesh has good potential for biogas based electricity projects. Biogas plants not only provide gas for cooking purpose but also produce organic fertilizer for the crops and fish pond. The program helps reduce the use of biomass fuel for cooking. Till December 2021, IDCOL has financed construction of over 61,200 biogas plants all over the country through its 37 partner organizations. IDCOL finances plants with daily gas production capacity ranging from 1.2 m3 to 25.0 m3 thereby meeting demand of both domestic households and mid-sized dairy and poultry farms. IDCOL currently finances two models of biogas plants: brick-cement based plants and pre-fabricated bio-digester based plants. The program saves 58,750 tons of firewood ever year worth USD 4.6 million and also reduces the use of 52,000 tons of chemical fertilizer worth USD 13.6 million by producing 363,000 tons of organic fertilizer. The program also reduces 234,000 ton CO2 consumption per annum.

Product
pads.title: Biogas for poultry farms in Bangladesh

pads.content:
Mass Cooking, Heating, and Baking Stove
Julius Kewir TANGKA 
Renewable Energy laboratory, University of Dschang. 
P.O Box 373 Dschang. 
Tel: 677589794 
E-mail : tangkajkfr@yahoo.fr, www.juliustangka.org
Yes, University of Dschang
Too much heat losses from conventional three stone fireplaces and other energy efficient stoves. Our scientific and technological analysis in the laboratory indicates that the most performant energy efficient stoves have an overall energy transfer rate of maximum only 25 % meaning that much of the heat supplied to the cooking pot is wasted. I am proposing a locally made heavily insulated cooking, baking, and pipe water heating rocket stove with proper heat flow which increases the energy transfer rate efficiency to 60% 
The unit cost if 250,000 Frs CFA with no maintenance costs. However if massed produced with a small iron smelting plant the cost could get down to 200000 frs CFA. 
Technical and economic feasibilities both positive. All materials of construction are readily available in most villages. However the heat exchanger pipe that heats water and also acts as chimney has to be sourced in big cities 
?Publication on social media has received over 5000 views and 300 commentaries. A few have been installed in Yaounde, and foumban since this stove was developed a year ago. Was recently (two weeks ago) presented in an international conference at the Pan African Climate Justice Alliance in Nairobi, Kenya. We have received another invitation for a conference in Kigali at the PACJA commonwealth heads of state conference from June 20 to June 25th 2022
Our laboratory analyses and tests energy efficient stoves for the public. We hardly get any stove with an efficiency of up to 25 percent. This one is 60 percent. This gives even 60 percent wood savings compared, to other stoves.
No particular bottlenecks however scarcity of cast iron plates might hinder mass production. We however have a cast iron smelting plant now which will soon go operational.
https://www.facebook.com/1296644613/videos/396371598869349/

The remote Power reboot
CONDE Djimé
+224664222179 /Djimeconde@gmail.com
NO
In general case, for remote actions we see in the movies it is all about connected houses. Some households in Africa and most part of the world are wasting energy just because the owner forgot to switch off the power before leaving the place. In France, Out of 250,000 annual fires, 80,000 are of electrical origin. 40% of the victims are children under 9 years old. So to avoid such kind of problem and taking in consideration that power is very expensive ressource that should be well managed, here is a proposition of Power management with a GSM mobile phone. all you need is to send an SMS of instruction that is going to enable the requested action. So if you have to switch off any electrical component remotely, and you just have GSM coverage, this is yours!

pads.content:
Traditional crafts from wood waste
Based on the concept 'waste to wealth', the project aims to produce high-value wooden craft products and decorations. The wood is sourced from woods of small diameter that comes from the thinning of teak wood farms. This small-diameter wood is usually known as 'kayu jaras' and is often thrown away or turned into firewood. 
The Forest Research Institute Malaysia (FRIM) has successfully organised a community programme in the effort to include the local communities in the research and development (R&D) output, particularly on the use, processing, and value-added production process from the thinning of the teak wood farm. 
The community-inclusive impact programme for the initial phase (2019-2020) of the programme was successfully implemented under the 11th Malaysia Plan (RMK11). The programme was also supported by the Malaysian Handicraft Development Corporation (Perlis branch), and the State of Perlis' Department of Forestry. 
The communities that participated in the programme were exposed to the various uses of and skills to make the handicrafts. Today, the cooperative effort has led to the pioneering of highly-skilled creative artists and woodcarvers among the communities in Perlis.
pads.title: Traditional crafts from wood waste

pads.content:
Colectores de Niebla

El sistema Aqualonis es fácil de instalar y es neutro en carbono, ya que no utiliza energía para su funcionamiento. A través de sus mallas ultrafinas de alta tecnología, extraen el agua que está en el aire y la recogen en recipientes que almacenan el líquido asegurando que la calidad sea óptima para el consumo humano. 
Es un método que no solo capta el agua del aire sino que la filtra para que sea apta para el consumo humano. Es perfecto para comunidades que viven en zonas montañosas donde es difícil llevar agua a través de tuberías.
pads.title: Colectores de Niebla

pads.content:
Riego Con Vasijas

Sistema milenario que no requiere energía y utiliza solo el agua que necesitan las plantas. Además, emplea artesanos, contribuye a la seguridad alimentaria, es barato y biodegradable.
A través de un sistema de transpiración, los recipientes proporcionan el agua necesaria a las plantas que se asientan cerca de ellos. Las plantas utilizan el agua que necesitan y tienen una reserva a su alcance, lo que les permite reducir el estrés hídrico en la estación seca. 
Utiliza tecnologías milenarias que permiten reducir el consumo de agua y no tienen ningún impacto ambiental negativo.
pads.title: Riego Con Vasijas

pads.content:
Invasive species-derived jewelry 
Jewelry made from invasive lionfish species in Dominica

Invasive lionfish first entered Dominica in 2011. A local marine protected area and dive shop were granted the rights to hunt the invasive species which is consumed domestically. Additionally, jewelers have been created unique crafts and products out of the species that is known to takeover reefs and reduce biodiversity due to it having no predators if left unchecked. The jewelry is one solution to this species that was originally brought to America from the Indian and Pacific Oceans via aquarium trading.
pads.title: Invasive species-derived jewelry

pads.content:
Generación Eólica Personal o Para Hogares

Esta solución logra producir energía con vientos de intensidad baja, a diferencia de otras turbinas eólicas pequeñas. "Por ejemplo, se puede cargar un ordenador portátil con un viendo de unos 14 kilómetros por hora. La versión más potente -de 600 W- tan solo necesita 28 kilómetros por hora de viento para producir su máximo de energía. La idea es poder ser una turbina compacta que pueda llevarse a lugares de difícil acceso. 
Una de las características que más llama la atención es la capacidad para replegarse y almacenarse en un espacio reducido. Según recogen desde KiteX, todo el sistema cabe en un espacio de 200 x 20 x 20 centímetros.
pads.title: Generación Eólica Personal o Para Hogares

pads.content:
Durian fruit slicer
A grassroot innovation to crack open Malaysia's favourite fruit, the durian.
pads.title: Durian fruit slicer

pads.content:
T-Bot spray
T-Bot Spray is a robotic vehicle controlled through the Internet of Things (IoT) for the purpose of pesticide spraying in agricultural lands, particularly in oil palm plantations. 

Its objectives:
1. to reduce dependence on human workforce
2. to reduce risk of exposure to toxic pesticide that endanger human health
3. to reduce maintenance cost of plantation
Its software: 
T-Bot Spray uses LiDAR technology to recognise and evade barriers. It can be remotely controlled through the use of smartphones or laptops within a radius of 400m that is connected to the Wifi. A high pressure pump and wide spout enable the user to spray the pesticide over a large area. The robot is designed to take into account of operational services; its modular design allows for easy repair and replacement of main components, while its electronic components can be accessed via a sliding mechanism underneath the vehicle.
pads.title: T-Bot spray

pads.content:
Biomaterials to replace disposable food packaging
The project "Malteria" seeks to provide a solution to the problem caused by the massive consumption of disposables in informal food stalls by proposing the replacement of two essential elements in this food sale, a plate for solid food and a bag, both made with biomaterials using as principal material the same waste produced by this sector prevails, such as the corn husks of the tamales, which are also biodegradable.
This project is a collaboration of Taina Campos with Cointya Oviedo.
https://www.tainacampos.com/malteria
pads.title: Biomaterials to replace disposable food packaging

pads.content:
DIY Composting Module
A ‘compo-station’ that converts organic waste into compost while producing high-quality fertilizer. The vermicompost is made of three 19-liter buckets cut into three different heights to create separate levels. The first is where fresh remains directly from the kitchen are placed. the second, holds a variety of red wigglers, white and other earthworms acting as a transition space made of bio-refuse mixed with other bedding materials. The final stage holds a collection of leachate, a liquid that is used in the process for top-dressing development. The workstation is made of standard sized pieces of lumber and of 12mm plywood.
Dowload building manual:
In collaboration with the designer Ariel Rojo, the Goethe Institut, and students from Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México (UNAM) and cultural center Faro Indios Verdes (Mexico City).
https://issuu.com/arielrojo/docs/manual-compostation-english
http://arielrojo.com/Ariel_Rojo/Ariel_Rojo.html
http://www.cultura.df.gob.mx/index.php/indios-verdes
http://www.goethe.de/ins/mx/es/lp.html
http://www.unam.mx/index/en
https://www.tainacampos.com/compostation
pads.title: DIY Composting Module

pads.content:
Community School Water Project 
For the first time, villagers of Kade on Koro islands now have access to clean and safe drinking water. This was all thanks to the funding donated by the EU, Rotary Pacific Water for Life Foundation, and co-financing by the Rural Maritime Development Ministry, VaiWai Natural Artesian Waters, and Latter-day Saints Charities.
Watch more in the link below:
Prior to the project, the villagers used sea and rain water for their washing, cooking, drinking and bathing.
https://fb.watch/gZku_3NGLt/
pads.title: Community School Water Project

pads.content:
Water well System 
The high-school "Brakja Miladinovci" from Skopje, will reduce the consumption of drinking water, for irrigation and maintenance of the school yard and the zoo by renewing the school well.
1. Installation of a pipeline to the yard and to the drinking fountain, where electronic drinking fountains will be installed.
2. Building a drip-by-drip system for garden plantings.
3. Construction of a transparent mini water purification station from natural materials.
https://upshift.lead.org.mk/
pads.title: Water well System

pads.content:
Rain Collection System 
In Skopje, the average annual precipitation in 2020 was about 600 mm, so a roof with 100 m2 can collect an average of 60,000 l of water.
Keeping this in mind, the students of Vlado Tasevski want to reduce the use of potable water for irrigation of the areas around the school.
Collecting and using rainwater in underground containers that they will use to water their own plants in the school yard.
All the equipment that will be installed would also have a permanent application in the implementation of the Hydrotechnics subject taught in the mechanical engineering school in the 2nd, 3rd and 4th year.
www.upshift.lead.org.mk
pads.title: Rain Collection System

pads.content: Conversion of sugarcane bagasse into pulp and paper bag
pads.title: Conversion of sugarcane bagasse into pulp and paper bag

pads.content:
Market Vendor Lauds Biogas Benefits
Two biogas units were installed at the Port Vila City market house to supply methane gas to the food vendors at the food vendors. This biogas is sourced from horse manure that was brought in by the Department of Agriculture and Rural Development several months ago. The waste from biogas production is a liquid that vendors use around the market house as a source of fertilizer. Some of the market vendors also use this in their gardens.
pads.title: Market Vendor Lauds Biogas Benefits

pads.content:
Hand Crafted Artisan Chocolate
Aelan means "Island" in Bislama, the language of Vanuatu. Aelan Chocolate Makers was born from a passion for cocoa and artisanal manufacturing. The business is based in Vanuatu and uses hand-farmed cocoa that is locally grown. The chocolate bars are infused with a variety of flavors such as Turmeric, Chili pepper, ginger, sea salt, Coconut, Nangai, Coffee and Cocoa nibs.
pads.title: Hand Crafted Artisan Chocolate

pads.content:
Used Shipping Containers Transformed into Classrooms
School in Vanuatu upcycles shipping containers into classrooms. Container classrooms are practical and safe solutions for students and can be used in all climatic conditions due to their effective insulation and cooling capability. The cost is also significantly lower than building a permanent concrete structure.
pads.title: Used Shipping Containers Transformed into Classrooms

pads.content:
Broadband Satellite Technology bridges Digital Divide 
3 Link Communication uses broadband satellite technology manufactured by Boeing and launched by SpaceX. The internet connectivity service is powered by a generation geostationary satellite that operates in the Ka-band frequency spectrum. It has a wide coverage that extends to over 25 countries reaching many islands, mountainous and rural regions. Coverage is everywhere in Vanuatu...
Millie Ogden owner of 3 Link Communications
pads.title: Broadband Satellite Technology bridges Digital Divide

pads.content:
Local Restaurant uses Natural Materials for Shelter 
Thatch roofing is renewable, available, and quite durable. It provides excellent insulation and keeps the room in the hot times. In addition, the superb insulation enables the restaurant to save on electricity for heating and cooking. They are much more environmentally friendly than shingles, which are made of metal and can be recycled and reused as shingles on the roofs.
pads.title: Local Restaurant uses Natural Materials for Shelter

pads.content:
Using Stone Walls as a Multipurpose Climate Change Adaptation Tool 
Retaining walls help to enhance overall property value, they are durable and low maintenance, and extremely functional. Stone walls are eco-friendly and optimal because they use minimal space and prevent soil erosion during natural disasters such as flooding. Not only is it used to protect or enhance the value of a property but the most common types of stone walls are used in interior design such as limestone and sandstone.
pads.title: Using Stone Walls as a Multipurpose Climate Change Adaptation Tool

pads.content:
DIY Repurposing Project - Wheel Rim Stove
Most of these old rims often find their way into landfills, but this household has turned it into something new and innovative. More communities located on the maritime and in semi/rural areas are finding out the enjoyment of cooking outdoors. Not only does it cut costs, but it also reduces the consumption of nonrenewable. This innovation is the perfect project for the "Do It Yourself" building crowd ...
pads.title: DIY Repurposing Project - Wheel Rim Stove

pads.content:
Green Fill, Plastic Waste Recycling
A product that turns plastic waste into filament that can be used for 3D Printing.
The Problem:
Plastic bottles pollute our environment - Every year, millions of tons of plastic waste end up in our oceans and landfills. This pollution has a devastating effect on wildlife, and it's also one of the leading causes of climate change. Nevertheless, there are a few local recycling programs in our governorate, but the overall level of participation is low. This means that there is a lot of potential for improvement when it comes to reducing waste and increasing recycling rates.
The Solution:
There are many ways to recycle plastic, and it's not easy. It can be recycled into new products - we can use them to make new products. This machine can take these bottles and convert them into 3D printer filament to make products. Hence, the solution is about developing a 3D printer filament recycling machine which is a device that can recycle plastic bottles into 3D printing filament. This machine consists of two parts: an electronic part and a mechanical part. The electronic part controls the motor that powers the blade, while the mechanical part contains the blade itself.
pads.title: Green Fill, Plastic Waste Recycling

pads.content:
gragjanskibudzet (Civiv Budget)
"Civic Budget" is a basic tool for improving the transparency and accountability of the municipality. It will explain the income and expenses of the municipality during the year, the process of adopting the Budget and the project activities that should be implemented during the year.
The purpose of the preparation of the Citizen's Budget is to ensure greater awareness of the citizens about the municipality's budget in an easier and more accessible way.
https://gragjanskibudzet.mk/
pads.title: gragjanskibudzet (Civiv Budget)

pads.content:
Origins: Personal Incubator
What is Origins?
Origins is a personal incubation; aims to put participants on the driver’s seat on a safe, fun and well-designed learning journey. The destination of their journey is to enter the private sector as entry level employees or as interns by developing their knowledge, skills and attitudes. This program is implemented and owned by a local startup called Doinc for Business Development and Consultation.
All the cultures we know asked the same question themselves: how did the world come to be? How were people and life born? And nowadays, we as humans are asking about how these cultures were born, and by basic logic, you can figure out that we asked about things – cultures, religions, and even the universe itself self- happened many decades, centuries ago and such questions are driven by curiosity and the desire of knowing how did they establish memorable buildings, figures, and ideas that dominated the human history; as Steve Jobs once said, you can only connect dots looking to the past to reshape the future we believe that it is time to ask our self about things happens in our daily life, it is time to back to origins. Going back to our origins means looking for patterns in the experiences that formulated persons who made the harmonious work environment and experience that shaped their attitude, behavior and knowledge; looking for the same elements that those persons had during their lives to be what they had become later. This understanding is not the purpose itself; it is to pave the way for those who can join private sector after that. At Origins, we aim to create and improve the knowledge, attitude, and behavior in a way fits with the participants entry to the Iraqi local market as an employee provides practical value reinforce by theoretical and technique knowledge in their matters of interest.
The main purpose of Origins overall is to provides participants with swords and shield to enter the private sector throughout leading companies. While this version is aiming to the same purpose but through the gate of Doinc as interns.
https://fb.watch/hw3WijhGQW/?mibextid=v7YzmG
Objectives:
1. Validating the program design in matters of learning theory and development of participants. 2. Prepare 10 – 15 participants to enter in this year the private sector as interns or entry level employees by developing their skills, knowledge, and attitude. 3. Talent Acquisition: create a talent pool of 15 participant which we will be interested to hire some of them as interns by the end of this program.
Elements of Origins:
Origins contains three phases:
Origins is supported by a group of experts who will take a role with the program implementation team through sharing their experiences with fresh talents of Origins Program.
pads.title: Origins: Personal Incubator

pads.content:
Implantable Packaging Paper 
The Solution:
Eco Life local solution is creating, developing, and disseminating eco-friendly lifestyle products made of green, clean, durable, and exceptional materials in the pursuit of a zero-waste environment. This solution is meant by producing implantable packaging paper where the end-user can plant the paper after its used. These papers are customizable where the user can select the type of plant that will be planted (Flowers, vegetables, etc.). These papers can be used to wrap different products. This solution is part of the bigger movement towards sustainable life (eco-friendly packaging solutions). This product is made completely by Iraqi hands.
The below pictures illustrate the product after 4 days of planting it:
pads.title: Implantable Packaging Paper

pads.content:
Biodegradable Materials. Plastic Free Solution
Eco Life local solution is creating, developing, and disseminating eco-friendly lifestyle products made of green, clean, durable, and exceptional materials in the pursuit of a zero-waste environment. This solution is meant by developing six biodegradable materials that are alternative to plastic and eco-friendly. These materials can be used in packaging, decoration, furniture and many other applications.
The six biodegradable materials are available in Iraq and it is 100% natural. These materials are: 1) Wheat Waste 2) Wild Herbs 3) Palm Fronds 4) Reeds 5) Barley Waste.
The specifications of this solution is: 1) Natural 2) Plastic free 3) Hydrolyzes 4) Modern durability 5) Free from harmful substances 6) Moldable as desired, either by injection, pressing, or dry molds in order to use it for packaging, decoration, furniture and many other applications.
pads.title: Biodegradable Materials. Plastic Free Solution

South Pacific's largest Solar Power Plant opens in Tonga
The South Pacific's largest solar power plant opens in Tonga. The Sunergise 6MW solar farm is helping lower power costs to Tonga and producing enough renewable energy to offset 18% of Tongatapu's current diesal-powered generation.

pads.content:
Fiji's First Bulumakau (Cow) Bank

Traditional obligations in Fiji are important but can costly, placing strain on family budgets. Friends and innovators Eleazor O'Connor and Ronetava Ronaivakulua have come up with an innovative business concept that combines modern market forces with traditional Fijian practices. 
Fijians can invest in livestock from the Bulumakau (cow) Bank operated by Naisevu Organic Farm in Naitasiri. After purchasing a cow, investors are charged a small monthly fee to raise the cow until they require if for a magiti (traditional feast). For instance, if the investor wishes to sell the cow instead, the business will connect the owner with buyers, helping them invest in their future.
pads.title: Fiji's First Bulumakau (Cow) Bank

Digital Wallet and Payment Acceptance Platform for Women-led Micro and Small Businesses
Mastercard, ygap Pacific Islands & Fintech Pacific partnered with the Australian government and the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade through the #DFATbpp - digital payment platform Dua Pay was piloted with women market vendors in Vuda, Lautoka in Fiji. The payment solution was in action where SMEs like BLISS FIJI Candle Maker and Marama Niu had accepted card and smartphone payments for their products - candles, lipsticks, ice creams, and coconut products. The aforementioned businesses were among the first cohort of women-owned businesses to trial the new payment platform (a system designed specifically to meet the needs of women-led small businesses). Dua Pay offers business owners an easily accessible, convenient, simple, and secure way to accept payments by smart phone, or credit and debit card, so they don't miss out on cashless customers. pads.content:
Red de extensión comunitaria para la protección del Bosque La Montañona
La Mesa Directiva para la Protección y Conservación del Bosque la Montañona es una iniciativa creada en el año 2021 por los líderes propietarios del bosque con el apoyo de la Mancomunidad La Montañona. Está compuesta por actores públicos así como privados que, a través de una actitud solidaria, decidieron unirse y establecer acuerdos comunes para la conservación del área natural en Chalatenango.
Esta es una Solución Medioambiental de Base que ha sido identificada por el Laboratorio de Aceleración del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo en el marco de la Gira de Mapeo de Soluciones Medioambientales de Base.
Tipo de solución
Modelo asociativo para la protección de bosque.
Descripción
Debido a la contaminación ambiental que sufrió el bosque en el contexto de la Guerra Civil en El Salvador, así como también a diversas actividades nocivas que realizan hoy en día los habitantes de la comunidad como tirar basura, tala indiscriminada de árboles para madera, y robo de plantas que han sido sembradas por los propietarios, el bosque se ha dañado considerablemente. A razón de esto, nace la idea de crear una mesa directiva representada por los propietarios mayoritarios de tierras. El principal objetivo de esta asociación es la protección del Bosque La Montañona así como también el lograr mantener una buena gestión del área natural de manera que pueda convertirse en un sitio turístico en Chalatenango.
El proceso de conformación de la mesa directiva siguió la siguiente dinámica: en diciembre de 2021 se invitó a los propietarios de tierras a un taller para definir el acuerdo de conformación de la Mesa Directiva. En marzo del 2022 se realizó la primera reunión en la que asistieron todos los actores, tanto públicos como privados involucrados. La mesa se reúne dos veces al mes para apostarle a un proyecto turístico que involucre a todos los propietarios del bosque. Está compuesta por siete actores, distribuidos de la siguiente manera:
El CORVELAN (155 propietarios - 508 manzanas), Cooperativa de vainillas (85 propietarios - 266 manzanas - grupos colectivos), Municipalidad del Carrizal (174 manzanas - propiedad ejidal), ISTA (192 manzanas), 3 Propietarios privados (368 manzanas).
Las proyecciones futuras que se quieren concretar abarcan la creación de un taller ampliado para presentación del Plan de Trabajo de la Mesa Directiva, la construcción de casetas informativas distribuidas en el territorio que abarca el bosque, y la realización de una reunión en la que se inviten al Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería, Ministerio de Desarrollo Local, y Ministerio de Turismo, así como también a la Dirección General de Ordenamiento Forestal.
¿Qué hace a esta Mesa Directiva diferente?
Frente a la falta de una organización, se decidió crear esta iniciativa con el objetivo de regular el uso de la zona protegida y que no se lleven a cabo prácticas dañinas para el bosque. Se creó la mesa por problemáticas en común, se protege el bosque y no se permite la extracción de madera, así como tampoco la recuperación de espacios verdes a consejo de biólogos y técnicos. Lo que se busca es generar un plan turístico para la montañona sin necesidad de dañar al bosque.
La actitud proactiva de proteger a la montaña le ha dado cuerpo a la mesa directiva. El éxito radica en la voluntad de los actores por trabajar en la protección del bosque. A partir de esto, se está desarrollando un Plan de Manejo de Bosques, y se ha iniciado la búsqueda para encontrar posibles socios estratégicos que puedan apoyar en las gestiones necesarias para el objetivo en común de la mesa.
Otra de las cosas interesantes de la mesa es a parte de la actitud proactiva también una actitud solidaria entre los propietarios, ya que se tiene una visión en común y se busca proteger el bosque bajo consenso de todos. La Mancomunidad cuenta con un fondo para mejoramiento de infraestructura turística.
Para conocer más sobre el trabajo de la Mancomunidad La Montañona también puedes visitar su perfil organizacional, disponible en Appropedia, la wiki de la sostenibilidad:
https://www.appropedia.org/Mancomunidad_La_Monta%C3%B1ona
pads.title: Red de extensión comunitaria para la protección del Bosque La Montañona

pads.content:
Tunantal - Mapa de iniciativas medioambientales

Tunantal es un mapa digital, abierto y gratuito que recolecta información sobre colectivos, comunidades, instituciones, ONG e iniciativas que trabajan en la defensa y cuido del medio ambiente en El Salvador.
Tunantal, que significa “Nuestra tierra” en náhuat, ha sido elaborado por Vivero de Iniciativas Ciudadanas (VIC), en el marco de Cartografías Líquidas, una iniciativa del clúster EUNIC San Salvador —conformado por el Centro Cultural de España en El Salvador (CCESV), la Alianza Francesa de San Salvador y la Società Dante Alighieri—, con apoyo de la Delegación de la Unión Europea en El Salvador, Foro Cultural Salvadoreño Alemán y el Laboratorio de Aceleración del PNUD en El Salvador.
Este mapa es un componente del proyecto Cartografías Líquidas que busca generar espacios de creación colectiva, construir nuevas herramientas, narrativas y alianzas para sensibilizar a la población salvadoreña sobre los efectos devastadores del cambio climático, la deforestación, la escasez y calidad del agua, la pérdida de biodiversidad, el impacto de los monocultivos extensivos, la minería o los residuos que se acumulan en los territorios.
Pueden consultar Tunantal, un mapeo de más de 200 iniciativas medioambientales, junto a su nombre, sitio web y contacto - una herramienta disponible para investigadores, estudiantes, universidades, ONG, instituciones y organismos internacionales - en los siguientes enlaces:
https://www.civics.cc/es/#!/iniciativas?center=13.7527,-88.9577,9&cities=18
pads.title: Tunantal - Mapa de iniciativas medioambientales

Planet 3R - Converting Textiles and Plastic wastes into Eco-friendly products through weaving.
Planet 3R is a social enterprise founded by Adejoke Lasisi and is dedicated to converting textile and plastic waste into eco-friendly products using the 3R method ( Reduce, Reuse, Recycle) to save our planet by weaving them into innovative items. With the vision of creating a sustainable world without textile and plastic wastes, it became necessary for Planet 3R to reduce the landfill space by recycling clothes and plastic bags. As landfill sites are a threat to our environment as well as water supplies. Planet 3R creatively shred old clothes and used plastic (especially pure water sachets) then converts them into finished products using traditional weaving techniques. These finished products include fashion wears, home decors, bags, and accessories.
https://planet3r.org/
pads.title: Planet 3R - Converting Textiles and Plastic wastes into Eco-friendly products through weaving.

pads.content:
Mini grids for safe and affordable water supply to rural households
Description

In Bangladesh, approximately 73 million individuals still lack access to safe water within their own homes. Merely 2% of rural households have the privilege of obtaining water through a piped water supply, meaning that an overwhelming 98% of rural households in Bangladesh are deprived of this convenience. The arduous task of collecting water falls on women and girls, who spend up to two hours each day engaged in this chore. Moreover, majority of households rely on potentially hazardous tube wells. Consequently, rural families, particularly children, face a heightened risk of diarrhoea, malnutrition, and stunted growth.
As a solution to this pressing issue, Max TapWater develops and operates mini grids for the provision of piped water supply, aiming to bring easy, safe, and affordable water to rural households in Bangladesh. By availing
this water supply services, households gain access to a continuous 24/7 water supply directly from their taps, with a minimum allocation of 80-100 litres per person per day across three water points within their homes (kitchen, toilet, and bathroom). Regular water quality testing is conducted to ensure the water's safety. The construction of these grids is not technically complex and relies on locally sourced materials. The innovation lies in the entrepreneurial model employed, which operates within small clusters of households and involves local entrepreneurs who can co-invest. 
Max TapWater was a grant recipient of the Youth Co:Lab Bangladesh's Springboard programme 4.0, a collaborative initiative by the UNDP and Citi Foundation.
pads.title: Mini grids for safe and affordable water supply to rural households

Nhana Sedi is the president of the Associação de Minjeres de Ponta Nova, women who dye fabric and sell it for a living. A tradition from saracule tribe, passed on from generation to generation. Other local tribes such as Fula, Mandinga and Balanta are now all working in this area and learning of this technique of dyeing fabric. pads.content:
Biorremediación de agua
Innovators: Universidad Nacional Santiago Antúnez de Mayolo Río Santa Ana community members (Canrey chico) Instituto de Montaña Rivers and other sources of water which farmers and communities depend on are polluted or have been negatively impacted from mining. Heavy metals in water poses an important threat to health and the environment. The Río Santa community in Perú has been trained in: analizing its water sources with the use of simple technological devices and use a filter system which consists of different water ponds with filtering plants and rocks. Polluted water travels and passes by filtering ponds and levels before arriving to farms or before community use. Communities chose the filtering plants to be used, which generate a bacteria that reduces metal pollution. Water becomes usable for agricultural purposes (not drinking).
https://www.actualidadambiental.pe/sistema-de-biorremediacion-de-agua-usarse-en-8-mil-pasivos-mineros/
pads.title: Biorremediación de agua

pads.content:
Ummo - Access to Public Services in the Wake of COVID 19
Accessing Public Services has always been a daunting experience for the everyday citizen. In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, this has become a critical Public Health challenge. Ummo is a mobile platform that improves how the public accesses government service information, as well as empower participation in the delivery and management of those public services. In 2020, Ummo piloted its service delivery solution at the Matsapha Revenue Office (Tommy Kirk shopping complex). In doing so, Ummo created job opportunities for two agents and saved over a hundred hours of queuing time for its customers. Ummo is on track to launch its mobile app which will host all Public Service information and enable citizens to participate in rating the performance of a given service - increasing the accountability of public administrators and leaders. This is also inline with the government's anti-corruption mandate. By focusing on our society’s public service challenges and creating job opportunities for service agents, Ummo’s “COVID-19 Objective”, as well as its 2021 plans is to aid in the kingdom’s economic recovery plan. Ummo’s SDG targets are to be one of the key drivers of Goal 1, Goal 8 and Goal 16 in the kingdom.
pads.title: Ummo - Access to Public Services in the Wake of COVID 19

pads.content:
Saerd Centre Limited
Saerd Centre are a company who specialize in a multi-dimensional approach to flood control in Kampala city. The organization was founded in 2017 with a focus of developing innovative appropriate solutions and offer practical training, their belief is that innovation is a vital part of development of new industries and the industrial transformation to create a smarter society in Africa. Flash floods affect many parts of Kampala city causing heavy rainfall, poorly maintained drainage systems, waste disposal in drainage channels, silting in natural channels and improper house planning of city suburbs contribute to the flooding. In 2020 alone Kampala experienced over 4 deadly flash floods which have left more than two dead and caused not only city-wide disruptions on travel and businesses but also destruction of properties and wide spread of water-borne diseases. Saerd’s main goal is to develop multi-dimensional structural and non-structural approach to control occasional floods and simultaneously mitigate future flood occurrences, currently the existing flood control measures include desilting of the channels to curb the floods regular maintenance of drainages but are inadequate. Saerd’s solution entails the structural measures which include water harvesting & multi-storage (i.e., underground reservoirs, drainage pumps). While there is a possibility of channeling this water to Lake Victoria, it can serve water needs in other sectors such as urban agriculture and industries. Moreover, underground water storage systems are one of the most sustainable approaches that has worked in other countries, for example, the one of Tokyo called the floodwater cathedral hidden 22 meters underground. The integration of the public-private partnership (PPP Model) into Saerd’s solution to drive capacity and sustainability is vital for providing much-needed support for monitoring, management and facility use. The following can be expected at the end of the project: 1. A feasibility study plan for flood control and storm water management of the Kampala city. 2. A Master plan on comprehensive flood and storm water management entailing structural and non-structural measures. 3. Designed and constructed multi storage, underground tanks/reservoirs, drainage pumps and Water harvesting system. 4. Addition of new opportunities in the job market. 5. Development of a new flood forecasting and warning system.
https://saerd.org/
pads.title: Saerd Centre Limited

pads.content:
LEDABANE ou « fini le plastique ».
La prolifération des déchets plastiques dans les centres urbains et mêmes ruraux est l'un des plus grands problèmes environnementaux qui surviennent l'humanité fait face aujourd'hui. En effet les déchets plastiques, outre l'insalubrité qu'ils causent dans l'environnement, intoxiquent les animaux, bloquent l'infiltration des eaux, asphyxient les plantes sur lesquelles ils se déposent, remplissent les fleuves, les puits et les marigots. C'est pour répondre à cette préoccupation que l'Association Nigérienne Pour la Promotion de l'Invention et de l'Innovation (ANPII) a mis au point un nouveau type de poubelle incinérateur mobile. Ce dispositif d'assainissement est appelé « LEDABANE » dans la langue locale Zarma qui signifie en français « fini le plastique ».
pads.title: LEDABANE ou « fini le plastique ».

pads.content:
Ingeniería Solar y Electrificación 

El programa faro de Barefoot College se dedica a la capacitación en ingeniería solar y posterior electrificación de comunidades aisladas en diferentes áreas de Guatemala. De igual forma han realizado la introducción del programa ENRICHE como una herramienta que engloba distintas temáticas para el empoderamiento de la mujer indígena. 
El proceso va más allá de la mera transferencia tecnológica, se trata de una herramienta de empoderamiento. Las estudiantes ganan confianza en sí mismas, sintiendo que ellas también son capaces de hacerlo y aportar a sus comunidades.
pads.title: Ingeniería Solar y Electrificación

pads.content:
Destiladora artesanal de plantas medicinales

Como parte de la Minga de Innovación del Laboratorio de Aceleración PNUD, y con el fin de encontrar soluciones a problemáticas que enfrentan las yerbateras de la Plataforma Primero de Mayo en el mercado de San Roque, estudiantes de la ESFOT de la Escuela Politécnica Nacional han desarrollado un prototipo de destiladora artesanal que permite evitar el desecho de la excedencia de plantas medicinales. Esta destiladora permite obtener aceites esenciales y agua perfumada, los cuales tienen un buen valor comercial.
pads.title: Destiladora artesanal de plantas medicinales

pads.content:
Proceso de compostaje para aprovechar residuos orgánicos

Como parte de la Minga de Innovación del Laboratorio de Aceleración 
PNUD, y con el fin de encontrar soluciones a problemáticas que enfrentan
las yerbateras de la Plataforma Primero de Mayo en el mercado de San 
Roque, estudiantes de la ESFOT de la Escuela Politécnica Nacional han 
planteado un proceso de compostaje para generar abono natural y 
aprovechar residuos orgánicos, generando además ingresos extra a favor 
de las yerbateras.
pads.title: Proceso de compostaje para aprovechar residuos orgánicos

pads.content:
Biol: abono orgánico para nutrir cultivos

El Instituto Nacional Autónomo de Investigaciones Agropecuarias en convenio con el Gobierno Provincial de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas presentan una alternativa orgánica para nutrir y desarrollar los cultivos de la zona. Con el objetivo de promover y estimular el desarrollo de las plantas (follaje, raíces y floración), en la Estación Experimental de Santo Domingo (INIAP), se preparó de manera fácil esta mezcla de estiércol y otros materiales orgánicos que son ingresados en un tanque que posteriormente se sella dejando una manguera que permite la salida de gases. De esta manera se consigue un producto sencillo de realizar que aportará a los programas de nutrición de los cultivos.
pads.title: Biol: abono orgánico para nutrir cultivos

pads.content:
Green Sewing
Green Sewing is a socio-environmental startup that aims to recycling tarpaulin advertising posters into products unique creative and eco-friendly (Shopping bag, Pencil case,backpacks ...). The project responds to the problem identified, namely the absence of promotion and use of advertising posters (tarpaulins) after their expiration, and the lack of sustainable alternatives. Our environmental impact is manifested in the fact that we give a second life to a material at the end of the cycle to produce new reusable and sustainable products to encourage people to stop using plastic bags for a single use, on the other hand we help housewives and low-income women by ensuring them a job and a salary. https://web.facebook.com/Green.sewing.4/videos/1093601367745275
pads.title: Green Sewing

pads.content:
Eco’save
This project consists of recovering used oils from fried foods into soap/detergents, this comes in view of the liquid discharges which contain a high oil and grease (high pollution rate).
pads.title: Eco’save

pads.content:
Hidroeléctrica comunitaria Nebaj

El proyecto Microcentral Hidroeléctrica Comunitaria Batzchocolá, ubicado en la comunidad del mismo nombre, forma parte del modelo de microempresas comunitarias de energía renovable que Semilla de Sol impulsa y asesora en comunidades pobres, rurales e indígenas de Guatemala. El proyecto tiene como objetivo dotar de servicio energético eléctrico a 3 comunidades de la región. 
El proyecto tiene capacidad de generación de 90 kW y su administración, operación y mantenimiento está a cargo de la Asociación Hidroeléctrica de Desarrollo Integral Norte del Quiché (ASHDINQUI).
pads.title: Hidroeléctrica comunitaria Nebaj

pads.content:
Aya Hamioud Project 
A project which consists in using a product resulting from the manufacture of butter, which is (buttermilk), it is considered as a waste rejected by dairy factories in Algeria and which is one of the most important causes of pollution of the water in the country. Its use is very wide, either in food (cheeses, creams, juices, etc.) or in cosmetics. The solution: by taking it up in many factories and combining it with the oil produced by recycling poultry products, Aya will make a natural soap that is useful for the skin and even the hair.
pads.title: Aya Hamioud Project

pads.content:
Rafeek
This is an Algerian application, made by Algerians, completely free to meet daily expenses, with Rafeek you do your shopping as before, but less expensive, thanks to our network of partners with whom we negotiate every day new discounts, whether you go to the doctor, to the gym or simply for a family outing or with friends, Rafeek accompanies you to find the best places at the best prices. With the Rafeek LOYALTY CARD spending has never paid you so much.
pads.title: Rafeek

pads.content:
Vertmonde: reciclaje de E-Waste

El manejo inadecuado de residuos eléctricos y electrónicos resultan altamente contaminantes para las personas y el Medioambiente. Vertmonde realiza una gestión adecuada de estos residuos, contribuyendo al consumo ético y sostenible de tecnología: se reduce la contaminación ambiental, se evitan problemas de salud y se protegen recursos naturales. Su programa de reciclaje especializado ofrece servicios tanto para hogares como para empresas, instituciones públicas, fabricantes e importadores. Además, a través de su servicio Vertmonde Box ofrecen servicio a domicilio para recoger residuos electrónicos.
pads.title: Vertmonde: reciclaje de E-Waste

pads.content:
Hidroeléctrica comunitaria La Taña

El colectivo ha enfocado sus esfuerzos en dar acompañamiento, asesoría y oportunidades de financiamiento a comunidades del área rural para que puedan desarrollar proyectos hidroelectricos de pequeña escala, con el objetivo de generar energía para dichas comunidades. 
El proyecto considera el costo de las horas de trabajo donadas por los miembros de la comunidad para hacer realidad la construcción de las hidroeléctricas.
pads.title: Hidroeléctrica comunitaria La Taña

pads.content:
AGADJI DETECTOR
Agadji detecteur est un appareil Electronique qui assure la sécurité domestique. En cas de fuite d'une bouteille de gaz (le gaz utilisé pour les préparations de plats, etc.). Cet appareil va fermer automatiquement la bouteille et prévient l'intéressé via un appel téléphonique et un son d'alarme. En cas d'incendie, l'appareil va prévenir via un appel téléphonique le concerné, dépasser un délai de 30 secondes sans éteindre l'incendie, ce dernier va automatiquement appeler les sapeurs-pompiers via un appel téléphonique tout en n'indiquant vocalement le numéro de porte de la maison, le quartier etc. pour faciliter sa localisation.
En cas de fuite d'une bouteille de gaz, l'appareil fermer la bouteille et prévient l'intéressé via un appel téléphonique. En cas incendie dans une habitation, l'appareil averti les sapeurs-pompiers.
pads.title: AGADJI DETECTOR

pads.content:
FINAGROS : FERME INTEGREE AGROALIMENTAIRE SOLAIRE
Le Projet FINAGROS a pour objet de créer un écosystème favorable à l'épanouissement des petits producteurs et des associations rurales dans les domaines des énergies renouvelables, de l'environnement, de l'agriculture, de l'élevage, de la transformation et de la conservation agroalimentaire. Il cible ainsi les opportunités locales d'emploi et l'employabilité des jeunes et des femmes grâce au développement des ressources locales de formation professionnelle et entrepreneuriale correspondant aux besoins du marché à travers les chaînes de valeur pérenne grâce à : • L'énergie solaire • L'eau • Développement des compétences Pour aboutir à la sécurité alimentaire, l'employabilité des jeunes et des femmes, la lutte contre la pauvreté et l'insécurité 
- Utilisation de l'énergie solaire et de nouvelles technologies (gestion rationnelle de l'eau, production d'engrais organique, préservation de l'environnement...) - Interaction des différentes chaînes de valeur(agricole, avicole, piscicole, ruminants, petites transformations agroalimentaire) -Création d'une plateforme en ligne de mise en relation producteurs & clients et information sur le marché -Promotion de l'éthique et de l'intégrité de la profession et de la qualité des services rendus - Respect et implication du genre -Formations métiers qualifiantes -Développement (entreprenariat, incubation, mise en relation, suivi et accompagnement)
pads.title: FINAGROS : FERME INTEGREE AGROALIMENTAIRE SOLAIRE

pads.content:
MoebiusFarm automation for greenhouses
The MoebiusFarm is an IoT solution for automation of watering and ventilation for greenhouses. It is a hardware/software complex with mobile app that controls temperature, humidity of air and soil, and other parameters, and switches on ventilators / watering systems depending on the type of vegetables.
It helps to support agricultural activities remotely for those who have summer houses in the village.
pads.title: MoebiusFarm automation for greenhouses

pads.content:
Biogas Solution: Farmers turning cows' manure into energy (creating the perfect closed loop) 
With minimum resources available, Mr. Atef Azkoul is making generating biogas from cows’ manures. He learnt about the method through the internet and started applying the experiment within his farms using a basic digester.
Because of the high prices of gas and fuel, biogas provided the perfect solution for a raising challenge.
Moreover, Mr. Azkoul is creating the perfect closed loop by using manure to generate energy and using the remaining liquid as a fertilizer, liquid compost. The compost is applied to crops which are then fed to cows who produce the manure that is used in the “digester” for biogas. 
Mr. Atef is one of many farmers from different Syrian provinces who are following the same practise.
pads.title: Biogas Solution: Farmers turning cows' manure into energy (creating the perfect closed loop)

Cottage industry development on Taveuni Island, Fiji

https://pacificfarmers.com/cottage-industry-development-on-taveuni/
Tutu Rural Training Centre on the island of Taveuni has established a food development unit to encourage cottage industries on the island. Cottage industries are small-scale, home-based manufacturing businesses. pads.content: Sanuva is an initiative of young Malian expatriates who have created a small business whose aim is to contribute to a better management of plastic waste through a change in the behaviour of the population. It consists of carrying out awareness campaigns and providing the population with bins for sorting waste at source. The company receives the waste through the EIGs (Economic Interest Groups), then divides it into categories for export to different countries where it is processed in industry. In the experimental phase, this company plans to embrace the transformation of organic waste in the future.

pads.content: In the Faladiè SEMA-Bamako district of Faladiè, the Lab team discovered a small company called "MAP Action" which has developed an application that provides timely information on uncontrolled waste disposal sites. Also, this application allows the mapping of dumps and facilitates decision making regarding their management. It plans to mobilise statistical data in this sector using this application, which uses satellite and UAV images. This will make up for the lack of statistics on waste production in the city of Bamako.

pads.content:
Plogga India
Plogging is an act of kindness towards the environment, where you jog and pick up trash to challenge the everyday use of plastic and understand the journey of waste right from when it's produced to its ultimate disposal. It's a more than 2-year-old sustainability initiative based in New Delhi. It is inspired from the plogging movement that began in Sweden in 2016. It's a pure behaviour change and action-oriented activity that focuses on exercise and promotes the idea of sustainable cities and communities through a transformative act of jogging and picking up trash. The initiative tracks kilometers covered, calories burnt, the amount of segregated trash (recyclable and non-recyclable) picked up during the drive as tangibles to measure impact. The central aim is to build communities through plogging that adopt sustainable waste practices like segregation of waste at source into wet and dry, composting, adopting a single-use plastic-free life, among others. A significant part of this initiative also deals with empowering youth and communities with agency and capacity-building so that they can encourage others societies to rally for cleanliness and proper waste management practices. 
https://www.instagram.com/ploggaindia/
12
pads.title: Plogga India

Plateforme e-commerce-agricole
Le commerce agricole constitue : - La source de revenus directs ou indirects de près de 80% de la population (INS, « Agriculture et conditions de vie des ménages », 2014) ; - Il représente 42,2% du PIB national entre 2000 et 2010 ; Manque de données sur Agrobusiness au Niger; A l'origine, une solution conçue en réponse à l'impact de la pandémie COVID 19 sur les petits producteurs Vulnérabilité à la propagation du virus du fait de leur dépendance aux petites transactions commerciales informelles (marchés) Accès limité aux marchés avec les mesures édictées par le gouvernement Mais identification d'un impact positif sur les territoires des petits producteurs (conservation, stockage) . Compétitivité pour le secteur agricole au niveau international Bancarisation des producteurs (surtout des petits) est encouragée, en façonnant un mécanisme fiable, simple et délocalisé grâce au réseau de la Maison du Paysan. -Traçabilité des flux bancaires du secteur agricole sera améliorée, permettant également de recevoir des informations en temps réel sur les revenus générés par le secteur ; -Revenu des petits producteurs sera sécurisé, le revenu des producteurs n'est plus amputé et leur disponibilité pour augmenter la production est assurée ; -Digitalisation de l'économie est encouragée : en proposant une solution numérique (sur la base d'une solution cartographiée par le Lab de plateforme de e-commerce), facile d'accès et disponible sur l'ensemble du territoire. également de recueillir des informations en temps réel sur les revenus générés par le secteur ; -Revenu des petits producteurs sera sécurisé, le revenu des producteurs n'est plus amputé et leur disponibilité pour augmenter la production est assurée ; -Digitalisation de l'économie est encouragée : en proposant une solution numérique (sur la base d'une solution cartographiée par le Lab de plateforme de e-commerce), facile d'accès et disponible sur l'ensemble du territoire. également de recueillir des informations en temps réel sur les revenus générés par le secteur ; -Revenu des petits producteurs sera sécurisé, le revenu des producteurs n'est plus amputé et leur disponibilité pour augmenter la production est assurée ; -Digitalisation de l'économie est encouragée : en proposant une solution numérique (sur la base d'une solution cartographiée par le Lab de plateforme de e-commerce), facile d'accès et disponible sur l'ensemble du territoire.

pads.content:
Pointillism: Batik block printing
The innovation "Blok Batik Boleh Ubah 'Pointillisme', or flexible Pointillist Batik block is an introduction to a new method of making batik blocks to conserve and sustain the batik heritage in Malaysia. The product is flexible and is capable of creating multiple batik patterns or designs based on single block use. 
Specifications
It uses the basic batik concept of 'Point'. The nail arrangements on the block are changeable to create different point-based designs. To create the batik print, the batik maker will only need to insert the metal plate according to the desired designs using the same batik block. The block is lightweight and easy to use. 
Impact
The block will help local batik makers to increase their creativity and productivity. This will raise their competitiveness with imported batik. 
This innovation will also benefit students from textile and fashion programmes by leveraging on the ease-of-use in creating new batik designs. 
Results
The block has been tested by local batik entrepreneurs. The blocks will be distributed to the local batik makers, and training sessions will be held on the use and handling of the block beginning September 2022.
pads.title: Pointillism: Batik block printing

pads.content:
Smart vanilla farming
In 2018, the total global vanilla trade was worth USD 1.47 billion, whereby 1kg of vanilla was valued between USD 350 - 500. Madagascar was the major exporter amounting to 60.1% of total exports, while Indonesia's exports stood at 5.56%. Indonesia's capacity to produce vanilla made it clear that Malaysia was also capable of producing and exporting high grade vanilla. Yet, the vanilla industry is wrought with problems: issues of ethics and sustainability, low yield at 40% - making vanilla one of the world's scarcest goods. The vanilla farm pioneered by Kairos Agriculture is the first smart vanilla farm with patent technology in Malaysia that integrates Internet of Things (IoT), artificial intelligence (AI), big data application, nanotechnology and machine learning to sustainably grow vanilla. Its objectives are to: 1. grow sustainable and ethically produced vanilla crops 2. leverage agritech to encourage more young people to venture into agriculture business 3. create jobs and improve the living standards of B40 and disadvantaged groups. Kairos partners with local institutions for research to improve and enhance crop farming towards optimum quantity and quality of vanilla planting. The group also has a portable module that can be built in schools collaboratively to help the school sustain an independent income stream with a buyback scheme. It also adopts various energy and resource-saving technologies that ranges from: 1. chemical-free planting, with the use of recycled crop residue as compost 2. production of Efficient Microbes (EM) with the fruit waste collected from local wet market 3. automated irrigation system that is activated according to the weather 4. rainwater harvesting system and full-LED usage in the farm.
pads.title: Smart vanilla farming

As part of a research thesis, innovator has developed a brick prototype using cocoa husks and mud, for construction use in Bucay canton, located in Guayas, Ecuador. Several tests have been carried out so that the materials meet the necessary requirements demanded by construction regulations. Farmers from Bucay discard cocoa shells, since they are only interested in marketing its nut; while the mud is used for the manufacture of handicrafts. The problem is trying to address is the fact that the residential constructions of the sector use materials such as cane and wood and this brick can offer a non-polluting and sustainable construction solution to people with limited resources as well as livelihoods.

pads.content:
Biocompost- external service
In Quito, around 2,000 to 2,400 tons of garbage are generated daily. That means that every 2 months we Quiteños can fill the Atahualpa Olympic Stadium with garbage. Likewise, the production of garbage in the city continues to grow exponentially.

More than half of the garbage we generate is organic waste and it can be easily decomposed. That is, they do not need large amounts of energy to transform. Despite this, they are a source of pollution since if they are not used correctly they produce methane (CH4), which is 25 times more polluting than carbon dioxide (CO2).

Quito lacks an effective treatment for the management of organic waste. This solution was found when ideating about how herbalists could increase their livelihoods and use their surplus medicinal plants in a way that it didn ́t get wasted. Composting is an interesting alternative, but for them, it requires transportation from the market to their plots to compost and time, which is very scarce. Outsourcing their organic waste may be a more viable alternative, and in return they would get a valuable material so needed for their orchards.
pads.title: Biocompost- external service

pads.content:
Light Electric Vehicle Based Virtual Power Plant

SolShare
LM Tower (2nd Floor), Ka/87,
Joar Shahara Bazar Road Vatara, Dhaka–1229, Bangladesh
Contact: +880 1708 458769
Email: contact@solshare.com 
Yes
Although energy access in Bangladesh has drastically improved in recent years in terms of the number of connections, the challenge of today mainly lies in assuring quality service for those connections at an affordable cost to the consumer and the government. Load shedding was a common phenomenon in the past, but since the latter half of 2022, its rate of occurrence has been on the rise again. The fear of load shedding is further increasing with the number of energy-hungry electric vehicles on the roads. While the adoption of renewable energies is slowly improving, their potential is far from utilised.
A discussion white paper by Solshare (link to the paper shared below), a climate-tech startup based in Dhaka, Bangladesh, explores the role of electric rickshaws (three-wheeler vehicle prevalent in Bangladesh), also known as e-rickshaws, in virtual power plants (VPPs) as an innovative solution to the above problems. Virtual power plants are cloud-based systems that manage and optimize various distributed energy resources such as solar panels, batteries, electric vehicles, and, in this case, rickshaws. By connecting and coordinating multiple individual rickshaws, the rickshaw VPP acts as a decentralized energy storage and generation source. The International Energy Agency recognizes VPPs as crucial for achieving a carbon-neutral or net-zero economy.
Through the VPP, e-rickshaw batteries can be efficiently charged and discharged, their capacity aggregated, and their energy usage optimized based on grid conditions, demand, and other factors. This allows e-rickshaws not only to serve as transportation vehicles but also to contribute to the stability and resilience of the electricity grid as distributed energy resources, facilitating the integration of renewable energy.
The solshare paper highlights that, at the end of a driver's day, approximately 25% to 30% of battery charge remains. Using the VPP, this excess electricity can be sold to the grid during peak demand hours and repurchased during low-demand periods, enabling the driver to earn extra income while helping stabilize the grid and address load shedding issues. The cost of fully charging the vehicle at night is much cheaper for the driver compared to selling electricity during peak demand, creating a financial advantage.
One of the significant advantages of VPPs is that they provide grid operators with a comprehensive understanding of the combined load. Additionally, they offer precise information about specific distribution lines, known as feeders. Unlike traditional load-shedding methods that consider only sanctioned load levels, VPPs take into account real-time actual load data. This enhanced visibility of the actual load enables more connections to remain online during periods of low load and allows feeders with renewable energy feed-in points to remain connected, promoting increased integration of renewable energy into the grid.
Affordability is another key benefit of VPPs. Participation in VPPs provides direct compensation to homes and businesses. Additionally, VPPs reduce wholesale energy and fuel costs by shifting demand to low- or no-marginal-cost resources, as opposed to relying on expensive peaking resources.
The technology builds on what is readily available today. The components and mechanisms of the Rickshaw VPP are
detailed in the image below.
The solution builds on readily available technology.
https://solshare.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Rickshaw-VPP-White-Paper.pdf
DIY / open source
pads.title: Light Electric Vehicle Based Virtual Power Plant

pads.content:
The search for local initiatives brought the Lab team to Banankoroni, a neighbourhood on the outskirts of Bamako. In this neighbourhood, we met a young, ambitious entrepreneur who has set up an informal solid plastic waste purchasing business. This company consists of a grinder and a washing basin. It buys solid plastic waste which is sorted, crushed, washed and bagged by the few men and women who work there. This plastic waste is destined for processing at the plant in Ghana.
The entrepreneur wants to develop this business by recovering plastic waste because, according to him, the sanitation sector presents real economic opportunities.
pads.title: Shredding and export of solid plastic waste

pads.content: This initiative brings us to Timbuktu in the north of Mali where an artist uses plastic waste and scrap metal to create works of art (animals, tables etc). This initiative is aesthetically pleasing while at the same time making a change in behaviour with respect to solid waste management. These recycled works of art are much appreciated by the visitors who go there.
pads.title: Manufacture of art objects from waste plastics

pads.content: In search of local initiative, the team met an ambitious young man named Harouna who produces fuel and gas from plastic waste. From a device comprising two gas cylinders connected to each other and a barrel by a coupling, it produces fuel and gas after heating the plastic waste contained in the barrel to a high degree. Its objective is to eventually produce electricity from plastic waste.
pads.title: Energy production from waste plastics

pads.content: The CoGeNeT cooperative transforms plastic waste into paving stones. The objective of these young people is to promote sanitation in the neighbourhoods through the manufacture of ecological paving stones. The process consists of putting the plastic waste in a tank placed on the fire. When plastics are melted, sand is added and the whole thing is stirred. The paste obtained is placed in a mould and after a few minutes a 5 to 10cm thick paving stone is obtained.
pads.title: Recycling of plastic waste into paving stones

pads.content:
The Hand Washing Machine
The Washing Machine Project is a social enterprise dedicated to alleviating the burden of hand washing clothes globally, a burden that often falls on women and girls.
The challenge: during displacement, women and girls often bear the burden of hand washing, spending up to 8 hours per week hand washing and consuming up to 40 liters per washing cycle.
The solution: a single, standalone, off the grid washing machine (WM) that will be affordable, portable and accessible for everyone. The WM reduces the washing cycle time to 30 minutes instead of 60-80 min, resulting in time saved which can be put towards more productive uses and will reduce the amount of water used per washing cycle to 10 liters instead of 20-40 liters, addressing the water-scarce conditions in IDP camps.
Target population: Displaced Women and girls in Iraq

pads.content:
COVID-Venture
Knowledge Gate Organization looks forward to a sustainable economy in Iraq. 
Private sector companies are severely impacted by covid-19 lock-down. The impact varies from businesses who lost part of their market share to others who closed. This led to increased unemployment. The still existing businesses were impacted due to gaps in their administrative systems. 
On the other side, other businesses started at the time of lock-down, they are entirely costumed to match the requirements of lock-down, and they may not be useful in the post-pandemic period.
COVID-venture is a start-up training programme that gathers most common systemic problems from the struggling private sector companies, then trains youth entrepreneurs on problem solving methodologies, and business model. The solutions come in shape of a business model that is to be studied and rated by the companies, each company adopts one project that matches its scope and helps it operate better and sustain.
