pads.content:
Aid Card
Aid Card facilitates aid/grants administration to the vulnerable, hungry, displaced, poor and people living below a dollar per day. According to the UN, over 2.7 million people are displaced in Nigeria and 60% are living below the poverty line of US$1.90 a day. In Africa, about 18 million people are displaced and globally, 821 million people are undernourished, and depend mostly on aid/grants from government and non-governmental agencies to survive. Leveraging a growing network of vendors, government agencies, non-governmental organizations, development agencies and philanthropists are able to administer aid/grants to their intended beneficiaries conveniently without the risks and high costs associated with typical processes of aid delivery. As a lot of vulnerable populations do not engage in the formal economy and might not have bank accounts to receive aid especially cash programmes, Aid Card meets them where they are and provides them a way to receive aid when needed. Aid-givers can also track and see how distributed aid/grant is expended by their beneficiaries in Realtime.
http://aidcard.com.ng/
tags: the vulnerable members of our society
pads.title: Aid Card

pads.content:
3D-Printing to Support the Circular Economy
Generar productos comercializables (y democratizar acceso a ellos) a través de métodos de procesamiento de plásticos reciclados como la trituración y la granulación, y de métodos de fabricación: la inyección, el prensado y la impresión 3D de plástico.
https://utp.ac.pa/utp-inaugura-centro-de-fabricacion-para-la-innovacion-tecnologica
pads.title: 3D-Printing to Support the Circular Economy

pads.content:
Innovación y Valorización del PET
Transformar botellas plásticas, obtener subproductos o productos terminados que tengan una utilidad y/o funcionalidad, principalmente en el ámbito de la construcción, que facilite su comercialización. Limpiezas de playa de Marea Verde indican que el 30% de los residuos de un sólo río (Matías Hernández) son plásticos reciclables. Estos materiales son valorizados y comercializados. Los ingresos se destinan 100% a cubrir el salario del equipo de personas que labora en el mismo.
pads.title: Innovación y Valorización del PET

pads.content:
Goodbye Plastics
Campaña con PYMES para el no uso de plásticos de un sólo uso. Previene que los plásticos contaminen ríos, mares y océanos
https://www.marviva.net/es/chaoplasticodesechable
pads.title: Goodbye Plastics

pads.content:
Resocialization and Recycling of Household, Business and Agriculture Waste
Sistema Penitenciaiario: Ha ahorrado al sistema penitenciario más de 700 mil dólares anuales en reincidencia penal
Personas en riesgo social: Es la empresa más grande de reinserción laboral en Panamá y la única gestora de desechos orgánicos en el municipio de Panamá y San miguelito
https://geoazul.com/
pads.title: Resocialization and Recycling of Household, Business and Agriculture Waste

pads.content:
Garbage Can made of Washing Machine
Garbage can made of Washing Machine to protect organic waste from being spread all over the place by dogs.
pads.title: Garbage Can made of Washing Machine

pads.content:
Plastic House with a Hammock
Plastic house with a hammock made in Paritilla to show how plastic could be put to good use. This project was developed together with a Peace Corps Volunteer in the community 4 years ago.
pads.title: Plastic House with a Hammock

pads.content:
BBQ stand using broken fridge as a base 
BBQ stand made by Linio Ballesteros, a school worker in Isla Cañas. He mentioned how peasants have to use their creativity because resources are limited in their communities, but they know how to adapt. This BBQ stand was made using an old fridge that got broken in the school. It makes the perfect high to to the best BBQ cooking.
pads.title: BBQ stand using broken fridge as a base

pads.content:
Chicken Water Feeder made of Used Tires
These tires were used by Aida to create this chicken water feeder higher than the dogs could reach, as they were always drinking the chicken water.
pads.title: Chicken Water Feeder made of Used Tires

pads.content:
Nitumeni Errands/Service
Nitumeni, which means "Send Me' is a start-up by a group of young women that seeks to contribute to the reduction in the spread of COVID-19. The initiative operates by encouraging people and business owners to order or deliver their food and non-food items through a courier company being operated by a group of female youths. They hope to reduce footprint in the market places thereby contributing to the reduction on the spread of COVID-19. The team currently uses social media to run errands for clients across Zambia's capital city of Lusaka.
The solution was identified during a solutions safari to identify community response to the COVID-19 challenge. The SME then participated in the Innovation Challenge that AccLab Zambia conducted in 2020 in partnership with partners from the government - National Technology Business Centre (NTBC) and the Zambia Information and Communication Technology Authority (ZICTA)
https://www.facebook.com/nitumeniZM/
pads.title: Nitumeni Errands/Service

pads.content:
Agricultural Management Platform and Farm Operating System
Guru is an integrated agriculture marketing and management platform that connects producers and buyers via a data driven digital marketplace. It may present a solution to some of the supply chain disruptions due to COVID-19 in the medium to longer term and provide a solution that assists farmers in improving their productivity.
pads.title: Agricultural Management Platform and Farm Operating System

pads.content:
Laboratoria, web training for women
Laboratoria is an organization that provides a web development training program to young women who have not had access to quality higher education. In an intensive course, Laboratoria teaches participants to build web pages and applications, as well as helping them prepare for a job at a technology company. The goal is for young women to build successful careers and inspire thousands more women to follow in their footsteps. According to the organization, in Mexico there are more than five million young women who have not had the opportunity to access higher education and are not currently working either. On the other hand, with more and more Mexicans connecting to the Internet, the digital sector is growing and will continue to expand. In this context, the purpose of Laboratoria is to make web programming an agent of change for thousands of young women in Latin America.
Found through Laboratorio para la Ciudad, Mexico City's former innovation lab.
https://www.laboratoria.la/
pads.title: Laboratoria, web training for women

pads.content:
Local home safe food and pharma ordering and delivery service

https://wifetch.com/
pads.title: Local home safe food and pharma ordering and delivery service

pads.content:
Building Blocks from Glass Bottles 
Domingos da Silva began an initiative to collect glass bottles which are causing harm to the enviroment and physical harm to citizens. Using his knowledge, he has began to garner support from volunteers to gather bottles ready for his collection. Going through a process to building these blocks and selling these, more resistant blocks.
pads.title: Building Blocks from Glass Bottles

pads.content:
LGTBQ-Friendly Caribbean Travel Service
Pink Coconuts is an LGBTQ travel startup building a new travel experience for the queer traveller, rooted in Barbados.
https://www.travelpinkcoconuts.com/
pads.title: LGTBQ-Friendly Caribbean Travel Service

pads.content:
Cashew Peeling Machine
With cashews being the biggest export of the country and employing a disproportionate number of population, there has been interest in ways to make the job easier. Ricardo Ca, developed this machine which functions with no electricity, in direct response to the lack of constant electricity in the country, which peels cashew nuts. This is to elevate the harm caused by peeling manually and increase the number peeled per minute.
pads.title: Cashew Peeling Machine

pads.content:
Netos de Bandim
Cultural dancing group who has created a circular economy whereby the children who dance, their parents and any others who show interest are supported by the organisation economically. The children are encouraged to preserve culture through dancing and showing of masks and traditional clothes, in exchange they have their education paid for as well as international travel to represent the country. The parents are employed by the group to manage children if they are interest as well the children being employed if they decide to stop participating in the dancing.
pads.title: Netos de Bandim

pads.content:
Washing Powder 
Fatu Uegé, developed a washing powder which she sells and gifts at well below market price. Fatu lives in Farim, a sector separated from the closest biggest city by a river. Due to inaccessibility and lack of employment she and her community have been limited in ways they can buy washing up powder. With inflated prices in Farim, she tested and prototyped till she developed a washing powder which used only local products. With the success of her washing powder she is able to sell but also give to other women of the city who face the same issues as her. 
This solution was spotted during our Bias di Soluson (solution safari) of six weeks, where we asked around for inventions.
pads.title: Washing Powder

pads.content:
Carbon negative resort utilizes solar and wind energy
Nukubati Resort Fiji
Phone (+679) 603 0919 
Nukubati Resort in Fiji, is a carbon negative resort that utilizes the clean energy produced by 300 solar panels and four wind generators, which can generate over 50 Kilowatts of electricity every day. Other measures the resort has taken to that contributes to their carbon negative status include using treated rainwater, recycling domestic and grey water, sewerage is tertiary treated utilizing natural bio-cycle systems and the sterilized water is then used on the gardens, growing organic vegetables and fruits, and composting all organic waste. The resort does not have any air conditioners installed (buildings are designed to receive ample sea breeze), nor does it have any swimming pools or jacuzzies. 
High cost of initial set up may be a hinderance to uptake of this solution.
https://www.nukubati.com/our-legacy
Prototype
pads.title: Carbon negative resort utilizes solar and wind energy

pads.content:
Adapted Tool for Carving
Pilon's are commonly used throughout Guinea-Bissau, mainly by women to clean rice, although men are the producers. The men of Bafata, showed us their adapted tools to make their work more efficient and make the smoothest pilons.
pads.title: Adapted Tool for Carving

pads.content:
Pots and Tools made from recycled cans and iron
Sulemane Trauwale used waste iron and recycled can to produce household items which he later sells. This is part of a circular economy because he pays those of the community who can collect a full bag of cans and iron a fixed amount which he then used to create these items and sell them to make a living. He also employs young men of the region which then create their own workshops or move to Bissau for further training.
pads.title: Pots and Tools made from recycled cans and iron

pads.content:
Multi Shop Stop - FinTech
Zeca Nfad lives in Bissora of the Oio Regio. Although geographically close the capital, it lacks in terms of local institutions including banks. Using his tech savyness Zeca serves the community by selling and fixing electronics at an affordable price. He also provides mobile money services which is the main source of money transactions in the region as no banks are available and Western Union closed down. He creates the bridge between those in the big cities but also the diaspora.
pads.title: Multi Shop Stop - FinTech

pads.content:
Glass Crushing Machine
Jose Pedro Dos Santos create a glass cutting machine in order to recycle glass bottles for reuse in block making. The machine has been adapted several times to maximise its productivity although he is developing another one due to the increased demand in glass building blocks.
pads.title: Glass Crushing Machine

pads.content:
Ojon Press
Jose Pedro dos Santos (Zeca), developed a manual Ojon pressing machine to make the work of women of Bubaque easier. Palm Oil is a big part of the produce Bideras (female market sellers) take to the markets of Bubaque and it is also a product that is highly sought after. Althought, the process of extracting the palm oil can often be physically harmful and unsafe. Zeca developed this machine to make the work easier and allow them to produce in higher quantities. Women can bring their Ojon to be pressed at his workshop.
pads.title: Ojon Press

pads.content:
Hand Washing Station
ADEMA, an organisation led by Augusto, is championing waste management and sanitation in the Archipelago of Bijagos. The organisation developed this handwashing station in response to Ebola outbreak in 2014. Training was given to 11 islands to allow citizens to set them up. They use 5 litre bottles, a string and 4 sticks to create this, making it sustainable and easy to manage.
pads.title: Hand Washing Station

pads.content:
Center for Moms
A grassroots organization established to support mothers and advocate for their rights. They focus on: labor rights, connecting moms, entrepreneurship, human rights of pregnant women and new mothers, and promoting a health and active life.
http://centarzamame.rs/
pads.title: Center for Moms

pads.content:
Mapping Global Serbia
A detailed spatial and socio-economic profile of the Serbian diaspora worldwide will be developed. It will be done in part by hiring members from the diaspora, leveraging their networks but also softly connecting them to Serbia. This will enable a more in-depth understanding of Global Serbia and generate material to both support research, as well as helping to fuel a wider debate about membership and meaning of the Global Serbian community. It will also enable the development of a dedicated high-level network and contact forum for major figures in the Serbian diaspora, including politicians, philanthropists, writers, artists and media. It will promote major initiatives in all areas – economic, political, cultural - relevant to Serbia’s national and international interests and reputation. A two-way communications channel with the diaspora will be central to this engagement. Finally, it will provide the basis for the implementation of an Emigrant Support Programme, detailed in a separate proposal.
pads.title: Mapping Global Serbia

pads.content:
Emigrant Support Programme
The Emigrant Support Programme funds projects that will: - Celebrate, maintain and strengthen the links between Serbia and Global Serbians; Address the diverse and evolving needs of Serbian emigrants, especially the elderly, disadvantaged and vulnerable; - Facilitate access to statutory and voluntary services in their country of residence for Serbian emigrants; - Foster a more vibrant sense of community and of Serbian identity, notably through initiatives focusing on arts and culture - Support business networks to connect Serbian people to each other at home and abroad; - Research and define the emerging needs of Serbian communities abroad; - Support development of new ways to communicate and connect with the increasingly diverse global Serbian, including non-traditional, diasporas; - Improve awareness and understanding of the emigrant and diaspora experience. While the Programme is primarily designed to assist Serbian community and voluntary organizations in delivering these goals, it also supports strategic initiatives within its overall framework.
pads.title: Emigrant Support Programme

pads.content:
Online expat communities
Facebook groups gathering expats and foreign visitors to Serbia as a playground for digital ethnography and understanding the experience of "positive deviants" in the context of depopulation in the country.
https://www.facebook.com/groups/254082317988926
https://www.facebook.com/groups/bgfvc
pads.title: Online expat communities

pads.content:
Time Bank
Time Banks are a proven strategy to promote community engagement, lower social isolation, and meet needs using the skills and talent already in a local community. The time bank is a connector linking people who have needs with volunteers who are available to provide a needed service to their neighbours, like child or elder care needs, cooking a meal, providing transport, teaching a skill or a class, offering IT support, etc. Time spent providing services is “banked” on a simple software platform and entitles provider to receive other services (I bake you a pie and your son shovels my sidewalk)
pads.title: Time Bank

pads.content:
First solar powered supermarket in Fiji
Sunergise Fiji Limited
Paul Makumbe, CEO Sunergise international, paul.m@sunergisegroup.com 
RB Patel, located in Nadi, Fiji, became the fist supermarket in Fiji to go solar. The installation of the solar system on the supermarket building's roof, by renewable energy company Sunergise, allows for a significant portion of the supermarkets power to be generated by clean power. This not makes the company operations greener, but also drastically cuts cost associated with power generation. Although the supermarket is still connected to the main electrical grid, which it switches to at night, the solar installation reduces the importation of diesel by 200 barrels a year. 
High cost of intitial set up may be a hinderance to uptake of this solution.
https://fijisun.com.fj/2013/10/20/rbs-jetpoint-goes-solar/
Yes
Product
Available in market
Advance order has to be given
pads.title: First solar powered supermarket in Fiji

pads.content:
No Limit Hub
A digital nomads hub outside of the capital city attracting digital nomads and other digital workers. Capitalizing on new travel possibilities (new airport for low cost companies, vicinity of Bulgaria, etc).
https://nolimithub.com/
pads.title: No Limit Hub

pads.content:
National retired diaspora strategy
When asked, 70% of the Serbian diaspora is considering retiring to Serbia. The return of these retirees is an opportunity to build a new economic base with synergies with the existing local needs. Returning professionals at the end of their careers can benefit the economy with their skills, talents, and resources if they continue to work and after they retire. The strategy would include programs such as “Landing Pads” (guides to retirement in Serbia), Age Friendly Communities, and subsidies for SMEs evolving around the “Golden Age Industry”.
pads.title: National retired diaspora strategy

pads.content:
Rocket stove
TuFFstove
Phone: (+678) 7711022 (Fiji)
This stove was designed to use less firewood, is almost smokless, and cooks food within a short period of time. It is made from cement and has an aluminium outer covering. It is cheap, is a quality product that lasts, it is portable and it also minimizes health risks in users.
https://m.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=113599013873775&id=112336537333356&set=a.113601467206863&source=49
DIY / open source
No
Product
Available in market
pads.title: Rocket stove

pads.content:
Analysis and visualization of health data
The software firm Heliant has developed a software product designed to analyze and visualize health data from a variety of sources. The goal is to use the tools in the field of business intelligence and data visualization, to raise the efficiency of the management of health care institutions as part of managing the pandemic. The product is compatible with data coming from the Heliant Health Health Information System, which is used in more than 200 health care institutions in Serbia, in 85 percent of primary health care institutions and more than 70 percent of secondary and tertiary health care institutions, including and those on the front line of response to COVID-19: the Clinical Center of Serbia and its 22 clinics, including the Clinic for Infectious and Tropical Diseases, the Clinical Hospital Center "Dr Dragisa Misovic", the Clinical Hospital Center Zvezdara. In addition, HA is fully adapted for the import and processing of data from other health information systems and in the rest of the state administration, the Ministry of Health and the Republic Health Insurance Fund according to defined formats and protocols. The idea is to enable the institutions that need it the most to use this tool.
https://heliant.rs/?lang=en
pads.title: Analysis and visualization of health data

pads.content:
Covid-19 Data Analysis and Prediction
The Corona Quaranteam team consists of over 35 experts and scientists, doctors and epidemiologists from the Balkans, mostly living in the diaspora. They are developing a single website for all countries in the region (Albania, Bosnia, Croatia, Macedonia, Montenegro, Serbia) which will offer relevant analyzes of regional data on morbidity and mortality and localization of COVID-19 as well as publish predictions of the situation. The solution would also improve and harmonize the protocols used to treat patients and special groups, and it also provides a part where the team can be approached directly by doctors and experts for help with an analyst.
http://covid19balkans.com/
pads.title: Covid-19 Data Analysis and Prediction

pads.content:
Research into the psychological aspects of the pandemic
Qualitative online research that aims to determine all the factors that influence behavior and personal action during a pandemic. The research will identify the factors that are responsible for someone to cope better with the current situation. As predictors in the research, the team examines the attitude towards various protection measures and institutions, the assessment of the danger of the virus, the fear of losing a job or a reduction in salary, etc. The research is conducted by a team of psychologists from the College of Vocational Studies in Subotica and the EU employment agency "Interea" from Novi Sad. The research is already in the process of implementation.
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdNcuyDRXNnZd1er4f7_rle851PgofwD0RcjZHq0zEprN0uwg/viewform
pads.title: Research into the psychological aspects of the pandemic

pads.content:
Monitoring the health status of persons in self-isolation
The Symptom Monitor solution automates the process of monitoring the health status of persons in self-isolation by competent persons and institutions. On a daily basis, registered persons receive questionnaires (on different types of devices) that enable checking the symptoms characteristic of Covid-19 and thus help the medical staff to monitor the health condition of patients in a quality and timely manner. The solution was fully developed by the Novi Sad company MI-Systems and is willing to provide it to our authorities free of charge.
pads.title: Monitoring the health status of persons in self-isolation

pads.content:
Tissilon Pano di Pinti
Julinho Boto Djú, moved from the region of Biombo and uses his skills to make Pano di Pinti, a traditional craft that is known around the country. The cloths are handmade and customised depending on the ceremony. They are key components to ceremonies, marriage and funerals.
pads.title: Tissilon Pano di Pinti

pads.content:
JobAcademics
This idea was sourced through the Depopulation Data Challenge and was not awarded in the final evaluation round
JobAcademics is an application that will provide insight into the structure of the offered jobs, as well as the scope and characteristics of the workforce seeking employment in order to establish economic strength and human potential at the municipal level in Serbia
pads.title: JobAcademics

pads.content:
Maps of development potential of settlements
This idea was sourced through the Depopulation Data Challenge and was not awarded in the final evaluation round 
Maps of development potential of settlements is a methodology for making maps of development potential of settlements for the purposes of decision-making and development of strategic documents, using publicly available spatial data and services in order to get better understanding of the depopulation in the central, hilly and mountainous parts of the Republic of Serbia.
pads.title: Maps of development potential of settlements

pads.content:
Human Mobility Insights
This idea was sourced through the Depopulation Data Challenge and was not awarded in the final evaluation round. 
Human Mobility Insights is a model of human mobility based on the mobile data for Serbia by using UNACAST mobile app ping data in order to better understand population’s mobility patterns.
pads.title: Human Mobility Insights

pads.content:
Student emigration - Academic Alumni migration
This idea was sourced through the Depopulation Data Challenge and was not awarded in the final evaluation round. 
Student emigration - Academic Alumni migration is a solution that uses the methods of advanced analytics based on data on alumni members of various universities in Serbia show the attractiveness of countries for work and life, using data from LinkedIn about alumni to university members, and open data on living standards, in order to better understand emigration of students.
pads.title: Student emigration - Academic Alumni migration

Phone: (+689) 5909577 Vanuatu
An affordable, steel, handmade peanut cooker, it has an opening with a lid that can be locked and can cook at least 50 bundles of peanuts at a time. It is durable and can last more than 6 years. 
16000 VUV/peanut cooker
This solution can easily be replicated in other countries.

DIY / open source

pads.content:
Citizen Science Sargassum Monitor - CollectiveView
Collective View is a citizen science project that seeks to complement traditional monitoring techniques, supporting validation points that allow Satellite Remote Sensing to improve its levels of precision.
The project has been developed by researchers from the Department of Observation and Study of the Earth, the Atmosphere and the Ocean of El Colegio de la Frontera Sur (ECOSUR), Chetumal unit, based on a collaborative scheme for the capture of images, algorithms of artificial intelligence for the automatic classification of photographs and geographic information systems for the visualization of results.
The main objective of the project is to generate distribution maps of sargassum along the beaches, using images collected and sent by the society. Through the use of an application available for mobile devices, the citizen can send images of the beach conditions. This information is stored on cloud servers and, later, the images are classified and processed so that various products can be produced, such as, for example, statistics of citizen participation by region or distribution maps of sargassum along the beach. , which in turn can support decision-making.
Source: Article on Este País newspaper by Javier Arellano-Verdejo y Hugo Enrique Lazcano Hernández -15.12.2020
https://learngis.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/fcd1f037f1464992abbf2a7a225459e3
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=appinventor.ai_javier_arellano_verdejo.ERIS_SMS&hl=es
https://estepais.com/home-slider/monitores-del-sargazo-mediante-ciencia-ciudadana/
pads.title: Citizen Science Sargassum Monitor - CollectiveView

pads.content:
Eggshells for clean water
"H2O Lerma, water for all" is a project of a collective of scientists that seeks to contribute to the improvement of water quality and the reduction of heavy metals in the Lerma River. They carry out efforts of citizen collection of eggshells in schools, events and social networks of eggs. Later, they carry out the design and implementation of filters for heavy metals in the Lerma river. The project was created by Ivonne Linares Hernández, Elia Alejandra Teutli Sequeira, Guadalupe Vázquez Mejía, Guadalupe Fonseca Montes de Oca, Rosa María Fuentes Rivas and Verónica Martínez Miranda, professors and researchers at the Inter-American Institute of Technologies and Water Sciences and CONACyT, and it is developed in collaboration with residents of the city of Lerma.
https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Nature-Preserve/Lerma-con-Encanto-y-R%C3%ADo-Lerma-con-Encanto-2715471532011472/
pads.title: Eggshells for clean water

pads.content:
The charger back center
My name is Alpha Ibrahima Diallo, I deliver battery recharging services for traders in the port of Kamsar. It is true that for my age it can seem difficult to reconcile but as we can well mean it, the work ennobled and makes it possible to avoid certain derogatory situations especially for us of which most of the families have modest incomes. Here is in a few lines my experience in this battery recharging business.
Being a member of a modest family, I must always help my parents find a way that can be a relief for them with regard to the expenses related to the maintenance of my brothers and me. Thus, I hurry every afternoon to reach the port of Kamsar where the population is quite dynamic and made up of saleswomen, fish fishermen but also resourceful people like me. I run a battery recharging business there that serves as a safe haven for the phones of the above types of people.
To avoid the theft and / or loss of phones, I use a ticket coupling system, each with the number corresponding to that provided by the carrier of the phone. during the collection, he has the obligation to present it to me with the cost of the service, against which I deliver the telephone. 
One of the reasons why many customers frequent me is that I provide them with a possibility of charging even in the event of a power cut from the sector and to do so, I use a 5 Kva motor (Tiger) for assure it.
pads.title: The charger back center

pads.content:
another simple and easy solution for Michelin
On the principles to look and try to find what best we can identify as innovation, we have been running our safari around Touyah beach. In normal situation it is a kind of waste dropping zone but according to what I had in front was really surprising. Because of the fact that we found the area that was before considered as nasty by the tones of collected wastes from the direct deposit of men and also all the raining water that was leading the wastes through the water coming from the area sides all around; clean with new restaurants at both sides of the road.
By discussing, we have seen from something like 300m a kind of rounded base all around flowers and my collegue and I have decided to just try to be closer and bingo! "Funny!!! are these guys, has said my collegue."
for the first point of view this was for us a joke. How can he be using tires as flowerpots? 
Some 10 to 15m later, we come to realize by seeing the complete line of tires that was used to change the state of the area. For the Owner, "this was for me a solution to avoid two cases: 
1- Fight against Air pollution as we cannot burn or incinarate without smoke!
2- Be submerged by falty tires and not be able to do something against, would certainly lead to the degradation and pollution of the environnement."
So please if you have faulty tires and you realy do not have idea for avoiding the incinaration please give a look at this solution and just let us know how it helps to transform things around you!
thanks to M. Bandi Amara for his sharing.
pads.title: another simple and easy solution for Michelin

pads.content:
IMPROVISED COLOURED GARBAGE CONTAINERS 
Improvised coloured plastic containers, suitable to facilitate the separation of waste for recycling. Although the use of several coloured plastic containers has not been enforced in Angola, the owner of a store around Alemanha informal market, used empty plastic oil bidons to replicate the original coloured garbage containers for the separation of solid waste.
pads.title: IMPROVISED COLOURED GARBAGE CONTAINERS

App tipo Tinder diseñado para hacer MATCH entre jóvenes y empresas, en donde podrán encontrar de manera divertida y jugando oportunidades de crecer profesionalmente si logran hacer MATCH. Conforme van jugando, haciendo matches y acumulando puntos iremos captando DATA de calidad para todos.
Equipo: Básica

Nature based cooking - Fijian Hot Springs

pads.content:
"Van Kookh" - a mobile handicraft training center
Raed Khader, architect from the city of Madaba, has an idea for a mobile handicraft training center ( a van) that teaches handicrafts around Jordan. This is in prototype phase. He also has a workplan and presented an analysis to justify his idea. His brief description about the idea: In addition to being one of the most beautiful manifestations of heritage, as well as being a cultural heritage, and an area for innovation, It is an activity that contributes to: Improving income, raising the standard of living, and providing job opportunities; It is a source for developing economic resources, and one of the important factors for reviving the commercial and tourism movement. However, craftsmen in Jordan face some of the problems and challenges that have led the current generations to move away from them, which made me feel responsible for being an architect following the path of Hassan Fathi, the Egyptian architect known as the poor architect, to devote himself to studying problems and solutions and strive to solve them and revive our Jordanian heritage and culture. It is worth noting that the mosaic craft was the reason the Governorate of Madaba was added to an international network of creative cities around the world by UNESCO in 2017, and we also gained the title of the city of stone mosaics in 2016 by the International Crafts Council Problems and challenges facing the handicraft sector: Lack of coordination in the sector Product development and development Getting to the market Production Quality control The lack of a Jordanian identity The regulatory framework Competing interest in work lack of English competency for many that work in the sector
pads.title: "Van Kookh" - a mobile handicraft training center

pads.content:
Vundzisa: nurtures entrepreneurs business growth
Vundzisa (loosely translated to nurture to ripen) helps entrepreneurs nurture their business growth. They help apply the right business tools at the right time for entrepreneurs who need help with managing their enterprises. They support entrepreneurs in financial management, business compliance, as well as sales and marketing. Founded in 2019, Vundzisa, continued to operate along the COVID19 pandemic 2020. Vundzisa mostly helped businesses position themselves online, access simple digital bookkeeping software, and provided free consultations for ~5 businesses to make themselves essential during the unforeseen lockdown. In 2021, Vundzisa continues to help entrepreneurs to grow their businesses. The Vundzisa mission continues to contribute towards the achievement of SDGs 1 & 4 directly.
pads.title: Vundzisa: nurtures entrepreneurs business growth

pads.content:
SVTECH: Improving the ease of doing Business and Reliable Technological Solutions.
SVTECH is a software development company that is aimed at improving the ease of doing business and building reliable technological solutions. Their mission is to make a qualitative difference to the lives of millions of people and organizations in Eswatini and across the continent by empowering them with the power of information telecommunications technology. SVTECH’s goals are to: 1. Empower businesses and individuals to keep them ahead. 2. Be a leader in market share, quality, revenue, growth and gross margins. 3. Add value to stakeholders, our investors, customers, partners and associates 4. Build on Eswatini’s unique advantages. Services and software solutions currently under SVTECH’s portfolio include the following: Smart Card Printing, Network Installation and management, hardware repair and refurbishing, bulk SMS platform, online school platform, retail point of sale, biometric clocking system, and online survey application. SVTECH recently developed a mobile application that will help agriculture stakeholders manage farmer’s data. They have put the functionality to send bulk SMS's to farmers to notify them about opportunities and information they will need to know about the agriculture industry. The application will also enable Eswatini Agricultural Union (ESNAU) to link farmers to financial services. Farmers are able to pay for input subsidy and further manage their individual farms. 
PROPOSED AGRI TECH PROJECT Currently, SVTECH is trying to gather enough resources to produce a cattle and general livestock tracking application to curb the problem of livestock theft and road accident caused by livestock in the country. SVTECH is still in process engaging with key stakeholders to gather information to develop and commercialize this project.
http://www.amis.co.sz
pads.title: SVTECH: Improving the ease of doing Business and Reliable Technological Solutions.

pads.content:
English - Siswati Tourism Manual
The English - Siswati manual aims to solve the language barrier between non-siswati speakers and native speakers when it comes to communication especially tourists who come into the country to explore the Kingdom of Eswatini with the interests in culture, tradition, tourist attraction areas and most importantly learning a new language, in this case being the Siswati language. The manual sets to translates over 3000+ English words that are translatable in Siswati. Non siSwati speakers will have the pleasure of learning basic Siswati words for communication purposes. Since most tourists are unfamiliar to the Swati language and culture, they will get an opportunity to learn about different Siswati words, basic Siswati sentences, traditional regalia, Swazi cuisine etc. This way non Siswati speakers, tourists or not will learn more about the Kingdom of Eswatini and broaden the language spectrum. The product will come in the form of a hard copy handbook/manual at first and then progress to be in a digital form (Soft copy or an app) depending on the target market's demand. It is going to cater for both digital users and people who prefer hardcopy manuals. This manual will put Eswatini on the map help develop the Siswati language and culture. The project is looking forwarding to engaging with the Ministry of Tourism and Environmental Affairs, as a key stakeholder to realizing this project.
pads.title: English - Siswati Tourism Manual

pads.content:
Propagation des plantes vivaces indigènes par le semis direct
La technique du semis direct est une technique simple mais précise, qui mimique les conditions de propagation des plantes naturelles, en respectant la génétique sauvage des plantes, ne demandant ni irrigation, ni engrais. Elle permet de faire pousser des arbres et d'autres espèces vivantes indigènes à moindre coût, et fonctionne particulièrement bien sur les terres agricoles pour les fins d'agroforesterie. Les plantes établies par cette technique développent un système racinaire très épanoui, ce qui leur permet de résister aux sécheresses. La pratique peut s'utiliser à partir de l'isohyète de 150 mm jusqu'à celle de 600 mm, voir même au-delà. Dans les zones les plus arides, une quinzaine d'espèces indigènes peuvent être établies par cette technique, et dans les zones plus humides, plus d'une cinquantaine. Le semis direct est une technique de reboisement très adaptée aux zones arides, parce qu'elle permet l'épanouissement du système racinaire, essentiel à l'adaptation de la plante à son milieu. La technique développée par Rewild.Earth est basée sur 35 ans de recherches sur les types d'espèces qui peuvent être établies, les configurations d'ensemencement, les profondeurs de semis, les traitements de semences, les modes et durées de conservation des semences et bien d'autres paramètres. Elle a permis de trouver les diversités optimales de techniques pour reboiser les champs de culture céréalières avec des essences indigènes, sans nécessiter d'irrigation ni d'engrais, et à bas coût, tout en conservant la génétique naturelle des espèces. Plus de 100 espèces différentes ont été expérimentées. Ces espèces sont ensuite de grandes valeurs alimentaires,
pads.title: Propagation des plantes vivaces indigènes par le semis direct

pads.content:
Transformation des aliments d’arbres indigènes
Transformation et valorisation des fruits, graines et feuilles des espèces d’arbres alimentaires indigènes du pays. Celles-ci, au nombre de quelques douzaines dans leur ensemble, ont des saisons de récoltes décalés, permettant de créer de l’activité en milieu rural tous les mois de l’année. Leur adaptation naturelle au climat aride sahélien font qu’ils résistent mieux aux années de sécheresse ou de décalage pluviométrique, et peuvent produire souvent même lorsque les céréales classiques échouent. Aussi, certains de ces espèces ont une productivité moyenne supérieur aux cultures céréalières, tel que l’arbuste de hanza (Boscia senegalensis) qui produit en moyenne 100g de pseudo-céréale par m2 d’espace de champ occupé, ce qui vaut plus de deux fois la production céréalière classique. Finalement, les aliments des arbres pris dans leur ensemble couvrent tous les éléments nutritifs nécessaires à l’organisme humain. Cependant, ils ont souvent besoin d’une transformation pour faciliter leur préparation en cuisine, ou pour écarter des composants amers présents à leur état naturel. Ces transformations les rendent adaptés aux habitudes de consommateurs du 21ème siècle et leur permet de redécouvrir leurs usages traditionnels, tout en y ajoutant des innovations sur les produits à en dériver. Les aliments d’arbres transformés, bien qu’ayant été utilisés dans l’histoire, ont été abandonnés en temps modernes et souvent fortement stigmatisés comme aliments de pénurie et de famine. Cette initiative reprend ces aliments oubliés, méprisés d’arbres indigènes saharao-saheliens à morphologie souvent épineuse et ratatinée, et à saveurs bruts souvent sérieusement amères, afin de les transformer en aliments de qualité pouvant être appréciés comme des délices et pratiques à consommer pour l’homme du 21ème siècle.
pads.title: Transformation des aliments d’arbres indigènes

pads.content:
Space Technology Agency Limited
Space Technology Agency (STA) specializes in tracking air and water pollution in informal settlements. STA aims to advance the inclusive use of space science tools and services for socio-economic development. STA expects to impact Uganda through an improved sewerage management system and increased mechanisms that will reduce air and water pollution. STA use modern technology to measure air and water quality against the index, their aerosol micro-robots measure with reference to the Air Quality Index (AQI) and Water Quality Index (WQI) respectively, purity or contamination details are then interpreted in their medium. STA’S solution will make use of technologies like artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics to determine the quality index. Using the AI route, images of water and air will be fed into a model which extracts features to be utilized in figuring out the quality index of the air or water. The data set created will contain images from different geographical positions with their accompanying quality indices to be fed into STA’s model used in mobile devices and robotics. This solution makes use of robotics with different sensors and cameras. They may include: 1. Camera 2. Carbon monoxide sensor 3. Carbon dioxide sensor 4. A combined ph. and temperature sensor 5. Turbidity sensor 6. Lidar sensor These sensors are used to formulate a micro-robot or even included on a drone used for surveys and to gather necessary data for the air quality and water quality indices. They are made from 3D printed material and electronically recycled components, all of which can be obtained locally. The solution provides data on change detection for Air and Water pollution in slums of Kampala and provides a warning system for contamination levels in the environment as a means to prevent health hazards caused by pollution.
https://www.spacetechnologyagency.com/
pads.title: Space Technology Agency Limited

These tote bags have a cultural social impact but also environmental, i.e. in the sense that these bags will be made for large surfaces to minimize the use of single-use bags. https://web.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100027452456406

pads.content:
Poultry Fodder, Azola
Ayman Ebrahim- IDLB 
Thaer Ghanem- As-Sweida 
Jbleh-Latakia 
Azolla cultivation, the green fern plant or the so-called "Azola", is spreading in different parts of Syria replacing imported livestock feed and other national fodder that are becoming more expensive. The plantis is a good source of protein with almost all essential amino acid required for animal nutrition (notably lysine). Furthermore, it also provides macronutrients like calcium, magnesium, potassium and vitamins like vitamin A (precursor beta-carotene) and B12. Azolla is planted in manmade special ponds and is picked up after it reproduces (Azolla is a highly productive plant. It doubles its biomass in 3-10 days, depending on conditions, and yield can reach 8-10 t fresh matter/ha in Asian rice fields.)
pads.title: Poultry Fodder, Azola

pads.content:
Covid-Ray AI analyzer of fluorography to identify pneumonia
How it works
The team processed a dataset from more than 250000 unique chest X-rays from hospitals. Each chest X-ray was classified by 3 professional radiologists. Our ML-engineers used cutting-edge technologies to train the neural network. This shows, that our service can be deployed in any hospital all around the world.
pads.title: Covid-Ray AI analyzer of fluorography to identify pneumonia

Automatic electric alternator
in this image, we find an automated alternation solution guaranteeing a phase change between the mains current source and that of the solar panel. This solution is a creation of the promotion of students of the year 2019 from the Institute of Sciences and Technologies IST of Mamou.
pads.title: Automatic electric alternator

pads.content:
The IST Eggs Incubator
To meet the strong market demand for eggs, some entrepreneurs are investing in poultry production. Thus, it represents a proven growth activity. However, faced with the lack of sufficient electrification of suitable production areas, our students from IST de Mamou have succeeded in developing an alternative solution that allows several eggs to be hatched at the same time with the possibility of being supplied with electricity from a double source by solar panel and mains.
pads.title: The IST Eggs Incubator

pads.content:
The IST smart trash can 
In prototype, we present to you the intelligent trash can designed by the students of the IST of Mamou. Beyond the normal function of trash which is used to collect garbage, our students have just set up a formula that allows to aggregate the automation of opening, closing, transmission of alert sms with automation of the extinction made available against probable fires.
pads.title: The IST smart trash can

pads.content:
IST cell culture incubator
like the eye incubator, to make it easier for our many doctors in remote areas, the IST of Mamou has taken the time to research and finally design this discovery which will allow all cells to be kept at the desired temperature. targeted to promote their production and from this point guarantee a rapid response in this area. Our design is able to operate on solar energy as well as electric.
pads.title: IST cell culture incubator

pads.content:
IST Compact sanitary protection kit
While everyone held their heads on the issue of covid, Guinea, through its team of engineers from the IST institute in Mamou, set to work hard and ended up designing a device for KRAPOS name which means: Automatic Sanitary Protection Kit, whose role is to Test and Prevent covid-19 disease, by aggregating the following functionalities: Scanner for the temperature level, hand washing with a reservoir integrated soap and drinking water, hand drying after washing and finally, a water level indicator to deal with any possible shortage.
On the strength of their results, the team of researchers finally presented their solution to OAPI at the African technological innovation fair where it was awarded the UEMOA prize et lui en a même dressé un Brévet. Our team of engineers has already started marketing this device and has prioritized other university education institutions.
pads.title: IST Compact sanitary protection kit

pads.content:
The IST Surge protection
Guinea, a country located on the west coast of Africa is endowed with a high rainfall, and has a vast network of rivers which earned it the name of water tower of Africa. A wealth taken advantage of by the government by the construction of certain dams for the provision of drinking water and electricity to the populations. However, the obsolescence of the circuits used to transport electricity, the use of certain alternatives such as generators, thunder, to name but a few, cause enormous losses for the population both in human lives and with regard to household electrical equipment. To respond to this problem, our research team at the Mamou IST center has set up a device to cut the circuit when the voltage level no longer corresponds to that expected in the circuit. This device is practically operational and will be available for low-income households.
pads.title: The IST Surge protection

pads.content:
Vermicomposting – A new source to achieve self-sufficiency 
Mahasen Ebrahim a women from rural areas in Homs Syria has established her own vermicompost production in her family farm. She started with limited number of worms that helped her improve the soil fertility thus achieving self-sufficiency. Now Mahasan is producing to supply the her community market.
pads.title: Vermicomposting – A new source to achieve self-sufficiency

pads.content:
IST Electric Management System 
If you are looking for a solution to control your electricity consumption and, in turn, lower your bill at the end of the month, this is indeed a device that will please you. it is a circuit assembly designed to adapt switching on and off by means of an SMS which you can send from any point on earth. Let's say it's an executor of will dictated through the short messaging system ....... For the moment this solution is in full swing and could well be available very soon on the market. This is also designed by the team of IST of Mamou.
pads.title: IST Electric Management System

pads.content:
Urban farming to achieve self-sufficiency 
Because of the economic hardship that most Syrians are going through, especially after the economic sanctions that were imposed recently, a number of urban areas residents decided they want to do things differently and wanted to try achieving self-sufficiency through urban farming. Abdul-Rahman al-Masri, from Damascus Syria, is using a hydroponics system to grow crops on his roof-top. Ziad Thabet and Osama aljbaai from As Suwayda also used Their rooftops to grow different kinds of crops for household consumption. Now, Thabet achieved a surplus in production and is supplying a local market. Another man from As-Suwayda Raslan Othman, a contractor, is planting his little home garden and back yard with different crops vegetables, and fruits for household consumption and is achieving self-sufficiency.
pads.title: Urban farming to achieve self-sufficiency

pads.content:
Dowè Mosque, the blessed land of animals
In a mosq where human and animal are welcome! Where water is considered as tresaure to not be wasted and any by any mean, blessing should be kept... Welcome in Dowè Village!
Dowè is a transit village between Labé and Mamou in Guinea, precisely located 56Km from Timbi Madina. The first building that strikes you at the start of the school year is indeed this mosque. In the normal functioning of mosques in Guinea, there are separate spaces dedicated to the prayer of men and women. Dest toilets and wells or taps intended for the taking of ablution (ritual washing of purification). At the Dorè mosque, one thing very quickly sublimated me, the support erected to support the tap breaks the rule of applied art common to mosques. Here under the tap is a biline cemented to form a channel allowing the water to flow. Usually the water would be lost on the path in the earth as it moves forward. Here the change brought is that at the end of the circuit formed by the two lines of cemented blocks there is a kind of rectangular basin which is definitely a water receptacle designed to allow the animals to drink. Yes goats, cattle and others find their accounts there. What a great initiative, to conserve water to serve as many people as possible, even if they are animals.
pads.title: Dowè Mosque, the blessed land of animals

pads.content:
The silente chair of Filao Hotel in Boké
In the locality of Boké there is a hotel that respects the comfort of its customers and anxious to keep a space conducive to reflection. This establishment guarantees you a quality silence through its works in this case the silent chair.
While passing through Boké, one of the towns of the lower coast of Guinea known for its basement and its geomine university, you will find on the national road 3 Complexe Hôtelier Filaoplus. A fairly well welcoming establishment with respect for the guests, the cost of the rooms varying between 35 and 70 Usd per night, the two reception rooms imensely dressed with good quality table covers and a smiling and very courteous staff willing to do everything implemented to satisfy customers. speaking of the rooms, you will necessarily find it to your liking. But what appeals is this quet of silence which is allowed even for the installed equipment. It looks like a deaf choir of its Mute, in the ocurence that of the chair placed at the small desk formed for your nocturnal typing and writing exercises. This chair has been completed in its elant by a kind of soft plastic slipper to break up the deafening noise that we make when we pull them up and most often the parents lecture us to lift the chair. Here, this is a great innovation, Zero noise, at least not to disturb the neighbor next door. do not hesitate to visit them while passing through Boké!
pads.title: The silente chair of Filao Hotel in Boké

COVIDEX DRUG
Approved by Uganda's National Drug Authority (NDA), COVIDEX is a product formulated from herbal plants that have been traditionally used to alleviate symptoms of several diseases including CoViD-19. It is only available by purchase through registered clinics, pharmacies and drug stores regulated by Uganda's NDA, the product should only be used it is unexpired and sealed. The product which was developed by Prof. Patrick Ogwang, is an oral consumption medication only to be used by adults (6 drops, 3 times daily) children, ages 5 - 12 years (3 drops 3 times daily) and those younger than 5 years (1 drop, 3 times daily). Consult with a medical doctor before use of this product as it is not WHO approved yet.

Traditional Skirt Made from Tree Bark
Rosa Nirão belongs to the Bujugu tribe from the Archipelago of Bijagos. This skirt is traditional wear for the tribe and it is made from tree bark. The process was passed down from her ancestors, and it used for ceremonies, national carnivals and initiations.
pads.title: Traditional Skirt Made from Tree Bark

pads.content:
The luggage trolley made in Timbi-madina!
Timbi-Madina is a town and a sub-prefecture of the Pita prefecture in the Mamou region, in north-central Guinea. the city is famous for these great productions of sweet potatoes and the dynamism of its townspeople as regards the organization and the holding of the great days of market.
During these days, flocking from all parts of the villages and other surrounding sub-prefectures. It is therefore in this atmosphere that there are a number of small businesses. Speaking of small businesses, you can find a bit of everything there, vendors full of shoes, electronic aprons that passers-by are crazy about, especially cell phones with long charging capacity, rechargeable radios ... can pass the eyes on the big calibers: the big tradesmen who with a stroke of mastery, load more parcels therefore require more manpower as for the port of these goods towards their means of displacement. This is how our charetiers come into play. Oh yes these long metal boards intended to carry all kinds of luggage.
What struck us the most is that these baggage handlers have established a management system that allows: - or rental for paid use (billed per day). - Or the purchase for personal use (you are free to agree with the customer). - Or by joint ownership with the manufacturer (a certain percentage is paid at the end of the day). According to the citizens of Timbi Madina, this creation is original and specific to the city of Timbi Madina, something that we cannot dispute.
pads.title: The luggage trolley made in Timbi-madina!

pads.content:
Helicopter of Yéro; from dream to reality!
I met an incredible metal genius who succeeded in following all the laws of aerodynamics by building a model helicopter from a visualization. 
In Guinea and particularly in Kamsar, there is a man by the name of Yéro Kanté, never educated but who has to his credit creations worthy of an engineer of great schools. Yéro by viewing a helicopter, will bring together all the equipment necessary to make this dream come true. Beyond the physical design, he will meet pilots who will not hesitate to provide him with everything he needs to learn, understand and master all the interdependencies linked to the dynamics of the helicopter. This is how yéro will put everything on its side, with the support of a team of young people guided by the strong desire to see the dream come true; to collect metals, weld them together, make a rotor and hand-crafted propellers and finally buy a motor which will serve to provide a driving power drive to the whole. After days of hard work, Yéro will be congratulated by his friends and almost all the inhabitants for his achievement
pads.title: Helicopter of Yéro; from dream to reality!

pads.content:
Yéro, the Hero of palm oil producers.
Again he, yes him, Yéro Kanté, here he takes on the savior of palm cultivators in the sense that given the difficulty of these in extracting oil properly and therefore to market on a large scale due to the fact that it required transport to processing plants which were excessively expensive, at least for the average producer. Our friend Yéro kate has designed a machine that crushes palm kernels and extracts the oil, bark and seed separately. This solution is of three types: one manual, two other motorized but respectively medium and large capacity. To date, Yéro has managed to make a good situation thanks to the sale of this solution which is very popular with our average growers and which finally allowed him to reach neighboring countries so as to facilitate the sale of his productions. .
tags: the vulnerable members of our society
pads.title: Yéro, the Hero of palm oil producers.

pads.content:
the architect of the ghetto
Leaving vocational school and graduated in masonry, Diallo Alpha Oumar, is a creative genius of design of all kinds. 
Alpha Oumar, since childhood began to create gadgets such as carts, helicopters, shoes, planes and other pure to name a few ... During its development, it was several times confronted with the problems of funding and supervision which were a real obstacle. One of Alpha Oumar's strengths was that in a dream he was used to visions that he forced himself to implement. He succeeded but still with a few points to review such as taking measurements to properly frame his work. It was therefore necessary for him to follow a training in masonry to understand how to overcome this obstacle. This is how he began to produce models of all kinds, here in image that of a double stadium sports complex with covered roofs. Added to this is his developed sense of adaptability to various trades such as hairdressing, electronics, particularly the repair of mobile phones and other accessories, and finally the carpentry where his action consists of indicating to laborers how to model and assemble what 'he wants to complete for a clientele whose orders are made on the basis of negotiation with regard to the final design to be adopted. Diallo Alpha Oumar would like the government to make available for young people in Guinea, and particularly those from Boké, a center intended to support young people in their businesses. According to him, these centers could be equipped with minimum equipment that could guarantee the development of the spirit of creativity.
pads.title: the architect of the ghetto

pads.content:
Yéro Kanté, the man with the hands of steel!
- Shipwreck off Kanfarandé: 14 dead, one missing and 15 injured. - Guinea-Conakry: at least 15 dead in the sinking of a boat - Kamsar: the sinking of a canoe leaves 3 dead and 15 survivors. These are the tragedies facing which the authorities and residents of Kamsar have long remained unarmed. Coming from a predominantly modest community, Yéro Kanté, will address the thorny question of finding a viable and lasting solution to the safety of the populations during the various crossings. Thus, with the sole strength of these arms coupled with the enthusiasm of the love of good, he will succeed in bringing together all the elements necessary mostly composed with the recycled metals for the design of a boat. To this day Yéro Kanté, like a true genius who started from nothing, has a naval fleet to his credit. his solution is a local option for the revalorisation of metals in the era side of Kamsar and by the same mean, a long term factor of saving peoples lives.
pads.title: Yéro Kanté, the man with the hands of steel!

pads.content:
Yéro Kanté, A will against a fate for a better tomorrow!
Yéro Kanté, a man who was not in his childhood favored by nature to be scolarized had the humility to get to work and by the strength of these points succeeded in building a school intended to train the younger generations of the city of Kamsar and by extension those of Guinea. Yero Kanté is a REAL HERO!!!
pads.title: Yéro Kanté, A will against a fate for a better tomorrow!

pads.content:
Repurposing used oil: Making soap from grease 
Throughout his 20 years of work, Mr. Abdulkadir's denial has recycled tones and tones of used oil. Mr. Abdulkadir has been creating handwashing soap using reclaimed vegetable oil. He collects the oil from Aleppo households, restaurants, and fast food shops and stores collected oil in his little workshop located on the outskirt of the city. After a sufficient amount is collected, Mr. Abdulkadir filters the oil and then mixes it with lye and some essential oils to give it a good smell. The process of turning grease is somehow used to be considered common knowledge especially among housewives, who used to collect their used oil and turn to turn it into soap once there is a sufficient amount. However, people started to forget about this skill because for a while it was cheaper and more time-saving to buy the soap from the market than making it at home. In addition to it is being a good source of income, turning oil to soap considered to be a very eco-friendly practice that protects drinking water from being polluted with grease as every 1 liter of oil can polluted 1000 liter of freshwater.
pads.title: Repurposing used oil: Making soap from grease

pads.content:
Fine Artists using textile and pieces of old clothes to create art pieces 
Hiyam Slaman a fine artist from Latakia, Syria, is using recycled materials and fabric scraps to create her art pieces. she collects leftovers materials from quilting and sewing projects and combines them with hand and machine embroidery to create collaged wall hangings, table cloths, artistic masks, and other artistic pieces. Through her artwork, Hiyam is able to generate an extra income that supports her family. when we interviewed her she said " I believe that anyone who has the passion to create new things from leftovers and who have artistic skills can make a successful small business that can generate a decent income"
pads.title: Fine Artists using textile and pieces of old clothes to create art pieces

pads.content:
The power of faith facing of the weakness of the means of a young self-taught innovator
Mamadou saliou is a young person who went to grade 5 in primary school. from his almost non-illiterate state, he will use the means at his disposal to guarantee himself a self-training in computer science. In Guinea and at Timbi Madina to find enough to pay the housing taxes but also and above all the expenses related to the maintenance of the parents, our friend Saliou, given the difficulty in the field of electrification of rural areas by the government agencies in charge of this, will decide to set up a micro dam system which according to him, for a start, was intended to supply twenty (20) houses. Faced with reprisals from the family, Saliou will gather friends and all the means to be assisted in his task which consisted of building a turbine, buying a coil and interconnecting everything with a dynamism respecting the standards of physics and mechanics. This is how in a few months, he will pick up sheets, iron bars, parts of abandoned vehicles and other utensils to then send them to a boilermaker to constitute them in Turbine. As for the reel, remember that alongside the entrepreneurial spirit is a very seasoned telephone repairer who sells his breakdown service to the various passers-by and travelers who come for their supplies on market days. So here is how Saliou, from nothing succeeded in setting up a micro dam to be installed in a village where river never dry up and which will probably be used to supply many more houses by the force of the water flowing.
pads.title: The power of faith facing of the weakness of the means of a young self-taught innovator

pads.content:
CAC, when environment, positive attitude and motivation make ONE
Sur image vous avez une plaque communément appelée dallette (dalle de terrasse) qui est un ensemble composé de plastiques collectés des déchets dans la ville de Boké. le plastic chauffé est liquéfié et ainsi malaxé au sable avec une proportion bien définie pour garantir la solidité mais aussi le cohérence entre les différents agrégats utilisés. la solution est ensuite recueillie dans des moules de différentes formes selon le design souhaité. Sur le plan environnemental, cette solution représente un moyen certes de recyclage, de création de richesse et d'auto employabilité des jeunes étudiants sans emploi regroupés en coopérative dénommée Coopérative Action Citoyenne.
pads.title: CAC, when environment, positive attitude and motivation make ONE

Nopal (prickly pear) gasoline / fuel
Using the waste of prickly pear plantations to transform public transport from fossil to bio-fuel vehicles.

Biogas from prickly pear has the same performance in vehicles as gasoline, but is 40% cheaper, besides the environmental benefits of not using non-renewable energy sources. According to the promoters, prickly pear biogas has proven more effective than sugar or corn biogas. Authors: Miguel Aké Madera (age 70) and Rogelio Sosa López (age 68) Images: El Universal Article reference: https://www.eluniversal.com.mx/colaboracion/orgullomexicano/con-nopal-crean-gasolina-organica

pads.content:
Sprouting Barley (Hydroponic fodder)
Increased prices of feed and the drought during the past couple of years are pushing farmers to look for alternative feed. One of the alternative that is gaining the most interest is sprouted barley. Although sprouted fodder is not a new idea, but what is new is the way Syrian farmers are growing it using local available resources. Some are sprouting for self-sufficiency other farmers has turned it into business that generate a decent income. Farmers chose barley over other kind of sprouted seed to feed their livestock because it is high production rate (1 kg of seeds gives 7kg sprouted) and more importantly because nutritional benefits in barely are high than in other seeds. How: Barley needs a controlled climate to sprout, some farmers are building rooms with special conditions to control climate and light. To sprout the barley, the first thing farmers do is soaking barely in water for 24 hours. Next, barley will be spread over trays and then trays will be put on racks for seven days and watered regularly.
pads.title: Sprouting Barley (Hydroponic fodder)

Karatou Post bac

pads.content:
Turning plastic waste into cooking gas
Plastic waste has attracted widespread concern and attention in Kenya. The rapid rate of urbanization throughout the world has led to the generation of increasing amounts of waste, including plastic waste and this in turn poses difficulties for disposal. The problem is more acute in developing countries such as Kenya. The ban on plastic bags/carriers took effect on 28th August 2017 which is a positive move towards reducing plastic waste. A more constraining issue arises on how to dispose off the current waste. Megagas focuses on the manufacturing of clean cooking gaseous fuel from various polymeric compounds, commonly known as plastic waste. This waste is found easily and cheaply thus making the product affordable and sustainable. James Isedia Mulema the founder of Megagas stumbled on the idea of manufacturing clean cooking fuel during trials to use plastic waste to harvest storm water. In 2014 he harvested his first gas into a makeshift cylinder he had made. Through this innovation, he has provided jobs for the youth by hiring them to collect the plastic waste, the raw material that he uses to produce the gas.
pads.title: Turning plastic waste into cooking gas

pads.content:
Boda Boda powered coffee pulper
It is every farmer's dream to earn money from their produce promptly, but for Mr. Githuki Mwangi, this dream never materialized for the many years that he farmed coffee. Eventually, he decided to uproot his coffee trees and try his hand at something else. Mwangi has introduced a system that will pulp coffee at farm level, meaning that farmers will not have to transport their produce to a factory or a cooperative. The system which is powered by motorcycles has a capacity of processing over 400 kilos of cherry per hour compared to just 50 kilos which farmers achieve through manual pulping. The system is likely to cut the long coffee value chain that makes farmers wait for six months to get paid.
pads.title: Boda Boda powered coffee pulper

pads.content:
E-distance
En quoi l’application E-distance peut aider ?
Les approches actuelles de recherche des contacts prennent relativement trop de temps, et plus la recherche des contacts est longue, plus le virus a de temps pour se propager à d'autres personnes. Avec cette application, les individus peuvent se contenir du virus en se distançant des autres individus et ainsi faire barrière aux virus.
Le concept d'application mobile que nous avons modélisé est simple. Il utilise votre position géographique et une version à données (data) mobile pour enregistrer dans une mémoire tous les utilisateurs de l'application.
Comme impact sanitaire, il y’aurai de moins en moins de contamination vue que cette dernière se fait le plus souvent lors des contact inter humain.
Comme impact socioéconomique, l’application pourrait servir a contenir le virus en épargnant le gouvernement d’une part à économiser les dépenses faites sur le malades dû a cette pandémie mais aussi pour la population de vaquer a leurs occupations mais en respectant nécessairement les gestes barrières.
pads.title: E-distance

pads.content:
Réchaud à charbon de bois ou à charbon minéral attisé par la vapeur d’eau 
La problématique de la production de l’énergie rentable, sécurisée et qui épargne le bois ou minimise son utilisation a longtemps été la préoccupation des Etats, et particulièrement des Etats du CILSS. De 1973 à ce jour, plusieurs stratégies et programmes ont été développés sans arriver à un résultat satisfaisant. C’est pour répondre à ce besoin que nous avons mis au point ce dispositif qui minimise l’usage du bois et permet une production énergétique à haut rendement, y compris sur le plan écologique. Le réchaud à charbon de bois ou à charbon minéral est en deux compartiments. Le réservoir d’eau en bas et le fourneau au-dessus. Le fourneau est d’abord mis en activité avec du charbon ordinaire. La chaleur provenant du fourneau chauffe l’eau du réservoir qui se transforme en vapeur. La vapeur passe à travers des conduits à l’intérieur du fourneau pour activer la combustion. Et il se crée un mouvement cyclique. L’eau attise la combustion et la combustion transforme l’eau en vapeur pour continuer à attiser le fourneau. La ventilation est si forte que le charbon minéral y brûle vivement sans fumée jusqu’à épuisement. En quoi est-ce que cette solution / initiative locale est-elle innovante ? Production de l'énergie domestique sans pollution et à haut rendement, production d’électricité avec le charbon minéral. 
Contacts innovateur: 0022796463666/0022796264664.
pads.title: Réchaud à charbon de bois ou à charbon minéral attisé par la vapeur d’eau

CORONAMENE
la présente bavette est faite en plastique transparent et rigide, Elle comporte une cavité qui permet de loger le nez et la bouche sans les étouffer. Le dispositif est prolongé par une forme de gouttière équipée d’un filtre qui permet d’épurer les gaz rentrant et sortant au cours de la respiration. Lutte contre la contamination interpersonnelle due à la propagation des particules pathogènes en suspension dans l’air, telles que le corona virus. Lutte contre la contamination interpersonnelle due à la propagation des particules pathogènes en suspension dans l’air, telles que le corona virus.Se porte sur le visage comme une bavette ordinaire.
En quoi est-ce que cette solution / initiative locale est-elle innovante ?
Permet de voir voir clairement l’interlocuteur, de respirer et de parler normalement comme sans masque, d’évacuer les gaz pollués presque en totalité, de respirer de l’air filtré. L’évacuation des gaz expirés qui polluent rapidement les bavettes classiques. Comme elle est en plastique, il est possible et facile de le relaver pour le désinfecter et le réutiliser.
Contacts innovateur : 00227 96264664; BP 5040 Niamey NIGER

pads.content:
Séchoir solaire fabriqué localement
La conservation des produits champêtres post-récolte ainsi que la mise en valeur par la transformation alimentaire demandent souvent que les produits soient séchés. Ceci se fait traditionnellement à l’air libre, dans des conditions qui ne répondent pas au normes hygiéniques : contacts avec les mouches et lézards, contamination par le sable et la poussière, perte de vitamines par l’impact direct des rayons solaires. Une réponse efficace à cela est le séchoir solaire. Sahara Sahel Foods et Rewild. Earth ont conçu un modèle de séchoir solaire fabriqué localement, à haute capacité. permettant de sécher les produits alimentaires dans des bonnes conditions hygiéniques. Le séchoir consiste à une rangée de six cabinets de douze claies chacune, alimentés par des aspirateurs et expirateurs d’air solaires. Le tout se connecte à un panneau collecteur de chaleur qui chauffe l’air de séchage avant son introduction dans le séchoir. Ceci donne une superficie de séchage totale de 46m2. En quoi est-ce que cette solution / initiative locale est-elle innovante ? La solution est innovante parce qu’elle permet de fabriquer les séchoirs localement, réduisant les coûts d’acquisition et facilitant l’entretien. Le modèle est optimisé aux conditions climatiques nigériennes, et utilise les principes découverts par un chercheur solaire nigérien (plus particulièrement le Prof. Albert Wright) pour maximiser l’effet de l’énergie. Le système de ventilation travail avec de l’énergie solaire photovoltaïque à l’aide de ventilateurs de radiateurs de véhicules, sélectionnés pour la circulation maximale de l’air par rapport à l’énergie consommé. Ainsi, le système est entièrement autonome et peut être installé dans n’importe quel village ou communauté rurale de la République du Niger. Le modèle est la 7ème itération de conception de séchoir de Sahara Sahel Foods, permettant de capitaliser sur les leçons apprises sur tous les modèles antérieurs afin d’obtenir un séchoir pratique, efficace et durable. Adresse de l'innovateur : Quand ? : Où ? : Par qui ? : Contact :
pads.title: Séchoir solaire fabriqué localement

C'est pour contrecarrer ce fléau que nous avons travaillé à le transformer en engrais. Et c'était une grande réussite. pads.content:
Piège à réarmement automatique
Le piège à réarmement automatique est un dispositif qui permet de capturer les rongeurs, de les placer dans une cage éloignée à l’aide d’un conduit à clapet et de se réarmer automatiquement pour capturer indéfiniment d’autres rongeurs, Le piège à réarmement automatique est un boitier fermé par un couvercle mobile qui s’abaisse sous la pression d’un rongeur et se referme à l’aide d’une force de rappel. Le rongeur tome dans la boite suit une conduite prévue pour offrir une voie d’échappement apparent. La conduite est muni d’un clapet qui oblige le rongeur à avancer dans une autre cage sans possibilité de revenir en arrière. En quoi est-ce que cette solution / initiative locale est-elle innovante ? Ø L’avantage de ce piège est qu’il permet de capturer plusieurs rongeurs sans nécessité la présence humaine pour le réarmer à chaque fois. En plus les rongeurs sont capturés vivants et peuvent être utilisés dans les laboratoires. Contacts de l'innovateur :
pads.title: Piège à réarmement automatique

pads.content:
Handicap et COVID19 : Formation des enfants e de femmes en situation de Handicap
Contexte Les enfants, femmes en situation de Handicap et leurs familles ne sont pas suffisamment impliqués dans la société au point de voir leur capacité renforcée au même titre que les autres franges de la population. Seule une minorité évolue au sein de structures associatives qui elles même sont léthargiques et pas assez efficace. Ceci peut être un facteur d’exposition à la pandémie pour elles et leurs familles. Solution Ces pour toutes ces raisons que le projet Handicap et COVID entend mettre en œuvre des actions de proximité et de renforcement de capacités dans le strict respect de la Gestion Axée sur les Résultats (GAR) avec une implication des différentes groupes concernés. Ces actions qui se basent sur le principe de l’inclusion sont : Rencontre de planification et de suivi évaluation avec les parties prenantes ; Formation et sensibilisation au profit des enfants, femmes en situation de handicap et famille sur le COVID-19 ; Formation sur le numérique, l’autonomisation et création d’un réseaux de promotion artisanal inclusif ; Formation et renforcement de capacité entrepreneuriales au profit des femmes membres des groupements des personnes en situation de handicap.
