pads.content:
Application de contrôle des prix des denrées alimentaires
Contexte Depuis l’apparition du coronavirus, le consommateur subit une hausse des prix des denrées alimentaires qui sont devenues rares sur le marché. Face à cela, le gouvernement a publié un arrêté pour enrayer cette hausse en plafonnant les prix pratiqués. L’Etat compte sur le soutien de la population qui doit dénoncer tout commerçant ou détaillant qui refuse de respecter l’arrêté. L’arrêté souffre d’un manque d’application de la part des commerçants et détaillants. 1. Fermeture des frontières qui empêche les grossistes de fournir assez de denrées pour tout le monde ; 2. Faible application de l’arrêté ; 3. Hausse des prix. Solution Création d’une application mobile pour permettre à la population de dénoncer les commerçants et détaillants qui ne respectent pas l’arrêté, en prenant en photo le produit et en fournissant les informations nécessaires à la localisation du professionnel. 1. Avec le nombre de dénonciations, l’Etat pourra faire pression sur les grossistes ; 2. L’Etat peut directement réprimander les commerçants et les détaillants ; 3. Baisse des prix dans le respect de l’arrêté. C’est une application mobile simple suffit, pas besoin de fonctionnalités complexes. Aujourd’hui, aucune solution n’existe au Niger pour soutenir la population a faire face à une situation de crise économique. Equipe innovateurs : - IBRAHIM MOUMOUNI HAROUNA, ETUDIANT A L’UNIVERSITE DE NIAMEY EN LICENCE 2 “MATHEMATHIQUE INFORMATIQUE”, ATTESTATION SUR LE BUILD IN A BOX 2018.
pads.title: Application de contrôle des prix des denrées alimentaires

pads.content:
Equipe Makaranta ou le e-learning
Contexte
L’informatique en générale, les technologies (TIC) en particulier ont conduit à l’apparition des services en ligne, Entre autres le e-learning.
Le e-learning consiste à utiliser les ressources de l'informatique et de l‘internet pour acquérir, à distance, des connaissances.
L’apparition du COVID-19 et les mesures de protection prises par les gouvernements pour stopper l’avancée de la pandémie ont poussé à une utilisation massive des services en ligne.
Dans le cadre de la compétition nationale Coronackathon, MAKARANTA la plateforme de e-learning qui est proposée pour faciliter l’apprentissage, la continuité des cours à distance pour les élèves, les enseignants et l’ensemble des systèmes éducatifs nigériens.
Il s’agira de :
Ø Appuyer le gouvernement dans la riposte contre COVID-19, en garantissant la continuité du système éducatif.
Ø Permettre la disponibilité des cours peu importe la destination sur ordinateurs et smartphones. Garantir l\'éducation tous les nigériens.

Solution
La plateforme dédiée offre aux institutions éducatives la possibilité de créer des cours en ligne et des sites e-learning. C’est un Learning Content Management System qui a plusieurs fonctionnalités. Il permet à l’organisme d’offrir des cours en ligne de gérer l’apprentissage, organiser le contenu, évaluer l’apprenant, et faciliter l’interactivité entre apprenant et enseignant. Il garantit aussi le cryptage des données sensibles. L’application MAKARANTA est facilement intégrable dans le système de ou l’infrastructure technologique de l’université.

Equipe innovateurs :

pads.content:
Portique de Désinfection des Germes de maladies Infectieuses (PDGI)
Contexte
Dans ce contexte de propagation de la Covid-19, nombreuses sont les initiatives engagées à travers le monde, afin de contribuer, à l'effort national visant à atténuer les répercussions de cette pandémie et la prévenir. Selon les moyens et les idées qui leur sont propres les Etats et des citoyens se sont engagés à chercher de nouvelles solutions pour protéger la santé des populations.
C`est dans cette situation que notre Entreprise INOVATECH a rapidement développé le Portique de Désinfection des Germes de maladies Infectieuses (PDGI), une innovation pour mettre sa compétence au service de cette cause. L’innovateur Hassane Bissala Y, phytopathologie de formation estime que c’est un devoir de présenter un service à son pays dans de telles circonstances.

Solution
Le renforcement des mesures barrières d’hygiène et de lutte contre l’infection peuvent limiter la propagation de micro-organismes résistants et réduire l’utilisation abusive et à mauvais escient des antimicrobiens.
Le Portique de Désinfection des Germes de maladies Infectieuses (PDGI) est un équipement physique qui rassemble en un seul outil, l`essentiel des mesures barrières conventionnelles recommandées par les États.
Il assure un seul passage la distanciation physique, la désinfection des semelles de chaussures, le lavage des mains, le port des bavettes et la désinfection des tenues vestimentaires des visiteurs.
Avantage du PDGI : en général les dispositifs de lavage des mains déposés devant les entrées des bâtiments sont très peu utilisés par les visiteurs pour diverses raisons. Le PDGI apporte une correction à cette négligence car les visiteurs sont contraints de passer dans le portique pour accéder aux lieux.

Equipe innovateurs :
- HASSANE BISSALA Yahaya, Directeur et innovateur : Phytopatologue ;

pads.content:
YAYI MAKE ou visières de protection
Contexte
Plus de 6 millions des cas confirmés dans le monde et 961 cas confirmés au Niger, la lutte contre le Covid 19 est plus que jamais urgente.
Face à cette pandémie, tout le monde doit être protégé au maximum surtout en cette période déconfinement.
Face à cette maladie virale sans traitement et ni vaccin, la seule arme qui est la prévention requiers un certain nombre d'équipements de protection qui sont en manque dans le pays :

● Une demande forte sur le marché international ;
● Une demande forte sur le marché international ;
● Une demande forte sur le marché international.

Solution
Yayi make utilise les nouvelles méthodes de fabrication numérique tel que l’impression 3D, l'électronique et l’open source pour fabriquer localement des visières protections en deux versions différentes.
§ Ils permettent une protection quasi-complète par leur effet anti projection au niveau des trois zones par lesquelles entre le virus : la bouche, le nez et les yeux.
Avec une vitesse de production rapide cette version de visière pourra être imprimé et assemblé en 20 minutes.
§ En plus d’une protection faciale, cette visière connectée avec son application mobile vous aide à bien respecter les règles de prévention tel que :
- La distanciation sociale grâce à un capteur ultrason qui contrôle la distance d’au moins 1 mètre avec les autres,
- Le lavage de main grâce à un minuteur intégré qui vous aide à bien lavé vos mains pendant 20 secondes tel que recommandé par l’OMS
- Le contrôle de votre température corporelle grâce à un capteur infrarouge.
Avec ces fonctionnalités , cette version de visière pourra être utilisée pour éduquer et sensibiliser sur les bons gestes barrières, mais aussi grâce à son application mobile elle peut être utilisé dans les entreprises et écoles pour surveiller sur une plateforme la température des employés.

Equipe des innovateurs :
- Mamane Kabirou Ousseini, Maker, Ingénieur en instrumentalisation biomédicale ;
- Ousmane Seydou Gnali, Software Engineer.

pads.content:
Mbabane Waste Minimisation System
About 48tonnes of unsegregated waste is generated per day and directed to landfills resulting in a reduced lifespan for the city’s landfill and an unsustainable living environment for the city of Mbabane. Furthermore, unemployment remains high in the city, yet opportunities to derive livelihoods from waste exist for the city’s dwellers. Additionally, inappropriately managed waste can result in the outbreak of diseases. The absence of an appropriate legal instrument to promote sustainable waste management practices has resulted in the slow uptake of recycling and sustainable waste management practices. Additionally, current waste management practices have resulted in a big carbon footprint for the city. 
The solution aims at:
- Promoting waste segregation as a social norm in Mbabane City
- Enabling and encouraging legislation on waste segregation
- Using waste to improve livelihoods by transforming waste management into sustainable business opportunities.
- Introducing new Technologies of Composting (i.e. bokashi) – with the aim of improving soil nutrients, increasing yields for organic produce, thus improving livelihoods, and providing economic incentives for good environmental practices through, i.e. sale of organic compost and farmers produce from backyard gardens,
- Reducing the city’s carbon footprint, as a climate action response,
The project is currently being piloted at 4 Mbabane communities (namely Pine Valley, Mbangweni, Woodlands and Msunduza) and 76 business outlets. The opportunities for income generation especially for the businesses, and the benefits currently observed make the potential for sustainability of this initiatives high. Additionally, through the learnings from this piloting phase and the passing of the Waste Management Regulations, the project will be scaleable to all other communities within the Municipal Council of Mbabane’s jurisdiction.
pads.title: Mbabane Waste Minimisation System

pads.content:
ePaynet - Digital Payment Solutions
Financial exclusion / lack of access to credit facilities: Most potential entrepreneurs, especially in rural areas are unemployed, financially dependent on other people, have no credit history in the country, or are unbanked, and they reside in becoming financially excluded due to their social status. With the COVID-19 pandemic at play, exchanging frequently touched items, including notes and coins could transmit the virus as well. Inconvenience: People have to leave their comfort zones in order to deposit or withdraw cash to make purchases. Others are very busy to do so, thus limiting the amount of time on spending, in which the government needs for economic growth. 
ePayNet is a technological innovation that aims at: - Empowering woman entrepreneurs by helping them get access to quick or instant loans in order for them to start and operate their own businesses. - Reducing the spread of COVID-19 through the use of FINTECH, limiting the number of people travelling to the most congested areas to deposit or get cash, and to avoid the exchange of notes and coins from one hand to another. - Bringing great convenience to all ePayNet clients. Enabling clients to make transactions at the comfort of their spaces at reasonable charges. In partnership with MTN, Digimage Investments developed a FINTECH driven solution towards financial inclusion. The initiative enhances client experience through an electronic platform to process payments through mobile money or bank cards. It offers interoperability between banks and mobile money for people to transfer funds between the two at the comfort of their spaces. The initiative links clients (including woman entrepreneurs in rural areas, who cannot move around in search of funds due to increased costs and the COVID-19 pandemic) to their SACCOS, stokvels and micro lenders, so they can borrow, repay and save via the platform. Clients also make donations, give offerings, pay school fees, pay to companies and utility bills. The product relies on excessive training of staff (both Digimage and MTN) and clients on how to use product, and robust marketing.
pads.title: ePaynet - Digital Payment Solutions

pads.content:
Waste to Mats
These are mats made from sweet/ candy wraps. Sitting mats are an important part of the Swazi Culture. They are normally made from a grass known as lukhwane that are a wetland species. They are used in many traditional ceremonies including as important gifts to the groom and his family during weddings, and as an important material used during the burial of a loved one (normally a senior male family member). Local women have now started making them from many forms of plastic waste including single use plastic shopping bags, sweet wrappers and many other single use plastic material. this solutions therefore provides a recycling avenue for this type of waste while also helping to improve local incomes.
pads.title: Waste to Mats

pads.content:
Informal transportation Tetovo-Skopje 
There is a great mobility between the city of Tetovo and the capital city Skopje. Main administrative institutions (namely ministries) are all located in the central area in Skopje; The distance between Skopje and Tetovo is 40 km, and many people choose to commute rather then settle in Skopje. The rents are much higher in Skopje, so as the living expenses. This situation is also getting more complex during the school year, where there are many students in high schools, as well as in university that choose to commute. Student housing is very limited, and private accommodation is a burden to many families. The public transportation offers a bus every hour, this is not enough for the need. All the seats in the bus are taken, and people are standing in the corridor of the bus while traveling between the cities. As a result of these circumstances, informal vans and cars have filled the gap. The informal meeting spot is in the exit of the city, and as the vehicles fill up the seats, they head to Skopje.
pads.title: Informal transportation Tetovo-Skopje

pads.content:
Le composteur aérobie de grande capacité (CAGC)
Le Composteur CAGC est une innovation de compostage conçu pour apporter une contribution certaine à la résolution des problèmes qui entravent la production du compost en quantité et qualité en milieu urbaine et rural. Le Composteur CAGC est une structure construite en surface et connecté à un système de régulation d`air, d`humidité et de température placé en-dessous. Un réservoir d’eau placé au-dessus de la construction permet le ravitaillement ajusté en eau grâce à un doseur. Ses capacités de chargement de résidus végétaux fermentescibles sont extensibles selon les besoins et peuvent aller jusqu`â 100 m3 de matières fermentescibles. Tout le bâtiment est couvert par une bâche imperméable et résistante au soleil. Au bout de 25 à 30 jours le compost est mûr avec les teneurs approximatives en nutriments suivants (en %).
pads.title: Le composteur aérobie de grande capacité (CAGC)

pads.content:
Récupérateur des Eaux de Ruissellement (RER) muni d'un Réservoir à Programmation Semi-automatique ...

C'est un dispositif technique qui consiste à récupérer les eaux de ruissellement tout évitant l'ensablement des bassins de stockage d'eau. Le dispositif refoule le sable et laisse passer uniquement l'eau dans le bassin de rétention. Les bassins de rétention des eaux pluviales peuvent être à ciel ouverts ou enterrés. Le dispositif a pour fonction d'assurer la disponibilité de l'eau dans les champs.
En cas de sécheresse il sera ainsi possible d'irriguer les plantes et d'arroser les composteurs grâce à l'eau stockée. Le RER est conçu pour épargner les équilibres hydriques et écologiques naturels des plantes durant les périodes de sécheresse. Il peut assurer une disponibilité d'eau jusqu'à trois mois à près la fin de la saison des pluies en fonction de sa capacité. Les dimensions et le nombre de ces bassins sont variables selon les besoins et les moyens du paysan. Pour les bassins situés sur une surface plane le remplissage commence à partir d'une pluie de 20 mm, Pour les bassins situés dans une trajectoire des eaux de ruissellement le remplissage commence à partir de 15 mm de pluie. Le RER complète le Réservoir à Programmation Semi-automatique (RPS) dans les champs.
Réservoir semi-automatique: C'est un dispositif programmable de ravitaillement en eau des plantes suivant des intervalles de temps et de débit bien définis d’avance. Le programme est introduit dans réservoir d'eau, il est mécanique et n'a pas besoin de source d'énergie pour son fonctionnement et de cerveau électronique central programmable. Il s’inscrit dans la logique des innovations low-tech (basse technologie) et « low-cost (bas coûts / à bas prix). Il est pratique très peu onéreux et économique.
Adresse de l’innovateur : INOVATECH-Sarl/ Innovations, Agroforesterie, Commerce Général RCCM/NI/NIA/2013/A/397/04/02/2013 ; Nif : 35665/S Cel : 91 10 00 85 / 96 96 48 53/ 96978110- BP 2796 Ny
Email : hbissala@gmail.com, hbissala@yahoo.fr, einovatech@yahoo.com
pads.title: Récupérateur des Eaux de Ruissellement (RER) muni d'un Réservoir à Programmation Semi-automatique ...

pads.content:
Borne Agricole & Scolaire
Présente en Guinée depuis 2017, la startup Guinéenne TULIP aujourd’hui devenue une référence dans la sous-région ; en matière d’innovation technologique dans les domaines tels que la santé avec ses bornes et tablettes
Ici sur images une commande personnalisée pour le PAM à destination des écoles de Guinée.
Développée par l'entreprise TULIP Technologies en Guinée, cette borne est un assemblage de fonctionnalités telles que la lecture de vidéo préconçues pour la formation des bénéficiaires en matière de qualification des aliments à consommer chez les enfants mais aussi en matière de notions relatives aux composants nutritifs, un système de messagerie vocale pour alerter ou laisser un message de requête de soutient et d'assistance en faveur des bénéficiaires. Cette borne permet de gérer à distance les flux financiers dans le domaine de l'alimentation des enfants dans les différente cantines ciblées destinataires. Elle est composée d'un écran assez robuste avec un niveau de résistance élevé; d'un système de panneaux solaires, lui garantissant une autonomie de fonction dans les zones à faible couverture électrique. On retiendra que cette borne admet la génération de données qui sont transmissibles à un serveur hébergé (si souhaité), chez le partenaire pouvant être utilisées pour les projections futures.
pads.title: Borne Agricole & Scolaire

pads.content:
LE DRONE A LA TULIP !
Présente en Guinée depuis 2017, la startup Guinéenne TULIP aujourd’hui devenue une référence dans la sous-région ; en matière d’innovation technologique dans les domaines tels que l'agriculture, avec ses drones et tablettes
Le drone à la TULIP, avec une taille d’environ 50 Cm de hauteur, 70cm de diamètre. Ce drone est équipé de 4 hélices en fibre de carbone, avec un réservoir de 10 litres et une poche pouvant recevoir 2/12 batteries avec une autonomie de 2h maximum selon la puissance du chargeur utilisé. Mais le nombre de batteries fournies permet de tenir une journée entière, soit 90-100 hectares. On retiendra que l’arrosage se fait soit en liquide ou en solide en fonction de la nature de la culture.
pads.title: LE DRONE A LA TULIP !

pads.content:
Description de la solution
Description de la solution
Il s’agit de l’utilisation d'une machine locale et des produits locaux pour enro
ber les semence agricoles, ce qui permet d’améliorer la durée de vie de la semence. L'enrobage permet : 
- Réduction de l’utilisation des pesticides chimiques ;
- Possibilité de semis précoce dès les premières pluies
- Augmente la capacité de rétention d’eau par la semence
- Germination rapide.

- Pertes des semis dues aux granivores

- Les producteur (rice)s agricoles

pads.content:
Description de la solution
Description de la solution
Il s’agit de confier la gestion d’une zone forestière aux femmes constituées en Groupes de Femmes pour la Gestion des Forêts (GFGF) et de leur céder une jachère agricole d’au moins 5 ha pour une reconstitution du couvert végétal à des fins de forêts villageoises. Les activités menées par les GFGF sur ces sites sont : la Régénération Naturelle Assistée (RNA), les plantations d’enrichissement, l’ouverture et l’entretien de pare-feu, l’implantation de panneaux d’interdiction, la surveillance des sites par des rondes régulières, l’exploitation de Produits Forestiers Non Ligneux (dont le miel).
A quel défi/problème répond cette solution ?
- Participation des femmes à la gestion durable des forêts
- Création de forêts villageoises par la récupération de jachère 
- Utilisation de la RNA comme technique principale de reconstitution du couvert végétal
- Lutte contre la déforestation et la coupe du bois vert (en contrepartie les femmes sont autorisées à ramasser le bois mort et les tiges élaguées issues de la RNA pour leur cuisine)
- Amélioration de l’accès des femmes aux PFNL
A qui s'adresse la solution ?
- Aux femmes
- Aux propriétaires terriens
En quoi est-ce que cette solution est innovante ?
- La reconstitution et la gestion des forêts par les femmes
Promoteur de la solution
Association Solidarité et Entraide Mutuelle au Sahel (SEMUS) en partenariat l’ONG Britannique TREE AID, Bissiga, commune de Yako, Province du Passoré
pads.title: Description de la solution

pads.content:
Economic and Social Empowerment of Musicians and Music Technicians
By establishing a community-oriented digital platform for all stakeholders, it is aimed to create meeting spaces within the scope of music and to create inclusive communities for every stage of production. Entrepreneurship, advocacy, technical training, community, sharing and networking opportunities and empowering employees for music production are also among the priority objectives.
pads.title: Economic and Social Empowerment of Musicians and Music Technicians

pads.content:
Increasing Productivity in Agriculture by Obtaining Bio-coal from Organic Wastes
Organic wastes from homes, workplaces and restaurants are collected separately and collected in organic waste containers placed by municipalities on every street. These containers are brought to the private organic waste processing facility by municipal vehicles. The wastes are separated from their packages and subjected to incineration in a high temperature and oxygen-free environment and bio-char is obtained. This substance, which is rich in carbon and minerals, is used as fertilizer in agricultural lands.
pads.title: Increasing Productivity in Agriculture by Obtaining Bio-coal from Organic Wastes

pads.content: Pop-up Kindergarten
pads.title: Pop-up Kindergarten

pads.content:
SMART SOCIETY 4 GOOD | Soc5Zero
"SmartSociety4Good" is a digital platform that aims to provide an environment conducive to cooperation and coordination in terms of creating social impact and brings together all relevant actors (institutions, non-governmental organizations, social entrepreneurs and individuals). This platform, which combines the crowdfunding system with the corporate social responsibility framework, provides institutions with social responsibility projects. It also provides transparent and reliable support to social entrepreneurs and charities in finding funds.
www.smartsociety4good.org
pads.title: SMART SOCIETY 4 GOOD | Soc5Zero

pads.content:
Sosyalfon Sosyal Girişim Havuzu (Social Enterprise Pool)
Sosyalfon is a system-level social enterprise set out to solve the financial scaling problems of social enterprises and to bring together and support all actors working within the framework of the UN Sustainable Development Goals. With its B2B model (Sosyalfon Social Enterprise Pool), it acts as a bridge between social enterprises and institutions and with the data set it uses, it ensures that the collaborations between these actors are systematized and carried out with maximum efficiency.
http://www.sosyalfon.com/
pads.title: Sosyalfon Sosyal Girişim Havuzu (Social Enterprise Pool)

pads.content:
STEAM Sokakta (STEAM on the Streets) | City Scientific
"STEAM Sokakta" aims to ensure that children receive education and training in a more creative environment with the understanding of participation at the neighborhood level. STEAM workshops are planned to be moved to parks and provided by volunteer trainers in the local area.
pads.title: STEAM Sokakta (STEAM on the Streets) | City Scientific

pads.content:
Early Childhood Workshop for a Sustainable Future (SÜRGEÇA) 
Children's workshops will carry out full-time weekend educational activities with activist early childhood educators and experts from different disciplines, families and local organizations, with a 7R-focused curriculum (reuse, reduce, rethink, reflect, respect, redistrubute, recycle). Each workshop will prepare its own action plan for the project it deals with and develop it in accordance with the nature of action research in the process.
pads.title: Early Childhood Workshop for a Sustainable Future (SÜRGEÇA)

pads.content:
Şebeke (Network) - Leave No One Offline
The project aims to bring together young people and individuals who need technological literacy skills at an advanced age to transfer information about technology.
pads.title: Şebeke (Network) - Leave No One Offline

pads.content:
Tarlaya Ektim Üzerime Giydim ( Wearing What's Planted)
The solution has been developed within the scope of responsible production and consumption relationship for effective and efficient use of resources. The aim of the project is to produce various textile products by obtaining yarn from the corn plant, which is an ancient agricultural product and a food source for many living things. Thus, by improving the usage area of the corn plant, which is widely used as table and animal feed, ecological and sustainable production will be supported.
pads.title: Tarlaya Ektim Üzerime Giydim ( Wearing What's Planted)

pads.content:
Citizen science on air quality: "Experimento participativo de monitoreo de calidad del aire"
Collaborative project: Citizens participate in data collection and analysis
Overall goal: Assess air quality, humidity and temperature in different cities of Argentina. Specific goals: • Map the air pollution affecting the population and learn about the changes in pollution levels. • Design corridors for climate change mitigation across urban areas, defining a strategy to understand the scope and limitations of measurements. • Provide technical and educational evidence for citizens to access information that will allow them to know the quality of the air they breathe, and the relation between pollution, climate change and urban dynamics. 
Description of citizen participation: It involves the development of low-cost sensors by students from public universities at workshops organized by Argentina's Ministry of Environmental and Sustainable Development (MAyDS in Sapnish) and UNDP. Each sensor weighs 500 grams and measures different variables, such as the levels of particles suspended in the air, humidity, and temperature. Once assembled, the sensors are delivered and fixed to the bikes and backpacks of the volunteers selected. Volunteer selection is based on frequency of circulation and daily commutes across urban and adjoining areas. After a certain number of weeks, sensor data are collected to create air pollution maps. Volunteers can see the level of pollution they are exposed to along their daily commutes, and they may provide solutions to reduce their own emissions. 
Time frame. 04/29/2019 – N/A
Project leaders. • María Eugenia Di Paola, UNDP Accelerator Lab in Argentina. • Lorena Gordillo Dagallier, UNDP Accelerator Lab in Argentina.
Contact information. Email: info@open-seneca.org Email: matias.acosta@undp.org Web: open-seneca.org
pads.title: Citizen science on air quality: "Experimento participativo de monitoreo de calidad del aire"

pads.content:
VERA Data Network 
The solution is a data network that aims to collect accurate and systematic data on issues related to women, primarily femicides and violence against women, through female journalists working in local newspapers in Turkey, and to strengthen civil demands for remedial policies by supporting them with data. VERA includes local women journalists, non-governmental organizations and academic knowledge in the data collection process. It also collects data on the different sub-identities of women.
pads.title: VERA Data Network

pads.content:
La Table à masse de Faranah
In the town of Faranah in Guinea, there is a restaurant located not far from the ISAV University where students generally go to eat. As illustrated in the picture, here you have plastic tables which are therefore very light and mobile on the terrace. Because each time he receives customers whose meals often consist of coffee and the like, it represents a big risk as to the unbalance of the table. To remedy this, the managers thought of finding masses composed of cement solidified in a medium recycled box (of tomato in this case) to be fixed on the four supports of the table. It should be remembered that to solve the problem of balance, they had to find boxes of the same dimensions. this represents a solution for recycling waste, particularly medium-sized cans.
pads.title: La Table à masse de Faranah

pads.content:
Citizen science on identification of spiders and scorpions found by the community
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection
Overall goal: Engage in dialogue with the entire community to answer the queries made by citizens when an arachnid is found, and, simultaneously, receive updated information about the species distribution and the likelihood of encountering them. • Resolve citizens’ doubts as to spiders and scorpions. • Generate a positive exchange of information between researchers and other citizens as to any issues which might arise from finding arachnids. • Contribute to the conservation of arachnids by sending data to the research team. • Make prevention and control measures available to the community in case species relevant to human health are found. 
Description of citizen participation: Participants of Spider or Scorpion? (“¿Es araña o scorpion?” in Spanish) are required to provide photographs and supplementary data on the spiders and/or scorpions found. Such photographs and data are sent by citizens by means of an app downloaded on their cell phones. 
Time frame. 12/21/2017 – N/A
Project leaders. Alda González, Centre for Parasitological and Vector Studies (CEPAVE)/National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET)-National University of La Plata (UNLP
Contact information. Email: asgonzalez@cepave.edu.ar
pads.title: Citizen science on identification of spiders and scorpions found by the community

pads.content:
Citizen science on technical and diagnostic assessment on urban floods: "COINCIDE: DPLUS"
Co-created project: Citizens participate in all stages of the scientific process.
Overall goal: Conduct assessments on urban floods, by directly engaging the affected community in data collection and in the proposal of joint solutions incorporating their experience and needs. Specific goals: • Perform a diagnostic assessment of the problem, identifying the different hazards to which the community is exposed by zones, depending on its place of residence. • Work with students at all educational levels and residents in recording and characterizing the rainfall events affecting the community (determine the rainfall level that causes flooding). • Gauge the amount of stormwater runoff on streets using videos and photographs recorded by the residents previously trained. 
Description of citizen participation: The community offers valuable insight into the basin behavior, which is combined with the technical expertise of the research team to produce a conceptual model of the system operation. Both hydrometeorological (rainfall) and hydrological data (flows draining through the streets) must be recorded for this. Additionally, citizens collaborate to define pertinent locations for collecting hydrological data. Different solutions are also proposed in collaboration, working on their sustainability and feasibility, both to be presented to the corresponding governmental institution and to be applied by the community. The research team in charge of the project receives the records created by the community. Reports are created, published, and sent to the community following the record validation
Time frame. 01/08/2019 – N/A
Project leaders. • Carlos Marcelo García Rodríguez, Faculty of Exact, Physical and Natural Sciences (FCEFyN) – UNC, National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET, in Spanish). • Sebastián López, FCEFYN / UNC and CONICET. • José Manuel Díaz Lozada, FCEFYN/UNC and CONICET.
Contact information. Email: slopez@mi.unc.edu.ar Email: carlos.marcelo.garcia@unc.edu.ar Email: jmdiazlozada@unc.edu.ar
pads.title: Citizen science on technical and diagnostic assessment on urban floods: "COINCIDE: DPLUS"

pads.content:
Citizen science on management and conservation of coastal shark populations
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection.
Overall goal: Promote recreational fishing with catch and release of coastal sharks, including conventional tagging. 
Description of citizen participation: This Program involves anglers and local fishing communities that take part in scientific research by tagging sharks with the aim to collect key information for their conservation. Tagging consists in placing a yellow dart tag containing the data required for identification below the shark’s dorsal fin. This information allows researchers to determine the migration patterns, days of release, body size growth, post-release survival, and tagging site fidelity of recaptured sharks, among other data. It also enables the identification of significant areas, the number of female sharks and of specimens close to parturition, and their conservation category according to the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN), among other aspects. 
Time frame. 1/10/2010 – N/A
Project leaders. Juan Martín Cuevas, Conservation Society Argentina (WCS) and National University of La Plata (UNLP, in Spanish).
Contact information. Email: cuevasjuanmartin@gmail.com Email: conservartiburonesenargentina@gmail.com Facebook: facebook.com/conservartiburonesarg/ posts/2769954916397100 Instagram: instagram.com/conservar_tiburones_arg
pads.title: Citizen science on management and conservation of coastal shark populations

pads.content:
Citizen science on cyanobacteria and water bodies eutrophication: "CYANO"
Co-created project: Citizens participate in all stages of the scientific process.
Overall goal: Address surface waterbodies eutrophication in relation to their catchment, different water uses and the Cianosemáforo (Cyanosignal), as a tool for preventing risks in recreational waters Specific goals: • Systematize and share the knowledge gathered from applied research during the monitoring of water quality. • Raise awareness in society on the impact of the issue of eutrophication, cyanobacteria and their consequences on health. • Promote visual monitoring of waterbodies through citizen participation. • Establish partnerships and create contact networks among stakeholders. 
Description of citizen participation: Citizens participate in workshops, visual monitoring, data interpretation and communication. The Spanish acronym stands for the following: · Control: Monitoring of cyanobacteria and other ELM water quality aspects, with systematized measures and adequate space-time resolution · Y (and): The nexus involving citizens, research teaching staff, and students of FCEFyN-UNC. · Alert(alert): After processing field data, supplemented with lab data, the risk levels associated to cyanobacteria exposure are informed to schools, decision-makers, and society. · Niveles (levels): A risk level is assigned, and recommendations are made for different water uses. · Observados (observed): Personnel from the Search and Rescue Group of Calamuchita and citizens perform visual monitoring at ELM. 
Time frame. 12/05/2018 – N/A
Project leaders. Raquel Bazán, School of Exact, Physical and Natural Sciences (FCEFyN)/National University of Córdoba (UNC)
Contact information.Email: raquel.bazan@unc.edu.ar ; proyecto.cyano.cba@gmail.com Web: proyectocyanocba.wixsite.com/sitio Facebook: facebook.com/Proyecto-CYANO-319140755425912 Instagram: instagram.com/proyecto_cyano
pads.title: Citizen science on cyanobacteria and water bodies eutrophication: "CYANO"

pads.content:
Citizen science on the marine environment: "El Veril del Banco de Afuera"
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection. 
Overall goal: Assess ocean acidification in the coastal area of Mar del Plata.
Description of citizen participation: The idea behind "El Veril del Banco de Afuera" (Outer Bank Reef) lies in the collaboration between the National Institute for Fisheries Research and Development (INIDEP in Spanish) and the "Escualo” Underwater Activities Center (CASE in Spanish) diving club in collecting information on the marine environment in order to coordinate an integrated monitoring effort towards the evaluation of possible changes linked to ocean acidification in the coastal site of Mar del Plata. CASE scuba divers collect seawater samples (for the analysis of pH levels and total alkalinity, salinity, dissolved oxygen, chlorophyll-a, phytoplankton and bacterioplankton abundance) during their recreational outings to "El Veril" (a coastal site visited by divers due to its good visibility and variety of marine species) on a semi-monthly basis. They also record the metadata required at the sampling site (GPS coordinates, date and time, sampling depth, the dive computer temperature profiles, and sea conditions). 
Time frame. 12/18/2018 – N/A
Project leaders.• Carla F. Berghoff, National Institute for Fisheries Research and Development (INIDEP, in Spanish). • Lucía Epherra, INIDEP / National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET, in Spanish).
Contact information. Email: cberghoff@inidep.edu.ar Email: lepeherra@inidep.edu.ar
pads.title: Citizen science on the marine environment: "El Veril del Banco de Afuera"

pads.content:
Citizen science on environmental monitoring: "Gaviota Cangrejera"
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection.
Overall goals: Contribute to the conservation and management of Olrog’s Gulls (Larus atlanticus) considering their habitats and their behavioral flexibility in the event of any potential changes in the conditions of the area they inhabit. The ultimate goal of this project is to contribute to the implementation of ecosystem policies in the management of the marine and coastal environment. Specific goals: • Determine the migration movements of Olrog’s Gull specimens using citizens’ reports on ringed birds. • Study habitat selection by this species during the non-breeding season in areas exposed to different anthropic impacts and link such information with the data collected on their individual condition and behavioral patterns.
Description of citizen participation: During field research, Olrog’s Gull specimens are caught for ringing. As part of the monitoring process, individuals are ringed, molting characteristics are recorded, and samples of blood and feces are taken. Additionally, behavioral tests are conducted to determine their personality traits and flexibility. The information gathered may be compared with the reports on ringed birds found in different coastal areas in the south of the continent. Citizens record ringed birds and report the number on their ring by sending a photo and the location of the bird (georeferencing). 
Time frame. 02/04/2016 – N/A
Project leaders. Germán García, Institute of Marine and Coastal Research (IIMYC, in Spanish) / National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET, in Spanish)-National University of Mar del Plata (UNMdP, in Spanish).
Contact information.Email: garciagerman@conicet.gov.ar Instagram: instagram.com/avesmarinas.iimyc Twitter: twitter.com/MdqSeabirds Facebook: facebook.com/mdq.seabird
pads.title: Citizen science on environmental monitoring: "Gaviota Cangrejera"

pads.content:
Citizen science on monitoring exotic species of geckos
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection. 
Overall goal: Assess the current knowledge of the exotic gecko invasion occurring in Argentine soil. • Establish the geographic distribution of each species within Argentina. • Raise awareness on the study of invasive species and the importance of citizen involvement for their conservation and research.
Description of citizen participation: Citizens provide data on some species of exotic geckos present in their own homes. To this end, they must fill out an online form or contact project members directly through social media or via e-mail.
Project leaders. Nicolás Pelegrin, Institute of Animal Diversity and Ecology (IDEA)/ National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET)-National University of Córdoba (UNC
Contact information.Email: pelegrin.nicolas@gmail.com Web: pelegrinlab.wixsite.com/lecoherp/gecks-forasteros Facebook: facebook.com/proyecto.geckos.forasteros Instagram: instagram.com/geckosforasteros
pads.title: Citizen science on monitoring exotic species of geckos

pads.content:
Citizen science on indoor ventilation monitoring by measuring carbon dioxide (CO2)
Collaborative project: Citizens participate in data collection and analysis.
Overall goal: • Provide a low-cost device for indoor ventilation monitoring by measuring carbon dioxide (CO2). • Reduce the probability of contracting airborne diseases, such as COVID-19, among others. • Contribute to enhance performance of people sharing indoor spaces by monitoring ventilation. Specific goals: Research CO2 meter designs, select those that use components available in Argentina, build a working prototype and make the circuit and microcontroller programming code freely and publicly available.
Description of citizen participation: Citizens are provided with a CO2 meter, equivalent to a "thermometer", and receive basic training. They learn that the optimal outdoor ventilation rate is about 400 parts per million (PPM), while the indoor ventilation rate can easily reach 2500 PPM. Therefore, if during monitoring, the value is less than 800 PPM, citizens will record that ventilation is adequate and they can remain indoors with a low risk, as long as they keep at least a one (1) meter distance and wear a mask (in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic). On the other hand, if the value rises, citizens know that they will have to increase ventilation or, otherwise, leave the room until the air is renewed.
Time frame. 12/26/2020 - N/A
Project leaders. Jorge Aliaga, National University of Hurlingham (UNAHUR, inSpanish), University of Buenos Aires (UBA by its Spanish acronym) and National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICE, in Spanish).
Contact information. Email: jorge.aliaga@unahur.edu.ar Web: jorgealiaga.com.ar/?page_id=2864
pads.title: Citizen science on indoor ventilation monitoring by measuring carbon dioxide (CO2)

pads.content:
Citizen science on urban forest conservation: "Censo Forestal Urbano de la ciudad de Bragado"
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection.
Overall goal: Conduct a census of the entire tree population in the chief town of the district (Bragado) for future public policy-making Specific goals: • Expand the urban tree census to the remaining towns located in the District of Bragado. • Create technical and scientific material based on the surveys conducted. • Identify and solve issues related to urban forests in the medium and long term. • Plan public strategies for proper tree care and pruning. • Set solid foundations for future landscape designs to be used for city planning, based on such previously assessed needs. 
Description of citizen participation: Citizens collect tree census data using a mobile app, after having been trained (both on the operation of the app and on the botanical knowledge required for tree identification). 
Time frame. 03/21/2021 – N/A
Project leaders. • Maximiliano Dorado • Silvina Guayta • Luciano Burghetti • Marcelo Bondoni
Contact information. Email: maximiliano_dorado@yahoo.com.ar Email: sguayta@hotmail.com Email: luchoburghetti@gmail.com Email: bondonimarcelo@gmail.com The initiative has been posted on the official website of the Municipality of Bragado, on the Citizen Science tab, as well as on the social media accounts of the local government and Foro Ambiental de Bragado. Web: www.bragado.gov.ar/participacion-ciudadana
pads.title: Citizen science on urban forest conservation: "Censo Forestal Urbano de la ciudad de Bragado"

pads.content:
Container Classroom 
The NGO 'Kolektif Rivier Nwar' works on the West Coast of Mauritius, covering a geographical area from Tamarin to Case Noyale. This part of the island is one of the poorest, with high numbers of unemployment, drug abuse and children and young adults out of school. This solution uses a renter container space, which has been converted into a classroom to welcome children and teenagers from the "cité des salines" to engage in educational activities provided by the NGO. The field-worker who manages the on-site facility is a resident of the same "cité" and maintains access (opening, closing, etc.,) to the container. The solution addresses many problems that the cité faces and has been a success, as many parents like to send their children there. The activities involve: (i) learning to read and write (ii) learning to draw and paint (iii) learning to engage with one and another An adjacent field is used for sport coaching and classes. Activities are supported by: 1 specialised educator 1 occupational therapist 1 child psychologist 1 parental coach 1 sport coach 1 music trainer 1 field worker (lives in the cité)
pads.title: Container Classroom

pads.content:
Citizen science on beach monitoring: "Playas Sostenibles de Mar del Plata"
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection. 
Overall goals: Develop a set of reliable indicators for monitoring and evaluating environmental conditions in coastal areas Create a manual that will enable reliable and systematic data collection to contribute to the formulation of a sustainable beach management plan for both public and private recreational beaches in Mar del Plata, with the aim to obtain an environmental certification Specific goals: Conduct an assessment of the characteristics of the coastal area on different scales for beach use classification Develop an instrument suitable for the monitoring and evaluation of public and private recreational beaches Train students, managers, and the personnel employed at beach facilities on how to implement procedures for recording the data to be collected at beach sites Select, develop, and put into practice the most adequate indicators Create an appropriate quality index Monitor the environmental quality of beach sites over a year, for the purposes of field index calibration and technical data collection for decision-makers Devise a management plan enabling the application of the most adequate environmental strategies for each type of beach site, based on its natural characteristics and use Generate dissemination material and recreational strategies to communicate risk management measures in order to raise awareness among visitors on the natural characteristics and conservation of beach sites Collaborate with the formulation of a management plan for the short, medium, and long term enabling the implementation of a consensual development strategy for the seashore of Mar del Plata Create a procedural manual for devising a management plan and recording data to determine beach environmental quality indicators associated to risk maps 
Description of citizen participation: Citizens participate in the identification of the problem, data collection, and they might contribute to their dissemination.
Time frame: 01/09/2019 - 01/08/2021 
Project leader: Eduardo Vallarino, Faculty of Exact and Natural Sciences (FCEyN, in Spanish) of the National University of Mar del Plata (UNMdP, in Spanish).
Contact information: Email: vallarinoeduardo@gmail.com The final document will be available in a digital format at MdPET’s website and the digital repositories of participating universities. It will also be published by the publishing house of the National University of Mar del Plata (EUDEM, in Spanish). Web: www.mardelplataentretodos.org
pads.title: Citizen science on beach monitoring: "Playas Sostenibles de Mar del Plata"

pads.content:
Citizen science on monitoring the diversity of Lady Beetles: "Vaquitas"
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection. 
Overall goal: Identify species of Lady Beetles existing in Argentina, determine their geographical distribution, and assess the potential impact of an invasive species, specifically the Asian Lady Beetle (Harmonia axyridis) and eventually of any other exotic species on native ones Specific goals: Monitor the spread of the Asian Lady Beetle across Argentina Assess the degree of spatial coexistence of said invasive species with other conspicuous native species (i.e., obvious to the eye) of the same family, in order to identify the most threatened species 
Description of citizen participation: Citizens send photos indicating the date and the geographic location where said insects have been observed
Time frame: 7/12/2019 - NA
Project leaders: Victoria Werenkraut, CONICET Researcher. National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET, in Spanish).
Contact information: Email: werenkraut@comahue-conicet.gob.ar Web: www.proyectovaquitas.com.ar Instagram: instagram.com/proyectovaquitas Twitter: twitter.com/pvaquitas
pads.title: Citizen science on monitoring the diversity of Lady Beetles: "Vaquitas"

pads.content:
Citizen science on presence, habitat and ecology of the Toucan: "Tucanes en mi Jujuy"
Contributory project: Designed by members of the scientific community, and citizens participate in data collection. 
Overall goal: Use Toco Toucans as flagship species to raise public awareness about biodiversity conservation in SSJ and contribute to environmentally sustainable urban planning. Specific goals: 1) Understand habitat use and selection patterns, seasonal migration, diet composition and reproductive habits of Toco Toucans in the city of SSJ; 2) Determine the link between toucan populations and different urban structural features; 3) Engage society in reporting the presence of toucans in different parts of the city and monitoring nest boxes, as a way of raising awareness about the value and protection of this bird and biodiversity in general; 4) Offer talks and workshops in academic institutions aimed at students and faculty to promote environmental education; 5) Prepare a diagnosis of the current situation of Toco Toucans in SSJ, identifying actual and potential threats affecting them, as well as beneficial actions and urban features for these species. 
Description of citizen participation: Anyone can participate by reporting toucan sightings in different parts of the city, through social media, website and/or mobile app. Although submitting photos and videos is not mandatory, these contributions are also encouraged. In addition, citizens also participate in placing and monitoring nest boxes to assess whether toucans are breeding in the city.
Time frame: 05/03/2021 - N/A 
Project leaders. • Román Ruggera, National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET, in Spanish) and National University of Jujuy (UNJu, in Spanish) • Alejandro Schaaf, CONICET • Noelia Gonzalez, CONICET • Agustina Yapura, UNJu • Natalia Chocobar, UNJu
Contact information: Emails: raruggera@fca.unju.edu.ar ; schaaf.alejandro@gmail.com ; novi.arg31@gmail.com ; agusyapura_09@live.com ; tucanesenmijujuy@gmail.com Facebook: facebook.com/tucanesenmijujuy Instagram: instagram.com/tucanesenmijujuy
pads.title: Citizen science on presence, habitat and ecology of the Toucan: "Tucanes en mi Jujuy"

pads.content:
Pocket Recovery Phone
Pocket Recovery Phone is a local solution aimed at protecting data and privacy of Smart phone users. It also serves as an early warning or alert system when someone's phone is taken away or distant from them. The solution addresses the following challenges:
-Customer Privacy Protection
-Supports reduction in the rate of theft and loss of smart phones
-Provides an efficient way for the customer to find their data in an event of loss or theft of their smart phones.
A solution comprised of three modules;
-An Electronic key ring
-A mobile Application and
-A Geolocation Platform
pads.title: Pocket Recovery Phone

A Dabola, pour maitriser la croissance de ses fleurs, notre restaurateur a privilégié ces pots traditionnels aux longues jambes que nous appellerons : le pot girafe. Au delà de l'aspect circonférence, ce pot à base de métaux recyclés permet de protéger les racines contre les écoulements de boue en cas de grande pluies, facilite un nettoyage précis des contours et permet de lutter efficacement contre le gaspillage d'eau destinée au maintient des végétaux cultivés.

pads.content:
Walnut skin remover (shelling machine) 
The walnut peeling machine is a Locally made equipment, assembled from local available and recycled materials. The walnut is poured directly into the metal barrel, and the walnuts are continuously rolled and rubbed in the barrel while rotating to remove the skin. Water is added manually to assist in making the skin and dirt on the surface fall off. The Machin is made of a metal bucket that is attached to a motor which works on not only electricity but also on battery to accommodate for the long hours powers cuts in coastal area There is a high demand and need for the machine especially during the walnut harvest season. The owner accepts nuts from small scale farmers in her village who want to peel their walnut harvest. How can UNDP support the innovator: UNDP can work on refining the model on the condition of replicating it to other farmers in different villages.
pads.title: Walnut skin remover (shelling machine)

pads.content:
Stone rainwater tanks (Indigenous knowledge brought back to life) 
Villagers in the Syrian coastal areas are resorting to their indigenous knowledge to collect rainwater and overcome water scarcity during dry seasons. The tanks are made from rocks and big stones which are found in the coastal area. Special skills and knowledge are needed to build the tanks, these skills are only available to some old villagers who inherited them from their ancestors. The rainwater tanks were made to collect rainwater during the rainy season and save it for the dry seasons. However, because of the viability of public water provided by the government from different resources, people stepped building the tanks, as a result, the knowledge and skills of building stone water tanks were about to be forgotten. Now because of the longer dry seasons and scarcity of water that is due to climate change, people brought back these tool to collect rainwater.
pads.title: Stone rainwater tanks (Indigenous knowledge brought back to life)

pads.content:
le réfrigérateur réservoir de Dabola
Dans la ville de Dabola et précisément au marché, se trouve un réservoir d'eau cylindrique au bas duquel se trouvent greffés des robinets permettant à la fois à plusieurs personnes de se désaltérer. On remarquera que ce réservoir est enveloppé dans des couches de tissus en vue de réduire la pénétration de la chaleur; dans la mesure où, le réservoir est fortement et longuement utilisé pour conserver de l'eau fraiche. Il constitue ainsi, une solution de conservation d'eau mais aussi, un moyen de recycler les cylindres de provenant de certaines usines d'huilerie tout comme certaines entreprises de production et ou de vente de carburant.
pads.title: le réfrigérateur réservoir de Dabola

pads.content:
Biodigester to obtain gas from livestock waste 
Mercedes Echarte, Researcher 
https://www.conicet.gov.ar/new_scp/mail.php?id=24198&detalle=yes&esprimera=1
Mercedes Echarte, Researcher at the National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET) and the National Institute of Agricultural Technology (INTA), Professor at the School of Agricultural Sciences (National University of Mar del Plata) and Director of the Biomass and Bioenergy Laboratory of the Balcarce Integrated Unit (INTA-FCA, UNMdP).
There are days when the residents of Los Pinos cannot enjoy such simple habits as going out to their yards to drink a cold beverage or get together with friends to have a barbecue in the open air. The inhabitants of this rural community in Balcarce district in Buenos Aires must share dinners with flies and strong odors from the enormous amounts of livestock waste that accumulate everywhere without finding a better destination. In addition, they suffer frequent power outages, consequently, access to water is difficult, since the way to extract it is through electric pumps. They also do not have a natural gas network and depend on the use of gas containers or firewood for heating and cooking. Based on this community problem, researchers from different affiliations decided to use their technical knowledge to find a solution that could solve more than one problem: a biodigester to obtain gas from livestock waste. The groundbreaking implications of this project (also known as the "Biogas Demonstration Unit for the Development of Sustainable Rural Energy") is not only the generation of biogas through the waste of poultry and pigs, or that the municipality joined the academy and the community, or that the community schools submit projects at national level to replicate the experience, but, in addition to all this, the inhabitants of Los Pinos formed a Cooperative to be able to make it sustainable over time, showing interest, commitment, desire for improvement and a bet for the future. 
Prototype system
The amount of biomass available is such that, according to the survey conducted in the community, it could be used to feed a plant ten or fifteen times larger than the one being built. But it is a start: the work in progress is a concrete biodigester with a capacity to store 100 cubic meters.
www.unsam.edu.ar/tss/energia-cooperativa/
DIY / open source
Yes
Prototype
pads.title: Biodigester to obtain gas from livestock waste

pads.content:
''Nô - Siouré''
Description de la solution:
Il s’agit de mécanismes pour une production avicole traditionnelle améliorée à grande échelle et de rentabilité accélérée et attachée à une formule de pérennisation dénommée No-Siouré (en dialecte moaga). Le rôle essentiel qui s’affiche de cette initiative est : La promotion de l’aviculture traditionnelle (race locale) couplée à une croissance économique en milieu rural à travers :
- La réduction du temps de travail des producteurs
- La multiplication des gains
- La professionnalisation et même la spécialisation des producteurs
Localité d'identification de la solution:
Koudougou - Province du Boulkiemdé - Burkina Faso
Promoteur de la solution :
ZOUBGA Talinmanègba Claver, Agent de développement communautaire, Formation en Psychologie
BP. 13 Koudougou; Tel.: 70 23 26 80 / 75 03 60 02 WhatsApp: 70 23 26 80
Email: zctalin68@yahoo.fr 
A quel défi/problème répond cette solution ?
- Au chômage des jeunes en milieu rural 
- A la fixation des jeunes dans leurs terroirs 
- A la faible production avicole traditionnelle (race locale)
- A la faiblesse des revenus de l’aviculture traditionnelle
- A la faible motivation des producteurs pour l’aviculture traditionnelle
- A la faible qualité nutritionnelle des ménages ruraux
A qui s'adresse la solution ?
La principale cible visée par cette initiative est l’ensemble des aviculteurs du milieu rural avec un focus chez les jeunes (femmes et hommes).
En quoi est-ce que cette solution est innovante ?
- L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est un moyen efficace de lutte contre le chômage et la pauvreté en milieu rural.
- L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est hautement Genre sensible : traite des inégalités sociales et de l’équité (activité praticable par n’importe quelle personne de n’importe quel statut social avec les mêmes chances)
- L’entrepreneuriat avicole traditionnelle est réalisable à moindre coût
- L’aviculture traditionnelle améliorée est économique, écologique et hygiénique
- L’aviculture contribue à la sécurité alimentaire et à la qualité nutritionnelle
pads.title: ''Nô - Siouré''

pads.content:
Accelerating E-Learning in Bangladesh
Online education has been gaining grounds all around the world, essentially because of convenience and cost-effectiveness. The pandemic, imposing its ravages on on-site in-person schooling, generated a boost for online education. However, online education is dependent on the availability of ICT infrastructure, hardware, and software, which are expensive and thus, invariably place developing countries among the community of nations, and resource-poor segments of population within each country in a highly disadvantaged position. The impact of the pandemic on education in Bangladesh has been an alarming “education deficit”, and in the underprivileged rural sector, a deficit of a disastrous proportion. To address this education deficit, Accelerator Lab Bangladesh, in collaboration with the Volunteers Association for Bangladesh (VAB) supported 191 digitally underprivileged high school students from 9 schools across 5 districts (Jashore, Satkhira, Kurigram, Nilphamari and Pabna) to receive e-learning for their 2021 Secondary School Certificate (SSC) preparation via tablets and digital contents related to the three Science subjects on which the exam in the Science “stream” was held – Physics, Chemistry and Biology. A picture is attached of the students with the distributed tabs.
pads.title: Accelerating E-Learning in Bangladesh

pads.content:
Hydroponics and fish farming to achieve food security and generate decent income 
Due to the increased prices of food, including vegetables and fruits, Abu Hassoun family decided to start their small project of Aquaponics farms. Aquaponic farms are a combination of aquaculture and hydroponics — where fish are raised in tanks and the water from the fish tanks is recirculated into the plant beds, so the plants can absorb nutrients from fish waste in the water.
AbuHasoun Family build the closed symbiotic system using simplified design to reduce building and operational costs using locally available materials. 
The project proved to be a success and the family achieved self-sufficiency and created a decent source of income from selling both fish and crops.
pads.title: Hydroponics and fish farming to achieve food security and generate decent income

pads.content:
Plastic waste management in Cox's Bazaar
Cox's Bazaar - the world's longest uninterrupted sea beach and the major tourist spot of Bangladesh - accumulates a huge amount of plastic waste each day, mostly from bottles and cans littered by tourists. A solutions mapping visit to the region uncovered that a local NGO is working on managing these waste by recycling - collecting the plastic waste, sorting them into different categories and reselling them. The video shows solution mapper Sohara Mehroze explaining the process of sorting the plastic in the recycling facility.
pads.title: Plastic waste management in Cox's Bazaar

pads.content:
Household Expenditure Survey on Financing Disaster-induced Expenses in Bangladesh
1. Climate change induced disasters such as tropical storms, cyclones and monsoon floods are recurring events in Bangladesh. Every year different parts of Bangladesh face different types of disasters. Exposure to disaster causes considerable damage to assets and livelihood opportunities of affected households. In response, households adopt private defensive measures investing their private funds, which acts as an additional financial burden. There is very limited information available about expenditure on disaster risk reduction and recovery in the country. In this context, to understand the types of expenditure, differences in expenditure by gender and help minimize them, the Accelerator Lab, in collaboration with the UK based International Institute for Environment and Development (IIED) commissioned a survey to assess the percentage of climate-related expenditure as a share of household income and expenditure in climate-vulnerable regions of Bangladesh. This research closely complements the “Strengthening Governance of Climate Change Finance to Enhance Gender Equality” project of UNDP Bangladesh. The findings of this study can help the Accelerator Lab narrow down specific district and female-headed households, most vulnerable and in risk of exposure to floods and storms, which holds promise for the lab to pilot new climate financing approaches and innovative adaptation solutions in the future.
pads.title: Household Expenditure Survey on Financing Disaster-induced Expenses in Bangladesh

pads.content:
Network Urban Growspace
The innovation: Urban Grow House Network This is an expansion of an existing urban garden solution that can be utilized by persons in their space to produce food items for themselves and suppliers within their area. As food prices continually rise amidst the supply chain disruptions this solution not only produces affordable food in small urban spaces, it can also provide a revenue stream from excess yields that we can purchase and distribute to our network
From the insight gained from the existing model, the activity seems profitable and sustainable. The solution developer is seeking to refine the Grow Houses using locally sourced bamboo. Bamboo is an invasive species that grows quickly and requires no human tending. Bamboo’s fibrous stem is also strong and versatile. The Grow Houses are tailored to the Caribbean climate and, even apart from the bamboo, the grow houses will be made out of locally sourced repurposed sustainable materials. Mr. Samlalsingh seeks to build a network of these Grow Houses and continually refine methodologies with the new data gained from the unique micro environments of every new site.
How the innovation started? This innovation began in 2015 so that we could produce healthy food on a consistent and easy basis for a household. We utilized methods from different agricultural methods such as aquaponics and companion planting to build our own semi intensive system. It has changed over time from producing leafy greens, to seedlings, to vegetables. We have been constantly rebuilding and refining the most efficient use of space and methodologies 
The Future? To make the operations more environmentally sustainable with regard to water management and to eliminate all non-renewable materials, such as plastics. Mr. Samlalsingh seeks to develop a manual for the solution so that it can be shared regionally and with institutions such as the UNDP so that it can make a greater impact globally
pads.title: Network Urban Growspace

pads.content:
Handmade Sanitary Pads
Problem being solved? Pollution and waste due to feminine personal hygiene and sexual education
This project locally produces and distributes cloth menstrual pads as an eco-friendly alternative to disposable menstrual products, as well as engaging in sexual and reproductive health education. 
What's the solution?
In 2018, Amy Li Baksh embarked on her own eco-friendly/reusable journey and went looking for locally made reusable products. She couldn't find any. Recognizing that this was a huge hole in our local market and wanting to create a product that could help solve the issue of plastic waste she began experimenting with hand-made, cloth sanitary pads for women. She also realized that to get women to use them she would have to fill some of the gaps in our local education when it comes to sexual and reproductive health. She also designs the fabric prints used for the pads since she felt Caribbean artwork was the best way to make an unfamiliar product seem less intimidating and to give persons who menstruate a positive and beautiful connection to their periods rather than the clinical white products they are used to using.
"I would like to change the local culture of menstrual product use not only in Trinidad and Tobago but across the Caribbean. Ideally I want to reach the most underserved communities rather than only engaging with communities already privileged with access to education and funding. I am currently limited by the small production team (myself and one other person) as well as pandemic-related issues with shipping in some of the fabric I use that is not currently available locally."
Future of the Innovation and Future Prospects
Accessing the female prisons where there is a shortage of sanitary pads. Also a widespread distribution system so that pads can be sent to persons across the Caribbean, as well as opportunities to engage with marginalized communities and do educational workshops on sexual and reproductive health.
https://newsday.co.tt/2019/10/08/lily-pads-making-periods-go-green/
pads.title: Handmade Sanitary Pads

Digital Registration for Civil Society Organizations

Agreement is for the purpose to enable easier registration of the assistance in order to ease the procedure for exemption from customs, excise and other import duties and / or exemption from value added tax (VAT) on trade in goods and services, in the procurement of goods and services, as well as import of goods and equipment is envisaged. for the needs of the project / donation. Digital Platform - Dialogue with EU
The project CSO Dialogue – Platform for Structural Participation in EU Integrations aims to facilitate meaningful and structured participation of the civil society that expresses the views of citizens, to impact key sector reforms in the EU accession process. The platform offers a opportunity for structural participation of the civil society in institutional consultation mechanisms, thereby increasing availability of information and support for participation in policy-making related to the EU accession process. The platform has the following functions: 1. conducting research to measure involvement and participation of the civil society; 2. organizing events and public consultations; 3. monitoring the work of sector working groups by developing analyses and reports; 4. designing visual charts on key conclusions from work of sector working groups in order to improve information dissemination to citizens about this process; 5. production of video materials, educational videos, tutorials, and the like; 6. drafting a declaration on transparency of the negotiations process; 7. streaming meetings of the Council for Cooperation between the Government of RNM and Civil Society; 8. organizing annual conferences around the issue of civil society participation in sector policy creation and implementation
https://dijalogkoneu.mk/en/
pads.title: Digital Platform - Dialogue with EU

Tanques de recolección y Filtración de Agua

La forma en que funcionan estos sistemas es a través de la instalación de canaletas colectoras de PVC en los bordes de los techos de lámina. Estas canaletas conducen el agua de lluvia a un tanque de agua, donde se almacena el agua. Una vez almacenada el agua, las familias beneficiarias pueden abrir un grifo, que permite el paso del agua a través de un filtro que purifica el líquido, para su posterior consumo. 
Es un método replicable en diferentes comunidades, ya que la organización ha creado un manual para que cualquier persona pueda hacerlo en sus hogares. Además de capturar el agua de lluvia, puede filtrarla directamente.

pads.content: Promoting equitable digital education in Bangladesh
pads.title: Promoting equitable digital education in Bangladesh

pads.content:
Exploring the impact of online education in Bangladesh
The global pandemic has had an adverse impact on learning and equity; but it also provided an opportunity to rethink the way students are educated. To explore this, the UNDP Accelerator Lab joined hands with the Volunteers Association for Bangladesh (VAB) – a grassroots organization dedicated to rural education since 2000 - to pilot an innovative E-Learning project. It is assisting rural and disadvantaged high school students from 9 schools across five districts - the majority being girls - on their preparation for the upcoming 2021 national secondary school certificate (SSC) examination through e-learning via tablets and digital contents. However, it is yet to be tested how effective and impactful are online-learning models via tablets and digital contents for digitally underprivileged rural high-school students, especially girls, for the preparation of their SSC examination. The Accelerator Lab is conducting a baseline survey to assess the current and the pre-pilot implementation status of digital underprivileged rural high school students from 5 districts in Bangladesh on relevant indicators, and an end line survey to assess the progress, results, and impact of the pilot (online-learning model via tablet and digital contents) intervention (including samples from non-tablet users) to deliver the necessary knowledge around impact of such models.
pads.title: Exploring the impact of online education in Bangladesh

pads.content:
Enhancing cross country collaboration
The Regional Bureau for Asia & the Pacific (RBAP) of UNDP selected several Country Offices - Bangladesh, India, Indonesia and the Philippines to show core strengths in specific development areas and help these COs in the delivery of “beyond borders” support to other RBAP COs that have the potential to benefit from their lessons learned, guidance, and/or direct support. To this end, the Bangladesh Accelerator Lab is working on the Capacity for Experience Sharing (CESI) initiative on developing an innovative, collaborative cross country knowledge management platform. CESI will promote a risk-based decision-making process that enables understanding of multiple concurrent threats and complex risks, trade-offs and opportunities, and then acting on that knowledge.
pads.title: Enhancing cross country collaboration

pads.content:
Women's digital innovation hackathon
Technology is becoming increasingly ingrained in people’s daily lives, with 90% of future jobs requiring digital skills. Despite its potential to empower women, technology careers are enmeshed with existing gender inequality, hindering women’s participation in the production, management, and use of technology. In this context, in line with UNDP Accelerator Lab’s Mission of reducing the Gender Digital Divide and increase female representation in the Bangladesh’s Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Space, an all-women digital hackathon was organized in July 2021. The Accelerator Lab’s women’s digital innovation hackathon aimed to promote ICT skills and innovation to female students and young professionals and find new digital solutions to a wide range of social problems, that can be piloted within the Accelerator lab network to address key development challenges of Bangladesh. While it was organized as a competition, the aim was to offer encouragement and learning opportunities to the participants. The Hackathon had two Challenge Tracks: Digital Transformation & Smart City. There was 200+ applications submitted. The top 3 teams of each Hack received funding to grow their innovative solutions after the event, with the Gold award being worth $1500 USD plus scholarships to Edx’s professional certificate series in deep learning and fintech, silver award being $1000 USD and Bronze award being $500 USD. All participants will receive scholarships to University of Helsinki and Reaktor’s “Elements of AI” online course. The Hackathon was carried out partnerships with Women in Digital, UNLEASH Innovation Lab, Reaktor, University of Helsinki, and UltraHack.
pads.title: Women's digital innovation hackathon

pads.content:
Waste collection robot in Bangladesh
The Bangladesh Accelerator Lab organized a Women’s Digital Innovation hackathon to promote ICT skills and innovation practices to female students and professionals and find new digital solutions to a wide range of SDG challenges. The winning solution that came up from this solution was one that aims to address the persistent challenge of waste detection, segregation, and collection. A Self-Controlling Spider Robot was designed by the first prize winning team of the hackathon. The robot's purpose is to collect, detect, and separate wastage for a model Smart City. The solution would use technologies such robot technology, sensor technology, artificial intelligence, machine learning, etc. The solution is particularly timely as garbage management is a huge challenge in Bangladesh and if not managed properly, not only will diseases increase but will also lead to soil, air and water pollution. The picture shows the members of the team that designed this solution.
pads.title: Waste collection robot in Bangladesh
