INNOFEIT as a part of its efforts to close the gap between academic education and practical expertize and prepare its students for better coping with the industrial challenges ahead. INNOFEIT is a hub for interaction among FEEIT staff, FEEIT students and industrial partners that will foster connections and transfer of technology as well as novel innovative ideas that will aid the economical growth of the sector and the society in general.
pads.title: SMART PHOTOVOLTAIC MODULE (FV-PAM)

pads.content:
ORGANIC FARMING IMPROVES ORANG ASLI LIVELIHOODS
The typical top-down business model was turned upside down such that the lion's share of OA Organik's profits was given to the Orang Asli (OA) farmers. The purpose of this project was not only to strengthen the economic livelihoods of the OA but also to empower them to preserve their forest and environment. The first project was based in Tasik Chini, Pahang YKPM together with the Indigenous Peoples Assistance Facility (IPAF) created this organic farming project, which has grown from the initial eight farmers to 40 today. YKPM Managing Director Kon Onn Sein said OA Organik had the opportunity to penetrate the local market on a premium scale because Jaya Grocer assisted farmers under the OA Organik project by transporting their produce from Kuantan to Kuala Lumpur using the supermarket chain's chiller trucks. Every month, Jaya Grocer transports three tonnes of produce from the farm. Additionally, the OA community and farmers are not expected to pay high down payments to promote or market their produce. In addition, Jaya Grocer pays them reasonable prices for their produce. Therefore, the farmers not only get to reduce their production and promotion costs, but they also get to enjoy a higher profit margin. Jaya Grocer also benefits from its partnership with OA Organik, as the brand is able to create a positive image among the rakyat through this corporate social responsibility (CSR) project. By assisting the farmers under the OA Organik project, both the OA Organik and Jaya Grocer brands have become more reputable in towns and metropolitan cities.
pads.title: ORGANIC FARMING IMPROVES ORANG ASLI LIVELIHOODS

pads.content:
RICEFERT: Software for fertiliser use calculation in rice cultivation
RiceFERT is a computerised software and decision support system, that is a site-specific fertiliser management for rice production in Malaysia. It provides location-specific fertiliser recommendations according to a soil test-target yield approach. The recommendation on fertiliser rates is based on four essential components: indigenous soil nutrient status, soil fertility status, crop nutrient requirements, and target rice yield. The variety of rice used will also affect the recommendation. There is a critical need to recalibrate from using the current blanket rate of fertiliser, which has been in use for more than two decades in rice cultivation, towards a precision fertilizer management system. This is important to ensure that rice crops and soil receive the exact amount of nutrients to achieve optimal health and productivity. This technology recommends more efficient amounts of fertiliser, typically 10% to 15% less than the current blanket rate used in rice granaries. Further research is being conducted in larger scale rice granaries so that this technology can be adapted to the government fertiliser subsidy scheme.
pads.title: RICEFERT: Software for fertiliser use calculation in rice cultivation

pads.content:
Variable Rate Technologies for Rice Cultivation
In the rice production sector, the seed application system is used to provide data which has been collected through sensors and satellites on land levels (like the surface of land) where seeds are planted. This is helpful as there are differences in land levels which can affect the quality and quantity of rice produced. By using a farming software to identify the conditions and land levels of each land area, farmers can identify and calculate the optimum amount of seeds needed to be planted on an uneven ground to produce just as many germinated seeds as on even land areas. This enables optimum planting of paddy plant. Another important step for an optimum harvest is the nurturing process, which is related to how paddy plants are fertilised. Data about soil fertility from the fertiliser application system can help farmers and other users make more informed decisions on the amount of fertiliser required at a given area. The application of variable rate technologies can save labour costs up to 50% and reduce the use of chemical fertilisers by 25%, limiting its impact on the environment.
pads.title: Variable Rate Technologies for Rice Cultivation

pads.content:
DEHYDOME: Stingless Bee Portable Dehydrator
Stingless bee honey is a superfood as it contains phenolics and antioxidants that are beneficial to our health, by nature, stingless bee honey goes through rapid hydration and a high moisturising rate. This makes it difficult storage-wise, because alcohol fermentation quickly occurs when the moisturising rate of honey is high. Thus come DEHYDOME, a portable and tool, perfect for stingless bee honey producers and entrepreneurs. DEHYDOME can be used to dehydrate stingless bee honey at its most optimum level, and from there, extract the highest quality stingless bee honey. Not only is it smaller and cheaper than conventional methods in the market, its dehydration capabilities are also remarkably efficient. The dehydrator can reduce honey's water content to below 20% in six to 10 hours, faster than the 24 hours it would take with common methods. Another interesting fact about the DEHYDOME is that it has Internet of Things (IoT) capabilities that allow it to be operated from a mobile app. This makes the dehydrator easier to control and monitor remotely as long as there is internet connectivity. Its IoT control features include a live/dead tool, operation period set, electric-use data, and even an electric bill.
pads.title: DEHYDOME: Stingless Bee Portable Dehydrator

pads.content:
AIR QUALITY MONITORING SYSTEM (PURECLOUD)
This is a joint effort with the local company INform (https://inform.mk/) where our experts developed a portable device (BlueCloud) capable of measuring air pollutants thus monitoring the air quality. The design and the development of the device was made by INNOFEIT experts whereas INform’s experts developed a cloud back-end for data storage and analysis. As a result, the integrated solution is now commercialized as PureCloud. Moreover, INNOFEIT is in the process of developing a calibration laboratory for certifying the monitoring devices.
https://inno.feit.ukim.edu.mk/projects/
pads.title: AIR QUALITY MONITORING SYSTEM (PURECLOUD)

pads.content:
Mushroom farming with nuclear technology
Agensi Nuklear Malaysia is using it for a good cause by exposing mushrooms to gamma rays to modify their genes. One of the documented positive results was that shitake mushrooms previously planted only in the highlands have been modified so that they can be planted in the lowlands as well. Ts. Dr. Azhar Mohamad said they use nuclear energy to alter the genetic material of plants for instance is not at all dangerous. Instead, this method enables different variations of plants to be grown for the benefit of society. This diversity allows the selection and screening of quality mushrooms that are resistant to the changes in the environment and can be grown and harvested in a shorter time. This new breed is not classified as Genetically Modified Organism (GMO) because no external DNA is inserted into the cells of the mushroom. The mushrooms are grown on suitable substrate such as rice straw and wood dust that has been formed into blocks for easy handling. These materials are ideal to be used as substrate as they are low in cost and easy to prepare The project makes the process of producing the mushroom blocks from farm waste more efficient by using nuclear energy. The inspiration behind this innovation is Dr Azhar’s goal to go green. His method keeps the cost of production low as there is no need for farmers to purchase an expensive block-making machine Mushrooms can be collected continuously and can be produced up to 4 times/block/cycle. After a cycle is completed, the waste can be composted for fertigation activities
pads.title: Mushroom farming with nuclear technology

pads.content:
Resource-saving aquafarm
Mr Azizul Julirin come up with the brilliant idea of creating an aquafarm. Designed to incorporate two functions in one system, the Kundasang Aquafarm takes the form of aquaculture by rearing fish and hydroponics, where vegetables are planted without the use of soil in an enclosed area. What is needed is just an area of any size and some water from the surrounding areas, and you’re good to go. The aquafarm is sustainable and ensures that the environment is not harmed. For instance, waste from the fish is used as nutrients for the vegetable plantations, instead of chemicals. In addition, space is used creatively as vertical planting is also practiced in his aquafarm. Instead of continuously clearing large areas of land, his soilless invention to grow vegetables does the trick and comes in handy. This method requires less time and labour to increase yield. This will ensure all those involved earn a better living while being eco-friendly. The Kundasang Aquafarm helps communities in rural and urban areas. The farm is also open to anyone who wants to learn and start her own farm.
pads.title: Resource-saving aquafarm

pads.content:
Banana and Catappa based Water Filter
My Filtro Aqua Natsponge is a filter that is used to filter wastewater, which can be used at home and even in restaurants. The innovation came about as the innovator Noor Liza often came across issues of waste being clogged up in pipe holes which consequently resulted in water and air pollution. The solution is inspired from Malay traditional knowledge, whereby in villages the Malays would soak their cutleries in a basin filled with water and banana leaves. This is done because the banana leaves can absorb grease and oil from the cutleries, which would then make it easier for the cleaning process to take place. Similarly, the innovation uses banana fibers from its stem to create a sponge that would be part of the first layer in the wastewater filtration system. With improvements being made to the design and function of the wastewater filter along the way, Catappa leaves are added to the mix. The upgraded version not only filters clean and clear water as a by product, it also prevents clogs and bacteria build-up after wastewater has been filtered. What also gives the My Filtro Aqua Natsponge an edge over others is that it is relatively cheaper and it does not use synthetic sponges that are harmful to the environment. On top of that, the filter can even be connected through a smartphone app to give an indication of the pH level of the filtered water. This will indicate when consumers should replace the first layer of the wastewater filter.
pads.title: Banana and Catappa based Water Filter

pads.content:
Calcium beads from fish scales
Manik BioHAP is a special water filter which uses beads made from hydroxyapatite from tilapia fish scales as its basic material. Hydroxyapatite has a high content of calcium ions, and when infused with water through the water filter for consumption, this can benefit consumers. This is because they would also be drinking water high in calcium and on top of that, clean and filtered water too. In essence, this can be used as a calcium supplement, and a source of filtered water. Fish scales are the best choice as it also contains another element called beta-tricalcium phosphate which is able to produce even more calcium ions.
pads.title: Calcium beads from fish scales

pads.content:
Remdii: An eczema remedy
Dr Lai's child suffered from severe eczema and as she could not find a cure to ease his discomfort despite searching high and low. Her husband encouraged her on creating her own remedy. Where eczema is concerned, the dermis layer is where allergens enter the skin causing the body's immune system to take over which would then cause the flare-ups. With her research rigor, she discovered and began to incorporate a very beneficial element called tocotrienol in her creams, something she noticed other available creams did not have. Even though its chemical properties may be hard to stabilise, and it is slightly more expensive, she knew that working with tocotrienol would be the way to move forward. She then founded Lipidware Sdn. Bhd. to produce Remdii creams. She has since filed two patents related to her research. Dr Lai with her colleagues have also created the Malaysian Eczema Support Community on Facebook, where it has reached Singaporean and even some European markets as well, proving that her Remdii products in combating skin conditions and eczema is a force to be reckoned with. This is not at all surprising since she has managed to help treat more than a thousand successful cases. Her creams, which have already reached an extraordinary level of success can be found in more than 500 pharmacies, 34 clinics and 2 hospitals in Malaysia. It has been very effective so much so she has even created other kinds of creams to suit a wide variety of needs.
pads.title: Remdii: An eczema remedy

pads.content:
SMART VENDING MACHINE FOR PACKAGE WASTE RECYCLING (SMARTBIN)
This is a joint effort with the local company Pakomak (https://www.pakomak.com.mk/) where our experts work on upgrading an off-the-shelf vending machine with control electronics to detect and classify specific package waste. This information is afterwards fed into an incentive-based system called ecoMac that can be used by markets to stimulate package waste recycling.
https://inno.feit.ukim.edu.mk/projects/
pads.title: SMART VENDING MACHINE FOR PACKAGE WASTE RECYCLING (SMARTBIN)

pads.content:
Bee Modular Box for Stingless Bee (Kelulut)
The Bee Modular Box for Kelulut (Stingless Bees) is an innovation by Dr Khairuddin Ramliy and his research team for modern bee farming. This innovation helps the community in Simpang Renggam, Johor, to have a decent living while ensuring the environment is protected. Based on a quadruple-helix model between UTM, the state government, corporate bodies and the local community, the innovation aims to produce high-quality products for the stingless bee honey market. The innovation is able to solve societal problems holistically. The community benefits from selling the honey and its by-products, as well as from tourist visits. The innovation has helped the community generate a sustainable and profitable income. The university team also provides training to the community regarding entrepreneurship to equip them with knowledge on branding, marketing and business management. This would allow the community to be independent in the long run. The modular design Dr Khairuddin and his team created a special kind of concrete to build the box without compromising the quality of the stingless bee honey. The special concrete ensures that honey can be produced in a safer and long-lasting environment for at least ten years as compared to the ones made from wood or normal concrete. The business model offered to the community also includes a contracted buy-back of the honey produced, through an external contractor.
pads.title: Bee Modular Box for Stingless Bee (Kelulut)

pads.content:
Drone technologies for delivery services
Alphaswift provides a unique service for industrial clients looking to adopt drone technologies: specialised UAS design and modification. The startup helps retrofit and modify drones from other brands to achieve higher performance or to complete other specialised tasks. The use of fossil fuels still dominates the aviation and air mobility industry. This in turn has resulted in the increase of the carbon dioxide emission, exacerbates air pollution and other greenhouse gases which further harms the environment. Alphaswift is able to deliver multi-functional UAS for use in light aviation, cargo and agricultural activities. Alphaswift drones have helped clients transport goods to hard-to-access locations such as remote towns in dire need of medical supplies, food, and water. Alphaswift UAS are also being used as crop sprayers in the agricultural sector, helping farmers and plantations spray fertilisers, pest-control chemicals, and other compounds across wide swathes of land while cutting down on man hours and machinery costs. These agricultural drones leverage artificial intelligence to fertilise plantations and farms incredibly efficiently, resulting in higher yields. Alphaswift drones, are customised to transport goods or spray crops without risking any harm to seedlings. A major part of all retrofitting and innovations undertaken by Alphaswift engineers is the payload consideration.
pads.title: Drone technologies for delivery services

pads.content:
Citizen science on native forest ecological restoration: "Restaura"
Collaborative project: Citizens participate in data collection and analysis. 
Overall goals: Create collaborative networks and connect different knowledge sources to promote the restoration of native forests. Study the phenology and standardization of Celtis tala employing collaborative tools within an open science framework. Specific goals: Learn about the different life cycles of the Tala (flowering, fructification, etc.) to plan when to collect seeds needed for the restoration projects. Determine the optimal planting date of Tala by conducting a collaborative experiment throughout its distribution in Argentina to locally adjust restoration strategies. Create collaborative tools for the restoration of native forests in different ecoregions through the replication of these activities with other species. Define the weak points of invasive exotic species in order to control them. 
Description of citizen participation: In the first part of the project, to learn about the different stages of the Tala's life cycle, the participants follow the same tree through its different stages of development, and report their results through a web app. In the second part, in order to determine the optimal planting date for the Tala, citizens simultaneously carry out a collaborative germination experiment in their homes or nurseries. In this context, monthly meetings are held in which preliminary results are informed and discussed and, in turn, participants help with the creation of future protocols. In future editions, in which stages 1 and 2 will be repeated, the aim is to let participants decide which species they want to continue working with according to the country's ecoregion. 
Time frame: 02/26/2021 - N/A.
Project leaders: Mariela Lacoretz. Institute of Ecology, Genetics, and Evolution of Buenos Aires (IEGEBA in Spanish)/National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET), Faculty of Exact and Natural Sciences (FCEN)/University of Buenos Aires (UBA). 
Contact information: Email: mariela.lacoretz@gmail.com Web: Www.restaura.com.ar Web app: www.restaura.com.ar/app/login.php Instagram: instagram.com/restaura.com.ar
pads.title: Citizen science on native forest ecological restoration: "Restaura"

pads.content:
Citizen science on home and community composting: "Composta Orgánicos"
Collaborative project: Citizens participate in data collection and analysis. 
Overall goals: To provide technical assistance and effective tools to overcome the barriers that citizens face in composting, and to encourage more and more people to participate in this experience. Specific goals: Composting: Organics examines the participant's profile who decides to compost their organic waste and gathers information about how they carry out this process, what challenges they face, and how they overcome them. It also suggests finding out why there are citizens who are not interested or find it difficult to compost, either at home or in the community. Composting: Organics aims at assessing the quality of the product developed (compost) by composters and, then, to determine its benefits. 
Description of citizen participation: Citizens answer a survey regarding the compost they produce, and then they are asked to bring samples of their finished compost for laboratory analysis. When the analyses are finished, they are invited to explain the findings, discuss them, and come up with solutions if there are any issues with the final product quality. This provides a foundation for sharing answers to common issues experienced by various urban composters. 
Time frame: 08/01/2021 - N/A 
Project leaders: Verónica Pierini, School of Agricultural Studies/University of Buenos Aires (UBA) María Semmartin, School of Agricultural Studies/UBA
Contact information: Email: pierini@agro.uba.ar Email: semmarti@agro.uba.ar Web: www.labciudadano.net/composta-organicos/
pads.title: Citizen science on home and community composting: "Composta Orgánicos"

pads.content:
ViaVii 
"Unique activities & experiences hosted by passionate people all over the world."
Source: Instagram
"By enabling “the era of people-to-people travels”, we aim to fulfill people’s desire to experience the world authentically. Whether you choose an experience only a drive away, or decide to travel across the globe, our diverse community of hosts offer experiences to suit every individual as unique as you are. We do that by providing travellers, wherever they may be, with a user-friendly online platform, that designs a tailored personalised travel experience based on budget and interest, while connecting them with delightful and talented people from around the world.
Some have labelled this new era as “the experience economy”, we are interpreting it as; people want to live their lives more fully, not by buying more things, but by collecting new experiences. In simple words, we’re putting the traveling experience in the hands of the traveller."
Source: https://viavii.com/page/about-us
pads.title: ViaVii

pads.content:
Sargassum Eating Worms for Composting
These worms were found within the sargassum deposits on the shoreline and have been used in vermicompost at a local farm. Sargassum has been used as part of the compost and the worms feed on and breakdown the sargassum which is then used as a plant fertilizer.
https://www.instagram.com/goodmoonfarmbvi/goodmoonfarm.com
pads.title: Sargassum Eating Worms for Composting

pads.content:
Glass Crusher
Glass crusher has been made from discarded metal material allowing glass to be crushed at source for example at bars, restaurants and hotels. Crushed glass can be used as aggregate in construction ( mixed with concrete - 'glasscrete'), in road construction including the base and surface coat for roadways, underlay for walking trails, walkways and driveways.
greenvi.org
pads.title: Glass Crusher

pads.content:
Vermiculture Derived Fertilizer
Local entrepreneur has partnered with greenscience.ca to use worms (vermiculture) to convert food waste and biodegradable industrial waste such as cardboard and paper into fertilizer. The fertilizer consists of worm waste excreted as the worms eat through the compost. This will be sold locally as an alternative to imported fertilizer which can help to regenerate soil. The waste will be brought to a central location in Tortola for processing and will start with hotel and restaurant food waste and then scale up to include household and yard waste. Contributor to green jobs in the Territory.
wastenot.com (under construction) greenscience.ca
pads.title: Vermiculture Derived Fertilizer

pads.content:
Furniture from Recycled Plastic
Utilizes grinded plastics from the national "We Recycle" Programme to make signature furniture pieces and recycle bins and other made to order items. Employees 2 local persons.
http://viplasticsrecycling.com/
pads.title: Furniture from Recycled Plastic

pads.content:
Eco Hike Tours
Started in 2020 during COVID-19 after internal lock-down restrictions were relaxed and a demand for outdoor activities. Catered initially to the local communities expanding to tourists when the borders reopened end of 2021. Business offers private hikes throughout the BVI, excursions to other islands and more recently coastal tours with the addition of kayaks and curated events e.g. bonfires using a contained portable bonfire pit. Promoted as an eco-friendly tour business: no plastics are used (all refreshments are served using reusable items such as mason jars and calabash bowls); existing trails are used and any trail enhancements are done with limited damage to surrounding vegetation; educational component encompassing history of trail and historical sites, discussion about native vegetation and wildlife and demonstrations of traditional agriculture practices (one tour includes visit to pineapple plantation).
https://www.hikebvi.com/
hikebvi.com
pads.title: Eco Hike Tours

pads.content:
Edible Sea Moss Product
Wildcrafted, sun-dried, and sustainably hand-harvested from the surrounding waters of the island of Grenada.
https://www.nowgrenada.com/2019/05/funding-needed-for-seamoss-cultivation-expansion/
https://www.alter8.com/products/sea-moss-grenada
pads.title: Edible Sea Moss Product

pads.content:
Patsari, portable efficient wood stove
The Patsari wood-burning stove, a metal-portable plate-type stove for rural use, which improves the use of fuel (wood and/or biomass), with a design of prefabricated pieces that allow its replacement and easy maintenance, it has a sealed comal that conducts the gases towards the chimney to avoid contamination inside the house. Done in a collaboration between UNAM, GIRA and the Clúster de Biocombustibles (Solid Biofuels Cluster). Currently registered for intellectual property at IMPI Registration Request, Exp. MX/u/2020/000262.
https://giraac.wordpress.com/2020/10/12/estufa-patsari-portatil-2/
pads.title: Patsari, portable efficient wood stove

pads.content:
Earth-IoT, agrotech platform for small and medium producers
Earth-IoT is an agrotech platform that allows farmers to track their harvest, save on production inputs and share information with agricultural and financial advisors for easy access. Unlike other foreign companies in the sector, the platform is designed to be inclusive of small and medium-sized producers, not just large producers, being cheaper and using simpler language, in addition to allowing access to recommendations and personalized follow-up.
https://www.earth-iot.com/
pads.title: Earth-IoT, agrotech platform for small and medium producers

pads.content:
Puzzle Energy de Boké
La solution énergétique par la fabrication d’un générateur électrique grâce à l’assemblage divers équipements et objets locaux. Cette solution énergétique est une initiative de monsieur N’Famara Touré, ingénieur mécanique et ses collaborateurs qui ont mis en place un réseau de production et de distribution d’électrique alternative qui dessert des centaines de PME et de familles à Boké. Le dispositif est composé de d’un moteur de batteuse agricole modifié (le modèle 1115) ; d’un système de refroidissement à l’aide de deux cuves d’eau et un circuit électrique monophasée. Avec une gestion en forme de parrainage et une desserte allant de 6H du matin à 18h avec une pause de 30mn entre 16 et 17H ; de sorte à combler les 24H contre seulement 8h par la compagnie d’électricité nationale EDG. Trois quartiers couverts, un centre de santé, un marché avec plus de 800 ménages abonnés. Le coût global de l’investissement est estimé à 20 000 000 Gnf ; le tout entretenu par 15 personnes directement.
pads.title: Puzzle Energy de Boké

pads.content:
Kizha Intregrate farm_Race Taureau

kizha Intregrate farm est une ferme intégré qui vise son autonomisation à travers une agriculture et un élevage vert et durable. La maitrise de l'eau est entre autres un facteur clé dans la réussite des activités agrosylvopastoral au Niger. Dans le souci de protection de l'environnement Kizha produit ses aliments bétails dans la ferme à partir de sa production fourragère qui se fait toute l'année grâce à un système d'irrigation utilisant l’énergie solaire mais aussi le gaz. La bouse des bétails est amassée dans une fosse fumière puis utilisé pour enrichir le sol nous utilisons aussi système de mulch aucun ENGRAI CHIMIQUE n'est utilisé et très prochainement l'installation d'un système de production de biogaz qui sera utilisé par le système d'irrigation, l'installation d'une unité de transformation fruitiers les déchets issus seront aussi utiliser pour l'enrichissement du sol. Kizha c'est la création d'emplois permanent, la sensibilisation des plus jeune dans la protection de l'enivrement à travers un agro business responsable et qui respecte l’environnement à travers une économie circulaire, Kizha se veut être une ferme complètement autonome écologique. La promotrice de cette ferme a innové dans la sélection des races de vache au Niger. C’est qui l’a value le second prix de la BAGRI meilleurs jeunes producteurs exposants / Elevage pour un taureau croisé Race Goudali x Race Holstein de la foire nationale du Niger de l’édition 2022 (7eme édition du Sahel Niger). Ce taureau est le fruit d’une insémination artificielle avec pour « père » les semences d’un mâle de race Holstein, fournies par le Programme National d’Amélioration Génétique (PNAG) et pour « mère » une femelle de race Goudali. La race Holstein est de robe pie (noir et blanc), la race Goudali est de robe blanc-gris, mais le descendant est tout noir. L’objectif de cette insémination est d’assurer une bonne production de lait et de viande, mais aussi d’avoir des sujets aptes à la traction animale. Ce taureau est âgé de 4 ans, 10 mois. Il a un poids estimé à 864 kg et une hauteur au garrot de 1,60 m. L’animal est bien dressé, docile. Il est utilisé pour le labour et peut labourer un hectare par jou
pads.title: Kizha Intregrate farm_Race Taureau

pads.content:
'OTA' contributes to local Fijian communities
When you book a holiday with TravelOnline you are making a difference to a local Fijian community. For every Fiji holiday package booked with this OTA, one is directly supporting social housing, education and welfare for Fijian families in need.
TravelOnline first partnered with Koroipita Project back in 2019, contributing FJ$12,000 towards building a new home for a Fiji family in need. As seen above, four members of their team traveled to Koroipita in rural Fiji to get involved by helping to build a new home for a Fijian family.
What is the "Holiday with Heart" concept?
TravelOnline was about to begin production when Covid hit and had to pause all operations since. Recently, the project has opened up again. TravelOnline customers arriving in Fiji will each receive an Eco Beach bag upon arrival. Bags are handmade with love with a special boutique operated by a group of women living in Koroipita - part of a social enterprise program.
What makes these eco bags unique?
All bags have the same turtle design made from recycled fabric offcuts! Sizes are made to fit beach towels and other holiday essentials. On top of that, inside each bag is a story card explaining the charity with a QR code - customers can choose to donate directly if they wish.
https://www.travelonline.com/news/holiday-with-heart
pads.title: 'OTA' contributes to local Fijian communities

pads.content:
Jaidee Eco-printing
Eco Printing is a technique of using leaves to dye and make patterns on the fabric. It is environmental friendly and affordable local material which is turned into wearable products.
https://www.facebook.com/JKlovehandiscraft
pads.title: Jaidee Eco-printing

pads.content:
Local Handmade Cork Wood Jewelry
Creation of sustainable materials which are expressed through jewelry. All materials are durable, lightweight and hypoallergenic in its finished form. Watty's Cork Cessories aims to be fully sustainable in the materials she uses and operates her business with eco-friendly principles.
https://www.instagram.com/wattys_attiresfj/
pads.title: Local Handmade Cork Wood Jewelry

pads.content:
Traditional Herbal Medicine
Warusi is a wild vine and a natural herbal remedy for debility especially fatigue muscle pain, diabetes, hypertensions, lameya, cold and flu, cleaning the body from toxic fluid, knee pain, tiredness, headaches, cancer impotency, cleans the uterus, prevents blood clots among many other ailments. 
Warusi is brewed here in spring water for 4-6 hours over an open fire using firewood in a Bombay pot. Both the leaves and vines are brewed together in order to extract the juices. The pot is sitting on top of an outdoor concrete block/stone stovetop
Warusi has to sit overnight to cool and the next day it is packed into bottles that their clients have over time provided the sellers with.
One of the workers with a sackload of Warusi. Currently, the business is looking into setting up an organic farm of this herbal juice. For the time being, the worker goes into the forest and collects them since Warusi grows wild and in abundance.
https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100084816056592
pads.title: Traditional Herbal Medicine

pads.content:
Citizen Science on bee colony monitoring
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection. 
Overall goal: Monitor the loss of bee colonies in Argentina. Specific goal: Measure the mortality rate of honey and stingless bee colonies in Argentina and understand the causes behind it to help to reverse the situation or alleviate this problem. 
Description of citizen participation: A national survey only of beekeepers and meliponiculturists is conducted in person or online (website, email, social media, press media, and beekeeping magazines) to record bee colony losses. This survey is based on internationally standardized methods involving voluntary participation, a national network of beekeepers, a questionnaire, and diverse promotion strategies. Estimates and statistical analyses of colony losses depend on the participation of producers, without which it is not possible to study the mortality causes, nor to provide recommendations for reducing mortality that can inform decision-making for the sector. Each participant has to answer 35 questions about three topics: (i) Bee handling (number of beehives, type of honey harvesting, bee genetics, etc.) (ii) Presence of bio-aggressors (disease symptoms and identification, etc.) (iii) Colony loss rate (winter and summer colony losses). 
Time frame: 04/01/2016 - N/A. 
Project leaders: • Fabrice Requier, Institut de Recherche pour le Développement (French National Research Institute for Sustainable Development). • Florencia Riafrecha.
Contact information: Email: requierf@gmail.com Web: solatina.org/temas-de-estudio/monitoreo/ Facebook of Sociedad Latinoamericana de Investigación en Abejas (SOLATINA): facebook.com/SoLatInA2017
pads.title: Citizen Science on bee colony monitoring

pads.content:
Citizen science on collaborative platform of Performing Arts: "NODOS"
Collaborative project: Citizens participate in data collection and analysis
Overall goals: Promote, create, and preserve a thorough collaborative knowledge base of performing acts, artists, cultural groups and spaces, plays, seasons, and festivals, among other events in the province of Buenos Aires. Specific goals: Build thorough and dynamic knowledge of artists, cultural groups and spaces, plays, seasons, and festivals in the province of Buenos Aires, among other events. This knowledge is created by the input of the platform users. Contribute to the Intangible Cultural Heritage of the Province of Buenos Aires, allowing to obtain firsthand and fully updated information not available in other resources
Description of citizen participation: Through their own productions, people involved in the Performing Arts scene write posts, upload information, and edit collaboratively articles on plays, performers, actors, dancers, groups of artists, and all kinds of information relating to the Performing Arts. 
Time frame: 02/2016 - N/A.
Project leaders: Mariana del Mármol, Institute for Research in Humanities and Social Sciences (IdIHCS)/National University of La Plata (UNLP)-National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET). Mariana Sáez, Escuela de Teatro de La Plata [La Plata School of Theater](ETLP in Spanish). Fashion business creates first breastfeeding-friendly clothing line
'Style Maya' is a locally owned clothing business that specifically targets breastfeeding mothers. The clothing line also targets breast cancer patients as well because it is tailored to provide comfort and confidence to women in these situations.
What is the purpose of your business? The owner Cynthia Cebujano, wishes to use her talent and skill to empower mothers to boost their confidence and also provide convenience and comfort in their lives as they carry out their responsibilities. Also, her fashion line is made from environmentally friendly materials and is durable enough to avoid being discarded; she uses her newfound innovation to provide a means of income for women and convenience to those recovering in hospitals etc.

pads.content:
Citizen science on amphibian monitoring and biological research: Los anfibios de la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires
Contributory project: It is designed by scientists, and citizens participate in data collection.
Objective: 
Overall goal: 
Make a record and inventory of the amphibian species living in the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires through citizen participation, helping the community get close to nature and becoming a potential management tool for environments identified as important sites for amphibians. 
Specific goals: 
Promote citizen participation in research projects to enhance the value of the amphibian fauna in the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires and surrounding areas. 
Identify the important sites for amphibian conservation in the City of Buenos Aires. 
Promote and combine the inventory-making and monitoring of amphibians at the important sites previously identified. 
Description of citizen participation: Anyone can upload records (photo or audio) which will be validated by the project's technical team and other users from the community, using a user profile in the iNaturalist (Argentinat) citizen science platform. The project leaders will upload these records when the citizens cannot do it on their own. Citizens should send them to the SAVE THE FROGS! Buenos Aires email. Through these records, contact is established with local citizens at places where a systematic field survey is needed, encouraging the rest of the citizens to monitor records and observe phenomena of interest (disappearance of water bodies or green spaces, etc.) as well as provide training in the territory to enhance and increase the number of records in the platform. Moreover, upon request of the relevant permissions, the photos or audio recordings sent to the project will be used to share educational content through the project’s social media, thus creating feedback. 
Time frame: 03/14/2017 - N/A.
Project leaders: 
Natalia Maruscak, SAVE THE FROGS! Buenos Aires. 
Rocío Rudak, SAVE THE FROGS! Buenos Aires. 
Contact information: 
Email: buenosaires@savethefrogs.com ; savethefrogs.bsas@gmail.com

#Switzerlan – jet fuel that is 100% carbon-neutral
Scientists have developed a way to make carbon-neutral jet fuel for hard-to-electrify heavy transport using sunlight and air.
The fuels release as much carbon dioxide (CO2) when combusted as they absorb from the atmosphere when produced, so no additional CO2 emissions are generated.
The new process could further efforts to combat climate change by decarbonizing transport sectors like aviation, which is responsible for almost 3% of all human-made carbon dioxide emissions, shipping and road haulage.

Car with a solar refrigerator
Ms. Eliso Ghviniashvili
Gurjaani, Georgia. Email: gbgassociation@gmail.com
N/A
Nowadays, the cultivation of berry gardens (blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, strawberries) is very popular in Georgia. Berries are mostly harvested in the hot season, and due to high temperatures, they quickly develop and begin to rot if cooling measures are not taken very quickly. In Georgia, the cold chain is not developed in such a way that the picked berries can be delivered to the quick cooling refrigerator in the desired time. By introducing the refrigerator cars developed using our concept for the berry gardens, our project offers a solution to this issue. In our hybrid concept, the required energy for cooling is obtained from solar panels mounted on the vehicle. The system also has accumulators that can be charged from the network. Using our system, farmers will solve the following problems: - The harvested berry immediately enters the cold room, and no time is wasted - We can bring the product directly to the markets by car, and it no longer needs to be transferred to another transport; - The lack of electricity in the garden is not a challenge anymore, the cooling system works on solar energy; - Service costs are getting cheaper - During the night, it is possible to have it connected to the normal electricity grid and use it as a refrigerator-storage.

pads.content:
Geothermal energy equipment
Mr. Solomon Ioramashvili
Tbilisi, Georgia. Email: Solomon.ioramashvili@gmail.com 
No
The purpose of the invention is to make geothermal energy generation available anywhere on Earth and to increase the efficiency of existing technologies. Existing technologies have two main limiting factors: the insufficiently high temperature of the geothermal source on the ground surface and the small volume of the hydrothermal flow. The number of sources of satisfactory indicators is limited and mainly localized in the places where tectonic plates join. That's why, despite its obvious advantages over all other types of energy generation, geothermal energy generation can't take its share of the total energy generation. We decided to transfer the heat exchange process from the ground surface to the depth of the well (to use the natural temperature gradient) and to install the so-called "Impulse Accelerator". As a result, we would have constant access to a limitless supply of geothermal energy anywhere the earth's crust could be drilled or an existing well used. In the long run, nonrenewable energies will be replaced, and greenhouse gas emissions will be significantly reduced. The presented geothermal energy device contains upward (3) and downward (4) pipes fit as a continuous (joined) circuit from the ground surface (2) into the borehole (1). On the downward pipe (4), on the ground surface (2), the pump (5) is installed. The upward (3) and downward (4) pipes in the depth of the borehole (1) are connected to the heat exchanger (6). Whole surface of pipes to the heat exchanger covered by heat-insulating material. The end of the upward (3) pipe on the ground surface (2) is directed to the condensation type steam turbine (7), which is connected to the electric generator (8). The power device contains an exhaust steam condenser (9) from a steam turbine (7), as well as the pipe for resupply of condensate to the pump (5). The end of the upward (3) pipe is equipped with a manageable valve (10) with its management (including possibly computer) device (not shown on the figures). The manageable valve (10) can be of different types, including electromagnetic or electromechanical types and can have the ability to be managed with a close-open duration / frequency regulation. Between this manageable valve (10) and the steam turbine (7), the steam nozzle is placed (11), which is performed as a “Laval nozzle.” The downward pipe (4) is equipped with a few (at least one) non-return valve (12) that allows the thermal agent pumped into the pipe to flow only in one direction (to the heat exchanger(6)). To prevent the loss of thermal water or/and atomization of associated harmful gases into the atmosphere, the borehole (1) is closed with a protective lid (13)
EUR 5M per country
TRL 8
N/A
Yes
In Georgia – Lack of scientific and technical base necessary for prototyping. Lack of connection with relevant scientific communities in other countries.

Lanchkhuti, Georgia
Email: ninoglonti77@gmail.com
No
The invention's goal is to create and commercialize a solar-powered beeswax heater and hot water receiver in one combined device. Beeswax can be melted with water, steam, or in a heating chamber, which are all expensive and environmentally harmful technologies that produce low-quality wax. 
Solar melted wax is of high quality, partially sterile due to exposure to ultraviolet and infrared rays of the sun. Solar energy allows for year-round access to hot water, regardless of the ambient temperature on sunny days.
Our solar-powered device operates in hot water mode all year long - on sunny days - whereas wax melting is primarily seasonal - spring, summer, and autumn. The load of the device for wax melting is determined by the size of the beehive. The process of melting the wax and heating the water does not interfere with each other, but when the melting of the wax is finished, the efficiency of the water heater increases. Therefore, hot water can be used for different purposes.
The presented equipment saves 350-400 GEL annually for a beehive consisting of 100 bee families, taking into account all components.
There are at least 14,074 beekeepers in Georgia, and at least 5,000 of them will use the above. The received economic benefit is impressive and amounts to 1,750,000 GEL.
N/A
TRL 8
N/A
The invention's efficiency is defined by one axiom: it literally does not use any energy to melt the wax and produce hot water. The amount of melted wax and hot water received is solely determined by the device's size. It should be mentioned that if we regulate the temperature with additional small energy, we can create a device that can for instance heat the building and dry fruits
N/A
N/A
DIY / open source
Yes
Product
Available in market

Vunilagi Book Club (VBC) is a learning platform that promotes book reading in rural communities in and around Fiji. pads.content:
World's Biggest Baby Incubator that carries 10 babies in one go
Ugandan Local Apprentice/Artisan innovators, led by now the Late Engineer Nsamba Christopher (may he rest in eternal peace), who was the founder and director of the African Space Research Program, developed the largest and technologically advanced baby incubator in the world, they claim. Before his demise in July 2022 to diabetes, Christopher and his colleagues had completed working on the second baby incubator and both machines were deployed in Hospitals in Kawempe and Mukono. 

This incubator has saved thousands of babies. The innovators were inspired by the worrying infant mortality rate in Uganda which was standing at 44.745 deaths per 1000 live births in 2019. Currently the rate has dropped to 40.564 deaths per 1000 live births in 2022. Perhaps these 2 machines have contributed to the reduction of the infant mortality rate.

This AI supported incubator understands and can make decisions in case of an emergency when medical personnel are not close by.

It carries 10 babies at once, in 10 different chambers.
Some babies get brain injuries (Twitches) during birth, and they end up with continuously moving body parts, when it is not the baby doing it, for example, the baby can have the hand move back and forth continuously; this can cause the baby to become so tired and die (Twitches) This machine has a technology which fixes damaged brain cells for neonates.
Some babies delay to breath upon delivery and get dead brain cells, if they survive, they become mentally disabled. This machine has a technology which stops brain cells from dying off if the baby is loaded as quickly as possible.

Normally, oxygen is delivered to babies through tubes which they bypass over the nose, this machine can deliver oxygen wirelessly to the baby, without any tubes attached to the nose. Nsamba discovered some babies are really irritated by this conventional way of oxygen delivery, so SAVANT X delivers oxygen wirelessly.

The machine is loaded with a server customized through custom-made software to be able to read the 1087 sensors deployed on board, to understand, interpret them and call out decisions accordingly, incase this machine is confused about a decision to take, it will be able to communicate to the international paediatric network, for further advice in case no local medical personnel can save a baby, and when it is trying to do so by itself.
pads.title: World's Biggest Baby Incubator that carries 10 babies in one go

pads.content:
Use of fan to reduce energy consumption
Arunima Malik, Coen Bongers, Bonnie McBain.
University of Sydney
Yes, in Australia
This solution applies to cities around the world who use air conditioners to cope with heat and which demand high electricity consumption, dependent on fossil fuels and thus increase emissions. The study found that moving air with electric fans in combination to air conditioning could serve as a sustainable alternative, reducing air conditioner use and associated greenhouse gas emissions without sacrificing thermal comfort. A simple existing technology that is accessible to millions of people every day can be combined with air conditioning to potentially provide a sustainable low-tech cooling solution. Results show that the use of fans in combination with air conditioners provides a way of maintaining thermal comfort while reducing greenhouse gas emissions: 76% reduction in energy use (from 5592 GWh to 1344 GWh) and associated greenhouse gas emissions (from 5091 kilotonnes to 1208 kilotonnes).This practice can be extended with a campaign 
Practically 0- the cost of an electric fan
It has been tested and results show a 76% of reduction in energy use.
Published but dissemination is needed so population adopts this practice.
76% reduction in energy use (from 5592 GWh to 1344 GWh) and associated greenhouse gas emissions (from 5091 kilotonnes to 1208 kilotonnes).
https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lanplh/article/PIIS2542-5196(22)00042-0/fulltext#%20
DIY / open source
It doesn ́t require much training, other than putting in practice, measuring electricity consumption reduction to extend the practice in those countries or cities that rely on air conditioning.
Product

pads.content:
Ecomena, Recycle Plastic Waste into Plastic Lumber

The Problem:
The Solution:
Ecomena is developing a plastic waste recycling line to help reduce plastic waste in Iraq by turning plastic waste into sustainable, eco-friendly and long-lasting Plastic Lumber that uses in different applications such as residential, commercial and structural. In addition, it’s a great alternative to wood and PVC. Ecomena will be the first to market that serves locally and our product provides improved materials to replace wood and PVC; it’s water-proof, anti-chemical, anti-fungal, weather resistance, durable and affordable. Our mission is to solve one of the most important problems in Iraq which is waste management. We are committed to help reduce the amount of plastic waste by using it as a raw material for manufacturing Plastic Lumber. We believe that this can be achieved by implementing an innovative approach at every step of production process in order to lower costs while increasing quality control standards.
Ecomena will be the right solution for the plastic waste problem for several reasons:
-It’s an opportunity to take action and deal with plastic waste and use it as a raw material for
our product. This will help in reducing the plastic waste and that will be an important step
towards reducing pollution
-Provide great product made from recycling plastic waste is helpful in encouraging people to
recycle and that will make it easier for us to address other environmental concerns
-Using our product is an opportunity for people to take action on their environmental beliefs
pads.title: Ecomena, Recycle Plastic Waste into Plastic Lumber

pads.content:
Healthy habits for healthy environment
The vast majority of the citizens of Skopje live in areas that do not meet the minimum air quality standards, mainly caused by heavy vehicle use. Skopje citizens also face disruptive public transport with lack of real time monitoring tools in most of the areas. Walking and cycling as methods of commuting have the potential to decrease vehicle use, thus can be attained by diverting motorized commuting for distance of 2 km to walking; and for distance of 5 km to bicycle commuting, by promoting healthy and active lifestyle. Namely, daily walking and cycling have various health benefits, including cardiovascular and muscular endurance, body weight control, lowered blood pressure etc. In addition, other benefits include low costs, energy efficiency, time saving during the peak period of urban traffic, and reduced noise pollution. The overall aim regarding fluctuating urban mobility is to encourage and motivate individuals (aged 18 - 65) to practice efficient mobility i.e. to walk or to use pedal or/electric bicycles, whilst altering their daily activity patterns in terms of costs, energy and environmental conservation. We influenced behavioral changes in terms of mobility by focusing on test group consisted of 50 citizens, which perceptions and behaviors were be measured before, during and after the challenges. How we did it? - Our innovative approach for citizens’ mobilization was with one of the highly rated sport/activity application-STRAVA App. The application is used to measure people’s sports activities - hiking, running, walking, cycling, swimming etc. It uses GPS, thus gives precise calculations on the speed and distance, and additionally, it calculates statistical data over periods of time (daily, weekly, monthly). If connected with smart watch, the app goes deeper in the statistics and calculates the stress level, heartbeat, pulse ox and more. It offers users to join group challenges but it also allows creation of custom made challenges - the option that we used. We created 2 group challenges – one for walking (up to 2 km daily), other for cycling (up to 6 km daily) and randomized the test group members into them. All group participants could see who reached the challenge goal and beyond, thus there was strong competitiveness among them. After the challenges ended, we calculated and checked whether all participants reached the goals. The ones that did not were disqualified, while the others were rewarded with sport equipment. The ones that went beyond the challenge got an extra reward. The pre and post research showed that people change daily habits with small incentives. 92% of the test group walking - finished the challenge, from which 65% will continue walking that distance on daily basis. 84% of the test group cycling finished the challenge, from which 61% will continue this practice on daily basis. People get extra motivation if a target is set and got competitive when are part of a bigger group. In addition, they were motivated by their engagement in the policy making process. This action also encapsulated participatory approach by providing comments and suggestions on improving the quality of urban mobility infrastructure and sending them to the relevant authorities.
http://www.crpm.org.mk
pads.title: Healthy habits for healthy environment
